Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites San Diego - Great Location”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites in April 2012 and found that this hotel was very good. It was in close proximity to the beach, legoland, Seaworld and the San Diego Zoo. The room although small was clean and had a kitchenette which was very useful. The continental breakfast was great. My kids especially enjoyed the waffles. Next time we visit San Deigo we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Excellent property, close to everything. I stayed 70 days on business and still can give that rating. Great for families and centrally located, the Liberty Station area is like you are at a resort. My daughters came out to visit over Spring Break and the wife came out twice--we did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: 412JW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. Was originally concerned about the noise due to closeness of the airport but turned out to be very quiet!! The hotel is hidden behind a shopping plaza. You have to actually turn into the plaza to get to the hotel. Love the walking path along the water! I did a 30-45 min walk couple days. Great breakfast bar as usually! The bed is a little too soft for me. The only low rating I give is to the front desk. I called in the morning for early check-in. The room was not ready so the front desk asked for a phone number so they can call me when the room is ready. They never called. At check-in , I asked why no one call and let me know the room was ready? No answer. I reserved a King Studio room but I entered a King 1-bedroom. I called the front desk to ensure they gave me the correct room so they won't charge me extra. Then, the front desk tells me it is a free upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Marisa0615
Reviews.Content: We (me, my husband and our 2.5 year old son) stayed here March 25th through the 30th, and I have nothing but good things to say about this property. We stayed in the south building in a studio suite. We had a king sized bed and a pull out sofa bed where our son slept. The room had a full (well, almost full - no oven) kitchen with all the dishes and glassware we needed. The room and the whole property were clean and nicely decorated. The hotel provided breakfast and dinner on the weeknights during our stay. We only ate the dinner twice, but both times the food was decent. It was nice to have that option so we didn't have to go out and spend money on dinner at a restaurant. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, as it was close to all of the sites we'd planned on seeing during our trip (Sea World, the Zoo, USS Midway and the beach) and there were many stores (Trader Joe's, VONS, Target) close by so that we could pick up anything we needed. There is also a walking path along the water with a huge park right behind the property. The park had a really nice playground with a toddler friendly area that our son enjoyed playing on. Lastly, even though the hotel was very close to the airport, we hardly heard any airplane noise and we even slept with our window open at night. The hotel staff was friendly and the service was great! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a few nightspot a family of five”
Reviews.Author: MonkTravellers
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel it's hard to beat. No frills in the rooms but it can be difficult to find decent or inexpensive hotels for 5. We got the 2 bedroom suites. Morning breakfast and even small dinners are included. There's a few restaurants to walk to- we chose the pizza/ sports bar and had pub food - pretty good. Starbucks, Mexican, subway also right there. Seaworld is why we came and that's only about 15 minutes away so perfect base for touring around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lowl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights ( convention). Not in a center of San Diego, but very close to the airport and short drive to Convention Center. Very convenient for any trips around that area. Many good restaurants within walking distance or short drive. Front desk very accommodating. Our initially assign room not to our liking, but after calling friont desk, we were moved to a very nice suite, The breakfast more than adequate . Facility very clean. Parking spaces always available. In summary - very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryScarlett
Reviews.Content: Our family visited San Diego over spring break and after booking our room last October, we found it wasn't working for us. The front desk staff were very accommodating and were able to move us to a 2 BR 2 BA suite the next day. Loved the daily breakfast and how pleasant the staff was, considering the hotel was very full. Great location to the airport and attractions. Despite closeness to the airport, the noise wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you want a 2 bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: BEENTHEREDONETHAT6
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites was a very well maintained, clean, friendly property. It is close to Old Town, the San Diego Zoo, and the Embarcadero. The hotel had a convenient breakfast each day and each room had a full kitchen that you could stock from the local Vons located just blocks away. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms were very clean. It was a great place for a family of five or six to stay because of the availability of two bedroom suites. As other travelers have pointed out the first floor is not too desirable, because you feel like you are in the middle of the parking lot, but the higher floors are nice and you can get a glimpse of the water from most balconies. We moved from a first floor room to a third floor room when it became available and the hotel made the move very easy by moving all of our belongings for us and having the new key ready at the desk when we returned from sightseeing. The staff are very accommodating and helpful. One of the desk staff spent about 10 minutes giving me the low down on the different beaches in the San Diego area. His advice was spot on. It was especially helpful that he mentioned that Blacks Beach is a nude beach when I asked which beach in La Jolla would be best. That would have been a little hard to explain to the kids... The Cove with happy sunning seals and sea lions was a much better fit. We would return to this Homewood Suites. Only advise is to try to make your room preferences known when you make your reservation to avoid having to room hop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to airport...good base for San Diego sights”
Reviews.Author: Bobo185
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites on March 17th, 2012. The hotel is located in a shopping plaza that has many dining options within walking distance. This allowed us to return our rental car a day early and walk to dinner. We took advantage of the free airport shuttle in the morning to get us to the airport. They run every half hour, but you do need to reserve a spot during the heavy departure times. There is a little business center that has two computers for general use and they allow free printing. This comes in handy to check in for you flights and print your boarding passes. There is also free wifi in the public areas and the rooms. There is free breakfast, but we could not take advantage because we had an early flight. There is a pool and hot tub…some folks were enjoying them when we walked by, but it was pretty cold the day we were there so we passed on that. We checked out there two small exercise rooms and they had good equipment. Nobody was using them when we were there. The room was great. We were in 361 which overlooked the basketball court and a nicely landscaped courtyard area. We had a little balcony and enjoyed having the window open for fresh air in the evening. There is a full kitchen with pots, pans, and utensils. There was a full sized refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, and coffee maker. They give you some packets of coffee, sugar, tea, microwave popcorn, salt, and pepper. You need to bring everything else. There was a dining table, a writing desk, a couch, and a large bed. There was plenty of drawer and bathroom space for our stuff and also plenty of outlets to charge our ever growing list of gadgets. There was an outside deck for relaxing on our floor also. The area is nice to walk around. You are right by the water, but not the ocean itself. It is a waterway for boats and you can walk along the banks. There is a 1/3 scale navy ship in the parking lot called the USS Recruit. It was used to train new Navy recruits in shipboard procedures. It holds the distinction of being the only commissioned Naval vessel to never reach the water. There are plenty of dining options within a short walk I saw pizza, Subway, Starbucks, a Greek place, and a Thai place. We had dinner at the Thai place, Spices Bay Thai Kitchen, and really enjoyed our meal and the friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay and would use this hotel again, especially on our arrival or departure nights. The price of a suite was close to the price of regular rooms in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: KristinaTXNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business-related meeting recently with my husband. The meeting was inland a ways, but we chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and its location close to the airport, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a shopping center, and easy walk to a good pizza place/beergarden/sports bar called Oggi's, or a Subway, and some other places I can't remember. This was a fairly typical Homewood Suites in terms of the room, which was roomy, clean and comfortable and had many amenities we never had the need to use, and the great free hot breakfast. We were on the first floor, and could hear the people over us more than we would have liked, but t was not a big problem. What set it apart a bit was that the hotel grounds are especially lovely. It is right on the water (not the ocean, but still), beautifully landscaped, and with lots of paths....in fact, the San Diego half-marathon went right by, on hotel grounds. The in-room wifi worked well. There were many families staying there, and I would take the kids there in a heartbeat. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: minnemommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights over President's Day weekend with our family of six in a two-bedroom two-bath room. The room is typical of other Homewood Suites: comfortable, well-laid out, spacious. We especially appreciate the kitchen when we tire of restaurant food while traveling. Service is with a smile and questions/problems are dealt with promptly. Anyone who's stayed in a Homewood Suites before will enjoy this location, especially with its outdoor patios and waterfront location. The variety of restaurants within a very short walk is also a plus. I was pleasantly surprised that although the hotel is close to the airport, noise from planes was not an issue, even on the fourth floor. My rating is four stars rather than five for two reasons: 1) The price seems high in comparison to other Homewood Suites we've stayed at, and 2) You pay the same price whether you get a waterfront view or not. I'd pay extra for a view of the water rather than the parking lot if I were guaranteed to get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmego
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend in San Diego. We always choose a Hilton of some sort, being a Gold Member perks are usually great. We choose this hotel due to location. We were situated around everything. Great view of the ocean and downtown. Check-in was easy, we received a nice one bedroom suite. Perfect, we could of stayed there longer. Definetely big enough for four (2 adults/2children). Nice balcony to sit and look at ocean. Two seperate rooms, so if we needed space or the kids did, you had somewhere to go (two tv's helped too). Nice and clean a few steps above a standard hotel room. Large kitchen if you wanted to cook (hello vacation).... Nice pool area (although to cold for us to use it). They even have a bbq area where you could probably make smores. Breakfast in the morning was nice, crowded but nice. This hotel provides many options for breakfast. People tend to forget manners while getting their food, but not my problem, as long as it wasn't my children. I would stay here again. A+ for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this property!!”
Reviews.Author: mccabe4u
Reviews.Content: Love the Homewood Suites Liberty Station. Great Family Hotel. We love it, love it! Great location, Good size rooms, clean, great staff, Great Happy Hour, Fabulous Breakfast and the kids love the sports court, walking trail, Pool table and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent night-stop after long flight”
Reviews.Author: Seniorsup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a 11 hour flight from UK, had prebooked a 1 bedroom suite at senior rate which was very reasonable. On day before went on to website to pre check-in to room ( a good feature that you can do with Homewood Suites) to find that we had been upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite - very nice. Check-in staff very pleasant and although we had arrived just after the free dinner service they did offer to stay open for us - we were a bit too tired. Room was very comfortable very good beds and a big selection of different types of pillows. Complimentary breakfast the next morning was good and fresh and set us up well for the days drive ahead. If we were to stay in San Diego again for a longer period I would definitely stay here - location is great 5 minutes from the airport and only 10 minutes from downtown, Seaworld, and Old Town. There are a few restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: navychick
Reviews.Content: Fabulous room with a cute kitchen!! The marble is so nice.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Drakarula
Reviews.Content: I went the week of Presidents week with my family, 2 kids 8 and 10 year old. We had a 2 bedroom suite, which was perfect for our needs. Full kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 3 flat screen tv's and 2 full bathrooms. The rooms were spotless, which shows that they care about the conditions that the guests stay in. The location can't be better. It is centrally located where nothing is far away. There are places to eat within a short drive as well as a Trader Joes supermarket as well. The hotel includes full breakfast that my entire family enjoyed. They have a nice pool table and basketball court. The pool is heated which my kids very much enjoyed. The hotel offers free wifi,which worked well as well as free parking. Fall out of bed and your at the airport in less than 5 min. Overall I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Fantastic-Repeat Stay”
Reviews.Author: barryvo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Homewood Suites including this one in the past. This place is one of my favorite hotels to stay as they always make me feel like at home. I’m currently on an extended stay and am blown away by how the staff continues to go above and beyond to ensure guests have a great stay. The place is in fantastic condition and the staff performs maintenance and upkeep constantly. One night the pool table got destroyed and it was replaced two days later. The bbq grills are cleaned everyday and the staff will light them for you if needed and provided utensils. Every encounter I have with the staff has been very pleasant. My luggage was stored upon arrival while they were preparing my room. I went to get it and could not carry it all and went to make another trip when the lady from the front desk jumped in and brought it to me. The cleaning team is very efficient and pretty stealthy. I reluctantly single out people when the entire staff is great. In this case I have to say the entire food team went above and beyond to accommodate. One example is the eggs were not good for a long time because the way they were prepared (steamed). One of the new employees took the initiative to fry them in a pan and add a little garnish. They were like a totally different product and were very delicious. I spoke to him and found out he actually went to the Courtyard hotel next door (opened by the same company) to use their pan. Marten and Stephanie who work the dinner/happy hour are very friendly and quite efficient. They do an excellent job keeping things stocked and cleaned and are always friendly. The hotel is a great location as others have noted. All the amenities of this place make it a great deal but the STAFF makes this place special. They are very proud of their Trip Advisor Award and continually strive to please everyone. It is very obvious the management and entire team are focused on delivering a great hotel stay for all guests! One side note, guests are allowed to use the fitness center next door afterhours since the ones here are only open from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. The Courtyard next door is also nice and they have a restaurant and bar which attract a good crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: raleighgrl
Reviews.Content: We had great service, nice breakfasts, easy laundry facilities, and a perfect room for a family. We enjoyed the central location and free parking. The place was fully booked when we were there, and everything still went smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “wished I stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: chopstick1
Reviews.Content: this place was fantastic, not to mention convenient to most attractions, stores, and freeways. it's comparable to being in a mini resort, without paying the resort prices. I don't think I can add on to what's already posted except I wished I would have stayed here longer!

Reviews.Title: “A joy...”
Reviews.Author: PanamaPaul
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days with my family in a 2-bedroom suite. The room was very clean and well equipped. It is just a few minutes from the airport, and since we got in late at night, we were in our beds in no time. The staff is amiable and you get all you can expect from a Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “a really great experience”
Reviews.Author: ktheider
Reviews.Content: There's a lot of positive things about this place. First is location -- it's extremely convenient to the airport and most of the attractions as well. There is also a Trader Joes and Vons within less than a half mile -- almost walking distance. The location on the esplanade park and walkway is wonderful, with bayfront/estuary views and a huge walking/biking pathway right outside the door and a huge park there too. Its in a quiet safe neighborhood with the only sound disturbances being the planes taking off, because of the proximity to the airport. The rooms have a nice almost full kitchen -- full size fridge, dishwasher, microwave, 2 burner range and no oven. There is a nice large granite type counter area that is very convenient for food preparation and a small dining table with 2 chairs in our one bedroom unit. There's a nice little balcony with one chair on it -- for a little reading or coffee in the sunshine. There are two LG flatscreen TVs -- one in the living room and one in the bedroom that are quite adequate. The fold out couch in the living room is smallish and the cushions are showing some age related compression, but it was still comfortable. There's a worktable with ergonomic chair and easy web access stuff and outlets that are efficient and comfortable. The bed linens are soft and comfortable, there are a wide variety of pillows available. The toilet paper is Cottonelle -- so it's nice and soft, not the single ply sandpaper stuff that many places are trying to offer now, and the toiletries are very nice Neutrogena products. The business center computers are antiquated and slow and pretty much only useful for printing out boarding passes. The laundry is large and bright with plenty of machines that are modern and do a good job. My husband enjoyed the exercise equipment that included a treadmill, elliptical, stationary bike, free weights and a weight machine - drinking fountains and a TV were available in the workout room. The gardens and outdoor areas were extensive, well landscaped and maintained.. There was quite a variety of outdoor seating available, with many areas having gas fireplaces in the seating areas. There were several outdoor grills available for guest use that were modern, clean and ready to go. The breakfast and dinner offerings are adequate - but not gourmet. You get hot filling food, but it's just kind of average. Standard make your own waffles, bagels, english muffins, etc, - three "hot offerings" which usually are eggs, sausage and tater tots -- the best of which is the tater tots, and a fruit and yogurt bar that has canned peaches, canned mandarins, cottage cheese and yogurt, and some fresh melon chunks. Evening offerings are a nice enough salad bar, and a hot offering that has been during our stay - edible, but mostly because it's included. There's drinkable wine and beer and with the nice pool table and fireplace area, it offers a nice opportunity to unwind after the day. I found the staff to be friendly and responsive, even when our flight was delayed. The cleaning staff is polite, unobtrusive and efficient. The hotel offers very good rates, with nice discounts for government and AAA and they participate in the HH points program. It is a family oriented hotel, so there will be kids at breakfast, in the pool, etc.... and, of course, their behavior is up to their parents ... but we had no problem with noise. Overall - the best place to stay in SanDiego if you're not looking for night life, excitement etc. If you want a great convenient location, nice facilities, large room, kitchen facilities, and the open air experience -- with just a few minutes to the zoo, SeaWorld, Balboa park, airport and downtown -- no parking fees, no internet fees, and a safe place where you and your kids can stretch out and run around.... This one's got it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect....”
Reviews.Author: painted_daisies
Reviews.Content: This was an ideal place for our San Diego vacation. The hotel is in a beautifully developed small mixed residential/cultural/small business neighborhood that was formerly a naval training station. You are in the city without the noise and traffic of an urban area. Many amenities within easy (1/2 mile) walking distance, including a great little supermarket (Von's); a good selection of restaurants, cafes. Everything else we wanted to do--Zoo, Balboa Park, Coronado, beaches--was in easy (10-15 min) driving distance. We had a king suite in the south building, facing the water, with a small balcony. I'd highly recommend the latter two options. There are two L shaped buildings--the north building surrounds the pool and the south building the basketball court. Suite was beautiful, large, very clean, nicely decorated, with an open plan, overlooking the boat channel and walking path. There is a large outdoor terrace at each building. The laundry was a welcome amenity and had front & top loading washer options. Our room was quiet and we were never bothered by noise from other guests or rooms on either side. Yes, there are planes overhead, but we did not find this an issue at the hotel. There are a LOT of planes in San Diego, and we found everywhere we went, every beach, every park, every attraction, had planes overhead. Some great things I didn't expect--there is a (free!) shopping service....just fill out a slip with what you need & hotel staff will pick it up. The evening 'receptions' (M-Th) were full dinners (we enjoyed chicken teriyaki; roast chicken; taco night--skipped the salisbury steak night) and surprisingly good. The breakfast was a cut above the usual hotel fare in both quality and quantity. My daughter, a hotel waffle connoisseur, found the 'make your own' here the best she's had. Staff was unfailingly wonderful. Everyone we encountered had a pleasant greeting. Everyone seemed happy and all were helpful, from the shuttle driver to housekeeping and everyone in between. If you have any forgotten necessities, the front desk will send them up free of charge (we forgot to pack a razor; they brought up some with a small can of shave cream, gratis, even though you could buy similar items in their small pantry/store). The attention to our comfort and overall friendliness were outstanding and really helped make our stay an outstanding experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tgr415
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Homewood Suites Liberty Station. Will always stay here while in San Diego. Everything was great, so good that the other than in the dining room for dinner and breakfast, I did not see the staff at all. No problems, spent about 10 seconds at the front desk to pick up keys, 5 seconds to check out! Great location, convenient to downtown and other attractions. Clean comfortable room with lots of space. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place, unhelpful staff... it could have been great.”
Reviews.Author: LaurentBeijing
Reviews.Content: As many review mention, it is a family place. So if you are not fond of kids running, screaming, etc... chose another place. We asked for a top floor, and were told there was no availability (we checked in at 4pm...). 3 nights out of 4, we had to bear the noise of whoever running, jumping, in the room above us. Called the front desk who casually replied they would look into it. Nothing happened. And they boast a "guaranteed satisfaction" offer that was never presented to me. If it had, I would have complained that for USD 175++, we could have received better treatment. Location is perfect. Staff is hardly polite and certainly no helpful. Maybe because we are not Americans, so for them, a one-time guest not worth much.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a few days with kids”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBriggs
Reviews.Content: We spend a weekend here on the tail end of a week in southern California with our kids, aged 3 & 5. The property is great in that it is centrally located (assuming you have a car - a given in San Diego), rooms have mini-kitchens (refrigerator, 2-burner stove, sink, coffee maker), ours had a little balcony (most rooms seem to, if not all),and the staff if very helpful. They have both kinds of suites, what I would call 'real suites' (door between rooms) and 'fake suites' (no door between rooms, but still called a suite). We booked a 'real' one so we could watch TV after the kids went to sleep. The rooms run a bit on the small size (e.g, a bit downzided from an Embassy Suites, but you are paying less, too, so no problem), but they are not overly cramped. Rooms were immaculately clean. They have a nice breakfast spread of cereals, breads, scrambled eggs, sausages, and a homemade waffle station. Our kids loved it. There is a strip mall (Liberty Station) with a Starbucks and several restaurants that are less than a 100 yards away, and the airport is 5 minutes away. They have an airport shuttle. One tip: They hotel is actually 3 buildings, and they keep the doors locked, so always have your card-key with you! All in all, a great kid-friendly spot for a few days that is centrally located to whatever you might do in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay but ask for top floor”
Reviews.Author: jaynic
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It was a good size and had 2 bathrooms. On our first night we had a terrrible night's sleep as the people above us were jumping and making lots of noise all night. It may have been kids playing the XBox. We were moved to a top floor room and given 2 tubs of icecream to compensate. Our next 3 nights were great. Brekfast had a good choice and we enjoyed dinner there on the nights it was served. Great pulled pork sandwiches. There are a few other restaurants close by- pizza at Oggie's was good and Starbucks handy for morning coffee. This hotel had the best laundry room out of everywhere we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Beautiful service”
Reviews.Author: Rachel C
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a gorgeous location, fantastic breakfast and extremely clean rooms. Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. We would definately choose this hotel- great value for your money and an all-around fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amusaint
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of it's central location, good reviews, and free breakfast. Check in was easy and we loved our room. We really liked how convenient the laundry room was and how quiet the pool area was. We never made it to dinner, but the menu sounded tasty. Breakfast was standard hotel fare, but we did enjoy it. We went to Old Town twice because it was so close and there was so much to see. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “You will like this one!”
Reviews.Author: PYT13
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel has won a Trip Adviser award but it still amazed me! Outstanding in every respect, but the location was the best bit. Lovely spot directly on the water, with nice walks in all directions. Close to a good food supermarket, about five minutes drive away so you can buy and cook food if you want to. But good restaurants within a couple of hundred yards too. Check out the outdoor terrace on third floor of South building. We sat out there for sunset and to watch planes land ... It also has a lovely view of downtown and lights sparkling across the water! Would definitely recommend both for business travellers and families.

Reviews.Title: “best place ot stay with family”
Reviews.Author: cmreilly
Reviews.Content: excellent room- huge, kitchen - wow breakfast - though a battle to get a chair for breakfast - fab. free week dya dinners staff really friendly have a tourist notice board with lastest events posted pool great landscaping great; lovely outdoor seating all great happy to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bells5544
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, good restaurant & free parking. Booked about 6 months in advance and got a much better rate than about a month out (when we wanted to extend our stay by a night)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bulldog64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights jan 3-7 2012. What a wonderful property in very convenient location. Great rooms with full kitchen & fridge, Great breakfast with menu changes every day, evening reception on weeknights is really dinner for free. Changing menu, 2 hours complimentary Wine & Beer. Outside seating area with gas fireplace, Very nice pool & jacuzzi. front desk staff great answering lots of questions, complimentary airport shuttle. If you like to walk this is the place for you, great walking along water the length of liberty station & we walked to old town (about 45 min at brisk pace) Also walked to waterfront downtown (about 1 &1/2 hours along waters edge). Bus runs back from downtown & lets you off close to hotel. Great location at reasonable price for touring San Diego Area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Hoovergab
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 friends visited The Homewood Suites over New Year's weekend. We had a great experience! I called the morning of our arrival to request 1) room near our friends 2)both rooms having a bay view. They said that they couldn't promise anything because it was a busy weekend, but that they would do their best. Sure enough - our rooms were great. We were 2 doors down from our friends, and we had a corner room with the living room window looking over the courtyard and the bedroom window with a clear view of the bay. Our friends were given a handicap room but wanted to have a bathtub so requested to move. They were very quick to help them move, so they lost their view - but ended up closer to us. And they ended up hanging out in our room most of the time so they didn't miss out on much. Their only complaint about their room was that they didn't get ESPN... but we did. They had a studio suite so I don't know if that makes a difference, but the guy was a little bummed...very minor issue though. It's in a great location, right on a bay, and there are plenty of eating places (Starbucks, Subway, Oggis Pizza) within walking distance, and then just a 3 minute drive away other food and grocery stores (Trader Joes, Vons, Five Guys Burgers). We were in a 1 bedroom suite and it was perfect. The decorations felt fresh and new. And everything was clean and in great condition. There was a flat screen TV in the living room and in the bedroom. The shower and toilet are separated from the sink which is a factor I really appreciate in a hotel. It's nice to be able to do my make-up or hair while someone else can use the shower or toilet. The bed was a little too soft for our preferences - but that's just a matter of personal opinion. Having the one-bedroom suite is great though because we could close the door on the mess and still have our friends over. The kitchen was well stocked (plates, cups, bowls, mixing bowls, flatware, etc) and had a full size fridge. There was a 2 burner stove, dishwasher and microwave as well. (housekeeping washed out dishes while we were out - which was also great!) Only thing we missed was a blender for mixed drinks but again... minor, minor issue. The breakfast was definitely better than other included breakfasts I've been to. We were only there for two mornings but each morning was different. The first morning was eggs, bacon and tater tots, and the second morning was chorizo, regular eggs, tortillas and sausage. Both mornings they also had 4 waffle stations going, cinnamon rolls, fresh and canned fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese, oatmeal and cereal. Also had a few juice and coffee options. Ultimately - very satisfying. We weren't there for any of the free dinners, but they post a menu on your fridge and options looked great! I used the running path one morning that goes along the water and it was well-maintained and pretty. I also used the fitness room (there are 2 but I only used the one in the south building) and it was clean, up to date and well stocked (a few hand weights, bench, 2 treadmills, 1 eliptical, an ab thing, several exercise balls, some medicine balls, a step, yoga mat and probably other things) We also didn't get a chance to use it, but their outdoor patio with a fire pit also looked very inviting. The pool and jacuzzi were also great. It was unseasonably warm weather for January so we were actually able to lay out by the pool and get some sun. They had plenty of towels and great, comfy lounge chairs. You need to use your room key-card to access the pool and any of the main buildings which I appreciate. It just adds another sense of safety and comfort. Ultimately we could not have asked for anything more in a hotel. It was a great price (especially for San Diego) and the inclusions (free parking, free wi-fi, free breakfast, free week night dinner) was all just above and beyond any other hotel in the area. When I was first looking for a hotel I was considering the gaslamp district so we'd be "close to action" but am so so so glad we went with the Homewood Suites. It was maybe a 10 minute drive to any of the places we wanted to go - and being by the water at such a great location was absolutely perfect. I wouldn't consider staying at any other hotel in San Diego ever again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, only good things to say”
Reviews.Author: mattnvick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights December 30th through January 7th. There were 5 of us (2 adults 3 kids) the first 2 nights we were in a king bed suite as all the 2 beds were gone. We got a rollaway bed for the 2nd night. On the day we moved to the 2 bedroom suite the staff told us to just pack up our stuff and leave it all in the room and they would transfer it over for us. We went out for the day and the room was ready with all our stuff in when we returned including all the stuff from the fridge and freezer and the rollaway bed. There was no charge for the rollaway during the entire stay. The suites are spacious, the maid service excellent. We sat out each morning in the courtyard to eat breakfast. Its 5 minutes from the airport so you hear the planes going over when you are o/s but no noise from them in the rooms. Breakfast was more than adequate, always eggs and some kind of meat, waffles, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, cinammon buns and muffins, tea, coffee, juice. Dinner 4 nights a week the menu is posted on the fridge in your room was varied and always they were filling up when things got low. It saved us a ton of money that we could then spend on trips. Beer and wine were complimentary. We used the barbecues in the courtyard one night, the pool was great and so was the hot tub. Staff were extremely friendly and i had no complaints about anything. Used the business centre to check emails and would definitely stay here again. The only tip i would say is if you arrive late by plane and want a transfer you need to use a regular call box or cell phone and call the hotel using the local number to arrange for pick up. It stops doing regular trips around 11.

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret your choice”
Reviews.Author: CaramutJane
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites are in a lovely location on a river very close to the harbour. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is a pleasant walking track right next to the hotel, as well as a number of restaurants in the same lot. There is even a Starbucks open until 10pm. Our stay wasnt cheap - we paid approx $285 a night for a two bedroom suite - but the hotel provided everything we needed. The kids and the adults enjoyed the outdoor heated pool and spa. Breakfast was more than satisfactory. There was hot porridge, eggs and bacon, cereal, lots of fruit, fresh rolls and best of all, make your own waffles. Our suite was comfortable and quiet. We made use of the fold-out sofa since there were five of us. (I dont like paying extra for rollaway beds). There were three TVs so we could all watch what we wanted to (it's hard to go out partying when you have three kids). I really appreciate the full kitchen, the free wifi and included breakfast. There is lots of free parking as well. We used the business centre to check in and print out our flights - also free. It is a roughly 20 minute drive to the San Diego Zoo and 30 plus minutes to Legoland at Carlsbad - both absolutely worth a visit. We were very happy with our stay at the Homewood Suites (San Diego Airport).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic .. Do not miss it!!”
Reviews.Author: Ebtehal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for six days during holidays. My husband, my kids, and I had great time!! The staff are super helpful and friendly.. The breakfast and dinner was lovely and lots of options. Finally, I will defiantly recommend it to family and friends. <3

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for our family.”
Reviews.Author: Cowsonarockyhillside
Reviews.Content: Super-clean, really comfortable beds, quiet and friendly. Near to great views, a variety of restaurants and sites. Totally pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Nessgraham
Reviews.Content: I am incredibly disappointed with my stay so far, we arrived yesterday after an 8 hour car ride and were checked in by a very uncaring, unsmiling girl at the front desk who said only one of my rooms was ready - at 3pm?! That's unacceptable. I reserved a room with a bay view and got first floor, looking at the pool. I would not recommend this hotel - terrible service

Reviews.Title: “Great for our family”
Reviews.Author: GaryMel
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 were very happy with the hotel. The 2 bedroom suite worked great for us! Although the breakfast was not great in my opinion, all in all the hotel's condition and location were great.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from a Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: RBinVABeach
Reviews.Content: I always stay in a Homewood Suites on business travel - always free parking, free Internet, and the Manager's Reception (dinner and drinks) Monday - Thursday nights is a bonus! This location is 5 minutes from San Diego International airport, and has a lot of what you'd need nearby - restaurants in the same lot and a shopping center a few blocks over. They have a nice waterfront walk that helped to get the kinks out after the long flight (and a Massage Envy next door if you need). Navy Federal and USAA ATMs on site. Breakfast is free, too, and they have hot oatmeal with granola and raisins, make your own waffles, eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurt and juices. By far the BEST value. I didn't use the gym, pool, or jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation, in a good position”
Reviews.Author: MatteoMarinaio
Reviews.Content: As a big chain resort, the accomodation is simply perfect in every detail: spacious and functional suite (we'd a studio), a lot of amenities, very good breakfast and location in the Liberty area park. Similar to all the structures like this, the only defect is that it's quite "cold" and lacks of originality. Generally speaking, the Liberty Centre is pretty as a park and relax area, but not so good in terms of shopping and life (differently from what is publicized).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family trip”
Reviews.Author: Isra-Caltraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Liberty Station Homewood Suites 4 days in early Dec 2011 on a mixed business/family trip (2 adults, 2 teenage kids). The hotel is located in a pleasant area (condos/navy base/close to the airport) which appeared safe. Several restaurants within walking distance. Plenty of free parking. 7-13 minutes from the freeway, depending on traffic. The hotel is newer. Free internet was great. Hotel seems popular with families. A suite type hotel is the way to go when traveling with the family, more elbow room. We chose the two room suite, which was plenty of room for my two teenagers. It had a small kitchen, which can come in handy, but we ate out most of the time. The free daily breakfasts are simple but very convenient. The complimentary weekday (M-Thur) dinners are better suited for families with children under the age of 6, very basic. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Front desk staff was nice and helpful. I would definitely return for another family stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here. Still great.”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit. Still a great hotel. Internet, parking, breakfast, quiet location. We'll stay here again, and again. Our favorite place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JCJCJ
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Homewood Suites, San Diego in December. We stayed with our 2 children (4 & 2) and stayed in a nice size 1 king bed suite. Room was equipped with microwave, toaster, coffee machine and dishwasher. Complimentary breakfast, internet and parking made the stay perfect. A short walk down the inlet to a playground and the main liberty station shops/restaurants. Ideal for families. Didn't use the pool because it was a little cold, but it looked nice. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Recommend”
Reviews.Author: fourwearytravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August 2011 to cap of our 2 week Southern California adventure. It was a good decision and I would recommend this hotel to other families who need a reasonably priced home base while exploring San Diego. We chose a 2 bedroom suite in order to have a little room to spread out after 8 nights of togetherness in one hotel room. Our suite was immaculate and everything was in working order. I didn't notice any noise from other guests. Housekeeping staff was wonderful and very friendly ... I left a few dishes in the sink one morning and they were washed when I returned. The dinner and breakfast were a huge plus ... the food was not gourmet, but it was filling, replenished constantly, and the hot stuff was hot while the cold stuff was cold. I was really impressed with how clean and well staffed the area was at meal times. Definately a money and time saver for families. The pool, while small, was nicely maintained with pretty lanscaping and plenty of fresh towels available. The front desk staff was very helpful ... I was not thrilled with our original ground floor assignment and we were immediately moved to a top floor room. When we needed directions to a beach ... the staff was ready with a pre-printed map and a recommendation for our needs. My only complaint about this place was the laundry room ... way too small for the amount of people trying to wash clothes and beach towels! Laundry was a comptetitve sport!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: minnesotans4
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Homewood Suites hotel before and now I am sold! This property is located along the bay and is centrally located. The hotel is 1 mile from the airport, 2 miles from an In-N-Out, 2 miles from Ralph's grocery store, 10 minute drive from Balboa Park, 10 minute drive to Seaport Village and 2 miles from C-Level Restaurant, one of our favorite restaurants. Parking is free as well as internet in the room. Breakfast is free which consists of eggs, sausage, oatmeal, bagels, fruit, waffles, juices, coffee. The property is very well maintained and the rooms are large. We stayed in Room 303 which overlooked the bay. It was a king size suite with a double pull out sofa. The kitchen is complete with a coffee maker, full size refrigerator, dishwasher, and a cooktop. The staff is wonderful and I would highly recommend this hotel. We would definitely come back. There is a great exercise room as well as an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: WorkPlayHard
Reviews.Content: Clean family friendly room with a beautiful fully equipped mini kitchen. Awesome customer service. Hot daily breakfast. Sea World and the SD Zoo is within 15 mins drive. Free parking accomodation. Great location, near restaurants and stores. The place has bbq area, basketball court, gym, laundry room, spa, pool, etc. Recommended for extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, and they found our lost iPod”
Reviews.Author: TrixieBelle
Reviews.Content: This location caters to the Naval/military post nearby. It is just past the San Diego airport (toward the water side) next to a strip mall with a Starbucks, USAA ATM, Oggies Brewery, Sushi, Pizza, Mexican food, and a massage place. The USS Neversail model is also parked next to the hotel. They have a hot tub, a pool, and outdoor BBQ and fireplace areas. Million dollar bay views, a great jogging trail near the hotel, one bedroom suites, clean, quiet and comfortable.. what more could anyone ask for? Free breakfast? They have that, too. This is not, however, a budget hotel. We paid almost $200 a night for our stay. My husband also accidentally left his iPod by the pool, and it was promptly returned to us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pennywilliams
Reviews.Content: We (family of 3) came to this hotel after checking out of another unsatisfactory resort, and it was such a lovely change. We had a one bedroom suite with a view on the 4th floor. Great size room, with a full kitchen (dishwasher, microwave, hotplate) and a supermarket nearby so we could stock up. It is in a complex with many restaurants and bars within walking distance and the drive to downtown and the gaslamp district is quick and pleasant (along the harbour). Comfortable beds (including the fold out sofa in the lounge room), good heating/cooling system, a desk as well as a table which I liked. Free breakfast was great, the pool was heated, the internet was fast and free and there was ample free parking. This is sort of like staying in a serviced apartment, the staff pretty much just leave you be unless you need something which is really nice. Highly recommended, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Staff Not Overly Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: LLP2
Reviews.Content: Made reservations several months in advance for a 2 bedroom suite. Requested a waterfront view & received an email back indicating my request was noted. Arrived early and was told to come back at 4:00pm. Arrived back at 4:00pm & asked if my suite with the waterfront view was ready. They said it was ready but it was not a waterfront view - it was a parking lot view. I said I had requested a waterfront view & they acknowledged that request was on the reservation but they could not accommodate that request. When I spoke to the assistant manager, he gave an excuse that there was no waterfront view suites available. There are three other sides to the building that would have provided a much nicer view than a parking lot, but apparently they were not interested in making my stay a bit more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Mary Anne W
Reviews.Content: Visited San Diego (from NJ) for sister's wedding. Cannot express enough how pleased we were with our stay at Homewood Suites San Diego Airport - Liberty Station. Suite was clean and very large for a family. Complimentary breakfast and dinner buffets were terrific...tasty and very convenient, saving plenty in meal expenses. The hotel staff was friendly and very accommodating. Location was great...near airport, however, plane noise was no issue whatsoever. Had other family members staying next door at the Marriott, but after our glowing commentary about Homewood Suites, they plan to stay here next time. Will definitely be back next time we visit San Diego. Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: birdwoman56
Reviews.Content: This hotels location is great. You can go to all parts of the city with very little travel time. We had the 2 bedroom suite. I wished they could have put 2 beds in one of the bedrooms, instead of 1 in both. This makes it a lot easier for 3 women traveling together than a rollway of sleeper sofa.(They aren't very comfortable). The breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful neighborhood, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen3317
Reviews.Content: Even though we are San Diego locals, we love this place for a little destressing "staycation". This was our third trip to this property and this time we sprung for one of the "bay view suites". Previously we have stayed in the king one bedroom suites, which are actually nicer than the bay view suite we just tried. We had a tiny view of the bay from our bedroom window. View was not worth the many extra dollars paid. Otherwise this is a beautiful property, well maintained, with great walking paths in the immediate area, stores and restaurants within walking distance, and convenient to many sightseeing places in San Diego. Its location near the airport is great, with a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Charlyn73
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by how convenient a location this was for out trip. While we were in San Diego we visited Cabrillo National Monument and did the Old San Diego Town Trolley tour. We were literally minutes from all of our planned attractions and just down the street from the airport. We couldn't have picked a better location. The rooms were large and the layout was great. They have a nice outdoor courtyard to enjoy the evening weather. They have a large breakfast dining area for the included hot continental breakfast. There was plenty of parking and the staff was very friendly. Would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: soldiergirl_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, close to everything we wanted to see. The room was just the right size for a couple. You would need more of a separation if there were more people. The kitchen had everything we needed when we decided to eat in, but the hotel provided breakfast every morning. The best part was the waffle station. You could eat in or out on the patio. After breakfast we would go to the pool room and shoot a game or 2. We also enjoyed their free light evening meals Mon-Thurs along with all the beer, wine and lemonaid you wanted to drink. The room was always cleaned with very comfortable beds. Only one TV. We never got in the pool but the hot tub was very nice. They also had a basketball court and a gym. FREE parking!! which is rare in that area. Front desk very helpful and friendly. I would stay there again and again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: okden
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this property and were very happy with our choice. This was our first time staying at this location. Property is centrally located to attractions in the area. The room suited our needs perfectly and was comfortable to come "home" to after a long day. The breakfast was a great way to start off the day, simple yet satisfying. The property itself was clean well cared for. We did experience a bit of a problem with the hot water in the north bldg however as experienced traveler's I understand "things" happen and the hotel staff did acknowledge there was a problem. The personnel we encountered were pleasant and helped us with our questions and needs. We would return to HWS-Liberty Station if our travels bring us back to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Made life easy”
Reviews.Author: PerZee
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights after a similar period in Anaheim. Proved to be an excellent base from which to explore San Diego and a relaxing contrast to our Anaheim accommodations (HoJo). The hotel is well located if you've got a car but wouldn't be practical without one and the 300 odd acres that comprise the Liberty Station project is a lovely mix of parks, water and developed space. Check in was swift and easy and the suite spacious and clean as a whistle. Very practical set-up, though another one of those hotels with a decent size kitchen area but without a toaster. Did the toaster manufacturers offend someone in the hotels caper at some stage? The Darling Wife rated the gym as pleasant and knucklehead free and the kids enjoyed the (outside but heated) pool. The adjacent spa helped with my increasingly sore back and was hot enough to build up a mild sweat. Th complimentary breakfast is useful (if somewhat rudimentary) as were the "welcome home dinners. Quiet observation of the waffle bar confirmed suspicions as to root cause of the rate of diabetes in the US. Having been on the road with two kids for a week, a bright, clean laundry room was a welcome sight and a boon for the traveller with the long itinerary. Only con for me was that the beds were very soft and by day three I as waking up with a nasty back ache. Overall, a great base for a family with wheels to base themselves to look around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice vacation stay for our family with small kids”
Reviews.Author: trilinearmipmap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a 2 bedroom suite. Our kids are aged 3 to 12. Pros: spacious suites, quite good buffet breakfast every day, good buffet dinner 4 nights per week, pool table, barbecues, free parking, good location convenient to various tourist attractions. Each bedroom as well as the living room had a large flatscreen TV. Cons: the pool is a little on the small side. No oven in the room, just a two burner stove, a microwave and fridge. Overall we were quite happy with our stay. We definitely saved several hundred dollars on food with the free breakfasts and dinners. Despite being near the airport we did not hear any plane noise. There is a room with a pool table as well as an outdoor courtyard area with dining tables to eat outside. I was happy in my dealings with the staff, they were quite pleasant and helpful each time I needed anything. For those traveling with a family this is definitely a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great family or business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MyZenworks
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton diamond member, I see a lot of hotels around the world. This hotel is one of the best hotel stays in my 16 years of traveling. Sure, it is not to be compared to other Hilton hotel brands since "Homewood" suites are designed for long-term stays. The breakfast and more importantly, the dinners (buffet style) are very good. The outdoor area is very inviting as well as functional. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The ease of parking and access to the San Diego area make this hotel a winner

Reviews.Title: “Really roomy hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: BettyboopAustralia
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the trip advisor reviews and the affordability, I also look for hotels with a king size bed. I have not been disappointed, the rooms are large, three flat screen televisions, two bedroom and two bathroom. The kids have their own space and so do we, and I can tell you after 10 hours of bickering I am happy for them to be in another room. I only gave this hotel a 4 because it is a little out of town but only about $15.00 in a taxi and if you take the trolly tour they will collect you from the hotel. The breakfast is ok and we are slowly getting used to American meals, the dinner from Monday to Thursday is not gourmet, but hey, there was plenty to eat and saved us $50.00 per day. It is very clean and well appointed, they front desk keeps out of our hair, answers out questions, so happy with that. Housekeeping is outstanding, and I love that.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy3x
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable by todays standards. Kayla and Rachel were outstanding. This was my famlies first vacation and they saw to it that my 2 1/2 year old had the time of his life. They even sent a gift of coloring books and ducks to the room for him. The breakfast and dinner made it so easy. We will definitely be coming back. Thank you for the wonderful customer service, clean room, great food and kind ways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friedly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ETontheroad
Reviews.Content: The location is close to downtown and the Airport. Staff is very professional and friendly, parking is at no cost (A plus in the SD area) walk able to NTC Liberty Station restaurants and grocery stores for long stays.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica C
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations! Polite front desk staff - check in took less than 4 minutes. The suite was very clean and did not have that weird hotel smell. The full size kitchen made traveling with small kids so much easier and the complimentary breakfast was amazing! My family really felt at home. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at Homewood in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tempoman
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in San Diego. Suites are nice, people are friendly, and free breakfast and supper is handy when you do not want to go out. Close to everything and staff is great for helping you out. Whenever I am in San Diego business or pleasure I always stay at this property. I like the Homewood Suites and this property is very well run.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, and amenities”
Reviews.Author: KingHuskey
Reviews.Content: This is a newer Homewood Suites in a great location only minutes from the airport, downtown, and the harbor but has virtually no air traffic noise. The hotel has complimentary dinner Mon-Thurs, nice touch. The breakfast is awesome, everything's fresh and tastes great. The grounds feel very resort like and there are great walking/jogging trails just steps outside the hotel. If this is hotel is an option for you ... take it! Great property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Property!”
Reviews.Author: IntlSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights in July (Saturday-Wednesday). We booked one of the two bedroom suites. I am currently a Hilton HHonors Gold member. Location: Finding the hotel was pretty easy, as it was located in Liberty Station, a relatively new development west of the airport. There are a lot of walking/jogging paths and green areas right next to the hotel. The harbor itself is also close by. There are a cluster of restaurants across from the hotel parking lot. If you go for a drive, you can get to a Trader Joe's and Vons in about 2-3 minutes. SeaWorld and Mission Beach are about 10 minutes away. Check-In: We arrived a bit early (3:45pm), so our room was not ready yet. On that note, we were able to check-in online the day before and pick the exact room that we wanted. We opted for a 4th floor (high floor) room in the south building. Hilton Gold HHonors benefits included 2 bottles of water and a 4-pack of Milano cookies. Not bad. The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. Room: The general condition of the hotel is excellent. It appears to have been built in the past few years. Our particular two bedroom suite had nice furnishings. One room had a king bed and the other had a queen bed. Each bedroom had its own full bathroom. The king bedroom had access to an outdoor balcony with a good view facing north. During our stay, we could see the nightly fireworks at SeaWorld from our room. In between the two bedrooms was a living room/kitchen area. There was plenty of space here. Some of the previous reviews mention the loud air conditioner. Yes, I can see what they mean when it cycles on/off. However, a good trick is to keep the a/c on "fan" mode. This keeps the fan blower on constantly, so when the compressor actually kicks in, it won't be as noticeable. Amenities: The property has a pool by the north building and a sport court (basketball court) by the south building. The gym was small but had your normal range of equipment. There are laundry facilities. We had the free breakfast buffet each morning. It was generally a good combination of hot and cold foods. Typical choices included scrambled eggs, meat (sausage or bacon), hash browns, waffles, breads, fruit, cereals, etc. We tried the complimentary dinner on one of the nights. The menu for that night consisted of orange chicken (drumsticks/thighs cooked in an orange sauce) with salad and couscous on the side. Rolls and beverages (wine, lemonade, water) were available. It wasn't anything spectacular, but it was free. Service: The housekeeping staff did a great job and we had no issues. The other staff in the hotel are friendly and helpful. There appears to be a hotel shuttle van that goes to/from the airport. Overall we had a wonderful experience here. The price was a little on the high side, but it was the summer season, so it was expected. We will definitely be back if we visit San Diego in the future.

Reviews.Title: “For the value, nothing comes close”
Reviews.Author: scwatkins
Reviews.Content: Normally, for the rates we've paid at the Homewood Suites for the past 3 years, we'd expect to get something far less clean, pleasant, and professional. The rooms are impeccable. The grounds are gorgeous - right on the water with a beautiful esplanade for incredibly relaxing strolls. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The pool is always crystal clear and clean. The included breakfasts (7 days/wk) and dinners (4 nights/wk) are a great way to save even more money. Full kitchens in the rooms. Location is perfect - beautiful and serene, not noisy or in a sketchy part of town, but within 5-10 minutes of downtown, balboa, mission bay, etc... 2 minutes from the airport. We've stayed here for the past 3 years with our family of five and have zero complaints. We stay for 3 weeks at a time and have never had a problem. We checked in late this year and so got the slim-Pickens on rooms, but the manager was very understanding and helped us find a bay-view room above the pool the very next morning. One night the people across the hall were being noisy until 1am, so I called the front desk because my kids couldnt sleep. Within 5 minutes, two security guards were the escorting people out and there wasn't another peep. We've thought of staying at another hotel/resort in San Diego, just to mix things up, so that the kids don't get bored with the same place year after year. But everything else I check either costs at least twice as much or is not nearly as nice and clean and perfectly located. You can't go wrong here! For your money, there is not a better value in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a family trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Michel G
Reviews.Content: Brand new place located 10mn from Downtown San Diego. Ideal for families. very large and comfortable suites. Very quiet and clean area. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Place to Stay...Customer Service is Job 1”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler84
Reviews.Content: I had picked this hotel after reading many, many, many reviews on TripAdvisor. It exceeded all my expectations. The staff really make customers their top priority and show it. The front staff was outstanding and always cheerful and pleasant... Kayla made sure we got the best available suite when we arrived (top floor, corner suite with a balcony and only one room next to ours....very quiet), Rachael helped me when I couldn't log onto the PC in the business center and Sydney helped us find all the best places to visit in San Diego. The breakfasts were top notch and it varied from day to day. All the pots of bacon, eggs, and sausage were always topped off even at the end of the meal time (6 am to 9:30am). There were 4 waffle makers with bottles of chilled whipcream, cinnamon and icing sugar shakers, and strawberry topping standing ready through out breakfast. The all day coffee and tea bar was constantly filled - even late into the night. The dinners were top caliber and varied from orange chicken on our first day, to meatloaf on our second day, to BBQ Pork on our third day. The red and white bottles were replaced before as soon as they went empty. The food counters were positioned perfectly so we never waited more than a minute in line. Our room was the double suite (two rooms, kitchen, and sitting room). It had stainless steel appliances (fridge, stove, and dish washer), fully stocked cupboard (plates, cups, spoons, knives, forks, and even a colander). There was even a complimentary goody basket with microwave popcorn and other snacks. When we asked for an extra cot...and asked how much the extra charge was going to be...it was free...and it arrived within 10 minutes. Duncan (the general manager) was always buzzing around the eating area at breakfast time and was greeting customers and even busing tables. On our way out, he gave my 5 year old and 7 year old Homewood suites friz-bees and drinking cups. The grounds and facilities were constantly being groomed and cared for by staff. I'm a bit obsessive about laundry...this facility had 4 sets of washers and dryers and even a bill changer in the laundry room. And the laundry room was huge! If you are visiting San Diego...this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a spacious room”
Reviews.Author: MDKT
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed in a King Studio suite. The room was spacious and clean. I had been concerned about airport noise, but there was none. The location of the hotel was very convenient to downtown San Diego and the beaches. I would recommend getting a room at the end of a hallway, as the walls are pretty thin and we could hear voices from next door. Generally, this wasn't a problem since our neighbors weren't home much. The breakfasts were tasty with a good variety of foods, the bed was very comfortable and the staff was quite friendly. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice, as did the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: vaggy1
Reviews.Content: This was our second hotel in a couple of days - the suite was a good size, clean and in good condition. The complimentary dinner and breakfast went down well - recommended

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Seed4
Reviews.Content: This is a really mixed review. We stayed here twice, once at the start and once at the end of our US trip and overall, we liked the property. The staff were friendly, check in was quick, airport pickup was easy the time we needed it and there was plenty of parking when we had a car. We had a one bedroom suite and the kids were happy on the fold out sofa. The "complimentary" breakfast was fantastic, everyone loved it and the one night we were there for the "free" dinner, we found it more than adequate for a hungry family. Now to the negatives. There were no tea towels in our room the first time but the big issue was when we took a clean towel out of the pile to dry our child after the bath, it had dried faeces on it! While the front desk person apologised, we felt it needed to be dealt with with more than just an apology. This was a pretty gross thing to find. The other issue was when we checked in the second time,late, very tired after a long cross country flight, our door lock didn't work and they had to send a technician to fix it. We just wanted to put the kids to sleep and changing our room would have been a quicker solution at this late point in the evening (maybe there weren't any rooms?). It was fixed but did take probably 45 minutes from the time we arrived in our room by which time it was extremely late for our poor children. So, all in all, a mixed stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: YoungDreams
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Homewood Suites, 2 adults and 2 kids, in May 2010. Taken a while to get around to writing our review! We found Homewood Suites to be clean and quiet. Having read the odd comment on tripadvisor about airport noise, we didnt find it an issue, even slept with the window open. We did have noisy neighbours a couple of nights and after complaining to front desk staff this was dealt with immediately. Service was always fantastic. Breakfast every morning was good. We had a one bedroom suite which was lovely. Only negative comment about the room would be there was no door between the bedroom and lounge which made it difficult at night with kids. The kids slept in the lounge on the pullout couch and a stretcher bed. Our advise would be if staying here with kids try and book a 2 bedroom suite. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we had more time to explore this property and area”
Reviews.Author: gy820
Reviews.Content: an overnight need brought us to this property. so many amenities that we did not get to try out. overlooking the waterway towards the airport, the view from the balcony was terrific. the staff were pleasant and efficient. the room was comfy and clean. if there was anything that showed is that the cabinetry were worn. otherwise just an excellent plan to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Meere
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in late July. Spotless room. Great location right near airport. Used the U.S.S. Recruit as a landmark every time we returned. Pretty cool. No noticeable airport noise. We loved morning breakfast, especially making giant waffles. Quick and easy to do, with fruit & whipped cream- they were delicious! Never managed to get back for dinner in evening, though it was pretty well attended. Salad & entree each night (except Fri & weekends) . Menu for week posted on refrigerator in room. Loved walking around the grounds. Restaurants starting to pop up on the property, that's a plus also. Found a quiet little patio up on 3rd floor on last night there. Would have liked to have drinks up there. Maybe next time?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Trip”
Reviews.Author: thurst27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for an evening during a trip to San Diego to see family and friends. The service that was present at this hotel was exceptional. Check in was quick and nice. The front desk staff was welcoming. When I woke up the next morning for breakfast I decided to have a waffle. Like many places they had a make your own waffle station. Although these stations tend to create a line because of the time it takes to make them, a young man that worked for the hotel offered to make waffles for people in line. He helped by making sure that the guests had waffles in the fastest way possible by making some in the kitchen. I did not get this service at the other Homewood that I stayed at. I was then called while in my room to offer me fresh towels. I appreciated the phone call because I did not want them to bring me new towels seeing as I was checking out that morning. I did not see the point in wasting towels and their call to offer them gave me the chance to let them know that I did not need them. Another hotel just brought me towels and wasted them because I was checking out in a matter of a few hours. I also loved the fact that the hotel was quiet. I did not hear any noise from planes, which I worried that I would. I am a light sleeper and had one of the best nights sleep. The location of the hotel is nice, it is close enough to downtown San Diego to make it convenient, but far enough away to make it not as busy and loud. I really enjoyed my stay here and will definitely be back to stay. Their service and location make it a perfect place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to give it a 5 but.....”
Reviews.Author: ginger2007
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property. While I wanted so badly to give it another 5 star rating like I did 2 years ago, one thing kept me from it. But let's start with the good first. For starters, I was in San Diego for Comic Con so having a full breakfast provided each morning at no additional cost is always a good thing because you usually don't eat again until dinner. Aside from the powdered eggs, the breakfast is good - great oatmeal, breads, waffles, cereals and excellent coffee. The hotel is extremely clean at all times and that is refreshing as well. We had the 2 room, 2 bathroom suite which was very large and all three of us had our own TV! Parking is free and plentiful - we never have to search for parking there - and it's always near the front. A bonus was in finding out that the Comic Con shuttle was actually making a stop that far out this year too so that kept parking costs down. Location is nice too - grocery store for the full kitchen ( which includes all the dishes, utensils, pots, pans, toaster, fridge and two burner stove) and several restaurants are nearby, some within walking distance. Now for the not so good. The pillows in our room were very small and thin - I had to use the decorative pillow actually - it had more meat to it. We had made this reservation in July of 2010, anticipating Comic Con, and we ended up with a handicap room. I can't stand handicap rooms - I'm not handicap and like to have a bathtub, not a shower with no sides to it and a toilet you have to climb onto (I'm short). That really irritated me that they would give me a room like that when I had made the reservation a year early. But the worst thing that happened was that when I checked in, their new computer system did not take into account that I had paid a portion of my bill already and they held several hundred dollars hostage. Then, when they tried to fix it, they ended up holding $2000 for a $727 hotel bill. I went to use my card at Comic Con and couldn't. We couldn't get food or anything. But Cydney at the Homewood - bless her heart - came to our rescue and brought us money for dinner - she actually delivered it to me and we had a wonderful dinner and the $2000 hold was removed as well for our use later. I know this was a glitch in their computer system but it did make us extremely nervous throughout our stay because we never knew if they were going to hold more. They did fix it and made amends but it was a very big inconvenience for that one day when we couldn't use our card for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: dnrdavies
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this Homewood. It is located right in the middle of all the sights of San Diego. Parking was great, free breakfast was nice and the area was safe. Room was clean and beds were great. Free dinners were a bonus. Will stay here again if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: zooprgirl
Reviews.Content: We really love the Point Loma/Liberty Station area and this is ideally located within walking distance and right on the bay. We had a lovely bayview room, a suite, which is a must for us when traveling with our young daughter. Good free breakfast if very busy on weekends. We had TONS of trouble with our electronic room keys, which you need to enter any part of the hotel except the front lobby. We had to get new keys no less than FIVE times because they failed to work. We did not have them by any type of magnet etc in our pockets/purses but they kept getting deactivated which meant a walk all the way back to the lobby every time. I'm not sure where the problem was but it became very frustrating. We noted that the hotel was kept very clean and tidy the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for families”
Reviews.Author: Cusita
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the busy week before the 4th of July and that holiday weekend. The hotel was full but we never felt it too crowded. The pool is on the small side however it was never crowded. The breakfast area was always busy but we always got a table after a few minutes. I love the fact that the breakfast was served early and you have the choice to eat in or out. Some days we took the food to our room to let the kids sleep an extra hour. When you register, be prepared to get a "hold" in your account for a high amount . Ask the person at front desk to give you the precise number. We saw many families and it was summer so be prepared to get some noise and screams. However, we slept every night without problems even when we had a room with "parking" view. I didn't like the food served during the reception days and I didn't love the breakfast either (I loved the food at the Marriott next door) but we chose the suite to have the convenience of a kitchen and 2 rooms. The staff was super nice and were very attentive to our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: MegWesternAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June. On check in we were given a ground floor room with a queen bed and a fold out sofa for the kids.It was very homely and had a modern practical kitchen. The thing I liked most about this hotel was the surrounding area. It is beautifully landscaped and there is a walking path along the water in front of the hotel and a park next door where the kids can run around and kick a ball. We didn't use the pool but that looked very clean. It was also great having the restaurants next door.One night we fed the kids the free meal and then took them to Oggi's for an icecream while we had a pizza and pasta. The next night we got Japanese takeaway from the Asian restaurant. Even though this hotel is next to the airport you can't hear the planes and you can't see the airport. I did notice a free shuttle bus taking people to the airport.You could stay at this hotel and not have a car. It would be possible to get cabs to the zoo, USS Midway and Sea World as they are all so close.
