We did have a car and there was plenty of free parking, but one night we went to the baseball and just took a cab there and back so we didn't have to worry. The breakfast is more than adequate and the dinner was good for the kids. It was a nice touch to have it included.Our kids loved the pool table. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location! Must stay”
Reviews.Author: famtime4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond our expectations. We booked thru Expedia (which I would not recommend as you can get better rates using AAA or direct reservation with the hotel). The location is perfect for visiting the zoo and Seaworld - super easy access to both. The hotel staff is wonderful- helpful and friendly. Although it is near the airport we never heard planes from our room. We faced the old naval ship and that was a great spot. Everything is clean and well maintained! Super bonus for famlies the hotel provided comp breakfast AND dinner! Both were well done. There are other dining options within walking distance also. This will be our permenant booking location when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: natstar2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, whilst we were happy with how clean & spacious the room was, but the walls were thin, we could hear everything the person was doing in the next room. The fridge was so noisy, to the point were the kids couldnt sleep out on the sofa bed!! they ended up sleeping with us. because all the racked next door, i ended up on the sofa bed & it was extremly uncomfortable. so ended back into the crowded bed, woke up with a really bad back & so did my husband was complaing of a bad back. Also you could hear the people above us aswell, stomping around all night. mind you this was a first night. I was ready to pack up & leave!! we went down for breakfast, the breakfast area was nice, but the tables were flithy, we had to clean the table ourselves!! Also there are hidden taxes & fees they charge, which werent mentioned when making a booking. when we told the person at the front desk about our experience, they just didnt care. very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: KLMHOUSE
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and close to everything - sea world, zoo, seaport village, airport. Parking is easy and plentiful. Breakfast in the morning is very nice. Wonderful grounds for a nice walk. Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone whether in SD for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeAnnMosey
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites Liberty Station is my favorite place to stay while in San Diego! The staff at Liberty Station are extremely friendly, helpful and will make every effort to ensure that your stay exceeds your expectations. The location is great for the beach and the downtown night life and the rooms are spacious and quiet. Between the professionalism of the staff and the wonderful property ammenities, Homewood Suites Liberty Station was the only choice when planning our family reunion later in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: nzcoops
Reviews.Content: Just what I was after. Free wifi, breakfast included (continental and cooked), and Mon-Thu they have a free meal at night! Huge bonus that I didn't know about till getting here. Room was very clean every night when I got home. The TV channels MATCHED! what was in the book, a miracle these days. Gym was great, huge laundry room, clean, quick and cheap to use. Awesome facilities, subway, thai, pizza, starbucks all <100m away. Room was huge, bed, pillows, comfy. Tea, coffee and popcorn in the room (dishwasher, microwave, fridge freezer) and they'll buy groceries for you and leave them in your room, no delivery charge (if you spend over $10). Check in staff and kitchen staff were great. Not in town obviously, but nice safe spot, quiet and relaxed and not that far from town (bus directly there from just outside Mon-Fri.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 4kidsandcrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King suite and it was beautiful. Very spacious with a full kitchen and nice sitting area. The breakfast each morning was very good, with lots of options. We didn't have the dinner, too many great restaurants in San Diego, but I'm sure it was good. The property is huge, with nice pool, basketball court, and a big courtyard with fire pits, grills, and lots of seating. It is not downtown, but I drove my husband to the convention center every day and it took less than 10 minutes to get there. The rooms can have a "water view" which is of the river going into the bay. It wasn't the bay, but still beautiful and I loved sitting on my small balcony and looking out at it. Over all, great hotel, and I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here 2 times already, within the past 30 days.”
Reviews.Author: apain_10
Reviews.Content: Great location for value, close to airport, free airport transport service, free full breakfast each day, free dinner 4 nights/week including wine and beer, free parking, free internet in room as well as in common areas, in-room kitchen, and seating room, on and on.... plus a perfect jogging route on the premise! Staff are very responsive and friendly. Definitely a great location for families... plenty of rooms and activities for children to be busy.

Reviews.Title: “This was our third annual trip here since they opened in '08 & we would love to return, but---”
Reviews.Author: shiralu1010
Reviews.Content: We loved our experiences at Homewood Suites each time-- & always book 2- 1 bedroom suites since 2008 when they opened. We were looking forward to returning this August, but the rates have jumped almost $100 per suite since last August for the same period and accomodations We know its high season in San Diego, but with the economy the way it is, Homewood needs to be sensitive to current conditions as well as being aware of the competition for similar accomodations. Hoping that Homewood suites will not price itself out of the market, otherwise it will lose potential new and returning guests.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Mystelody
Reviews.Content: On the outside, this place doesn't look like anything to write home about but the suite we stayed in was very comfortable and great value for money. Actually, the room itself was tiny, with barely any room to move about but the living area was very spacious. We had a view of the pool and the ocean. The hotel staff was very helpful in providing us with a guide of what to do in San Diego. The complimentary breakfast was great and parking was free (open lot). Locating this place wasn't easy or may be it was just my GPS' issues. Location: You need a car/taxi to get into downtown San Diego where the night life rocks but if you are looking for just calm relaxation, this is the place. I am a light sleeper and I didn't get bothered by the plane noise that some people mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Love the history”
Reviews.Author: rkbzdsa
Reviews.Content: The area of Liberty Stations is rich with history and the redevelopment of the area is outstanding. Right when you get off the freeway you start to ask yourself,"what did I get myself/family into?" Strip clubs line the main street with not so great looking people hanging out. The further you drive the better the area gets until you wind-up in the gem called Liberty Station. The hotel was tucked in behind a row of restaurants so depending on the area events it is difficult to get in and out of. You can't hear the restaurant noise from the hotel. We got there around 11 and check in wasn't for several more hours. The staff was very nice and found us a room to check in early. Now, because this is an extended stay hotel, all the best room over looking the waterway and most desired room are reserved or have been taken by long term guests. I was willing to wait for a better room than was given but I was told there was nothing much better. I explained that I'm a light sleeper but again, the hotel staff did what they could. I faced the parking lot on the 2nd floor. But hey, we have a balcony - kind of (bathtub size). I sleep with the window open and all was well until around 4 am when the kitchen staff comes into work. Then forget it. The only other noise that you have to deal with is the air show, courtesy of Lindberg airport. The room was a nice size and the bed was soft. The pull-out sofa was actually comfortable according to my son. The in-room kitchen was modest and severed its purpose. Same for the bathroom and small vanity. I did have to alert house keeping that under the sofa was trash that needed to be removed. The breakfast was outstanding... Now, if you are there to enjoy yourself with friends the place has security to put a stop to your chitchat outside the fire place after 10pm, on a Friday or Saturday night. Kind of a buzz kill, but you always have the restaurants across the way. This area is truly off the beaten path and the area and hotel are great/fine. If you wanna be away from it all (remember aboves) then you are good to stay at this hide away location.

Reviews.Title: “Still Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel. Rooms are still clean, spacious and quiet (no trains or trolley). Planes stopped flying around 8:30 PM and started up at 6:30 AM. Staff were friendly and we were checked in immediately and presented with our Hilton Honors guest bag of waters and snacks. Parking is free. Restaurants are nearby and it is an easy 5 minute drive to the San Diego waterfront. Also, it's a straight shot to Balboa Park using Laurel Street off of Harbor Drive. Breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, potatoes and bacon, make your own waffles, fruit, pastries, cereals, yougurt, juices, coffee/tea and milk. This will continue to be our hotel of choice when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAK
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this location and it was fabulous! I came to San Diego for a convention at Mission Bay. I chose this location as it was between the convention and the airport. I had a single suite room which was huge! I had a king size bed with the kitchen and living room. It was spotless and quiet. Since I came by myself, I was worried about my safety. I did not have a worry, as it was quite a secure building and in a very safe neighborhood. I loved that they provided a free breakfast, and a delightful dinner. There were varied choices and all quite good. The staff was very helpful when I had questions and very friendly. I will return to this hotel and will recommend it to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with e-check-in; they ignore it”
Reviews.Author: jmo3611
Reviews.Content: I am an honors club member; I have stayed at this hotel 4 times in the last 2 years for at least a week at a time and I have loved it. For my most recent stay, I was offered e-check in, where you can pick your room ahead of time. I did this and even called the hotel directly 2 times to make sure I had read the hotel map correctly and had followed the right procedure. Upon arrival, late at night, I was told my room was not available; the previous guest had decided to stay another night. Rather then tell him the room was reserved, they told me I would get a different room and would be moved after a day. Upon eeaching the room I didn't want, the hotel clerk called and said it would be 2 nights before I could get into my reserved room. We are in our 70's and need medical devices which have to be set up, then unassembled and repacked, so this was very inconvenient. They did move us to a different room after one night, but neither the night nor day manager offered any compensation for our trouble except to say "Sorry.". So my advice is don't bother with the e-check in; they will put you wherever is most convenient for them. Maybe don't even bother staying here if you don't want the hassle. previous guest

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: dancingprincess
Reviews.Content: Love the Homewood Suites chain and this hotel was fantastic from top to bottom. It really was a home away from home. THe front desk staff were awesome and were always happy to answer questions. The walking tracks along the water behind the hotel were just great. It really was a peaceful relaxing atmosphere both in and around this hotel. The 2 bedroom suite room was great, the only slight problem was that the pull out sofa was not real comfortable for my teenage daughter. bathrooms were huge and modern. The free dinner ( meatballs and spaghetti) was delicious and the free breakfast each morning was great. The pool was very nice and my girls enjoyed the basketball court shooting some hoops as well as the small gym. We had dinner at the Thai restuarant out the front of the hotel and it was absolutely devine and so cheap. This hotel would be perfect if only it was closer to the main part of San Diego. This wouldnt be a problem is you had a car but the taxi trip to the zoo one day and into Seaport Village the next was about $25 each. This hotel is totally worth it though and I would definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would be a great stay except wrong charges and bad services afterwards”
Reviews.Author: i_like_smile
Reviews.Content: I would say my 3 days stay there were a good experience. The place was quiet even our two bedroom suite was facing the street and was on first floor. The room is clean and the food are fine. The overall experience was really good and I planned to go back there next time when I revisit San Diego. However, all of above experience changed after I got an email from Assistant General Manager a day after my checkout date. The email said that their cleaning folks found out some scratches on the chairs and he went ahead and placed $80 charges on my credit card. After I read the email, I started to remember my daughter's comments when we checked in that late afternoon. Our daughter is 3.5 and what I would consider a very well behaved child and gets along well with her peers and listens to adults. I had to use the chair for her to stand near the sink so she could wash her hands before we headed out for the free dinner. I pulled the chair out from under the diner table in living room and carried it to the sink in bedroom. Before she climbed up, she noticed those marks. She asked me who drew those and I told her I did not know. She said it could be babies. To be frankly, I did not notice the marks at all until she pointed out. I did not bother to call front desk to report that as I thought that should be already knew by the hotel. So after I got the email, I called the assistant manager and told him the truth. He just said he did not have power to revert the charges and we had to talk to his manager. So we left a VM for his manager. Then it took the manager five days to get back to us by email and said his investigation was marks happened during our occupancy. He did not even leave his signature with title and phone number so that we could try to discuss this further over the phone. Anyway, I replied to his email right away and explained the situation to him again but till now a week passed, no answer from him. I think the management is NOT professional at all. They don't care about customer's service and they wrongly charged customer without listening to customer's voices. I would NOT go back to this hotel again and definitely would NOT recommend this hotel to my friends based on this incident because they may do the same thing to them and wrongly charge them.

Reviews.Title: “NO Major complaint here.”
Reviews.Author: ddkmdFairfax_VA
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Homewood suites, Double Tree, or Embassy Suites as we travel with two young children and often require a sofa bed in a separate room to get a restful night. Pros: Friendly staff, location from the major attractions. 5 washers and 4 dryers in each of the 2 buildings!! Cons: hydrogenated powdered eggs; room location did not match my request and we were given a choice of a room across from the elevator or moldy first floor. We took the latter and had the fan on constantly but could not leave the window open for security reasons. Overall although the room was not what I was used to, the staff was friendly enough to compensate for the minor deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Friendly Hotel Chain!!”
Reviews.Author: 2thdoc73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites-Liberty Station in San Diego for 5 nights. Checked in on Sunday, April 17, 2011 and checked out on Friday, April 22, 2011. Me, my wife, 9 year old son and 6 year old daughter were here for Spring Break to attend theme parks and other attractions. Homewood Suites is now our favorite family-friendly hotel!! Embassy Suites is now our second favorite. We read the reviews here on T.A., so we booked a room at HS and were thrilled. We payed $175/night, are Silver HHonors members, and booked directly from their website (no 3rd party like expedia, hotwire, etc). The suites may seem expensive at first, but with their amenities, you can save a lot of money in other ways. Try and use AAA rate or Govt rate (if possible) when booking on the website. Our room was on the second floor in the North Building with a view of the pool and the bay! We had the one bedroom suite. The kids slept on the sofa bed which pulled out just fine and we slept on the king sized bed. There was a full size stainless steel refrigerator, stainless steel microwave, stainless steel dishwasher, and electric range with 2 burner locations. The kitchen counter tops were granite. Wi-Fi was complimentary and our Blackberries connected no problem. There were 2 flat screen HDTVs. Parking is "self-park" and is free. Breakfast is included every morning (7 days a week) and dinner is included (Monday-Thursday only). The wine was Sycamore Lane (red and white) and Bud Light was served from the tap. The pool and hot tub were heated well. There is a nice walkway behind the hotel which leads to a playground. There's a Trader Joe's and Vons about a mile away. House keeping was great! I recommend waiting until 4pm to check in and/or returning to the room for the evening because the suites take more time for housekeeping to turn over. You can hear the airplanes flying over head during the day, but at night it didn't matter because from 10pm to 6am, the planes cannot land or take off. We are definitely headed to more Homewood Suite locations on our future trips because this is by far the most family friendly hotel chain out there. Normally I tell people "not to believe the hype" but, in this case, the positive reviews here on TA for HS are legit!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel but not very quiet”
Reviews.Author: foxmooder
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom suite for five nights. Plenty of space for us four. Nice kitchen. Two bathroom was great. Housekeepers are friendly and did a good job. Customer service was excellent. Fair good breakfast (was free). Free dinner with wine or beer on Monday thru Thursdays. Food was not great but cannot complain since it was free. Great thing was you can bring food back to your room and eat. It is hard to eat out with young kids so this was a bonus for us. Almost everything was included in the hotel price: parking, internet, breakfast, gym, pool, dinner, newspaper, 24 hour coffee. One thing that I was shock for being charge was for using the telephone for a local call. If I had known, I would have used my cell phone. The one thing that was a big disappointment was the cheap quality of this building's structure. You can hear people open and close doors, closet doors, walk, etc. from the people above you. And the people below you can hear you as well. If you are a light sleeper, stay on the fourth floor or go somewhere else. If you have super active young children, stay on the first floor or go somewhere else. You will get complaints from people who sleep super early or have low tolerance to noise. The airplane noise did not bother us. The closest freeway is two miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: w0rshipthesun
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! what a great hotel...... great service from the moment you get picked up in their complimentary shuttle. Drive even offered me an ice cold bottle of water. Front desk staff was great, recommended great trolley tour that picks up from the hotel. Close to liberty station village where there is a Vons and a Trader Joes to do shopping for groceries to cook in the efficiency suite. Full breakfast was included which was great and plentiful as well as a managers reception which featured a light meal with beer and wine. Only downsides were it is not close to downtown, about a $15 cab ride one way. Also soundproofing of hotel seems to be a little slopping as could hear pitter patter. Will defiantly return what I visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and convenience!”
Reviews.Author: 55711Anonymous
Reviews.Content: 26/M/TX stayed at Homewood Suites after searching through allll the travel sites for a good place in San Diego. Now this place isn't exactly in the middle of touristdom, but since we had a rental car, this was no big deal. And unlike many places, parking was free! There are a few restaurants near the hotel within walking distance, or you can take advantage of complimentary breakfasts and dinners. There is also a nice jogging trail next to the hotel that some friends of mine used and enjoyed. We selected a place with a kitchenette so that we could cook food at the hotel and then take lunches to the zoo, Seaworld, etc. There were grills outdoors that we used to make burgers and kebabs, which was a lot of fun and a low-priced alternative to having every vacation meal at a restaurant. There is a Trader Joe's grocery a few blocks away. Lots of families and their children stay here, making those complimentary meals a bit crowded. However, the rooms and halls were typically quiet, the staff was extremely courteous, cheery and helpful at all hours, and the rooms were well-appointed with comfortable beds and enough kitchen supplies and utensils to make whatever is necessary. The shower was not particularly effective, but we had the handicapped-accessible room, and through no fault of the hotel those showerheads are typically not very good anyway if you need some pressure. The (heated!) pool and hot tub are small, but still in keeping with the average hotel at this price range. There is some disparity between what wares and utensils are in each room, but the front desk can get you anything that is missing or extra containers to take, say, a big bowl of pineapple to the beach. I was very satisfied with what I got for the price and would happily stay at this place again on any future vacations to San Diego (which I'll need to do, it was a wonderful city and four days just isn't enough to see everything).

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, tastefully decorated, comfortable, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: mommiee
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. First of all, there is ample parking for everyone. Not to mention that it is included in the price of the room. The hotel is very clean, modern, safe, and is in a new development. There are many restaurants nearby and a Vons and Trader Joe's for marketing. The hotel is conveniently situated near the airport, close to downtown as well as Balboa Park, Seaworld, etc. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. We had a first floor room and although there was alot of noise one night at 2am, I think it was a wedding party arriving back to their room. Otherwise, I could not hear any planes at all. I am a light sleeper and so I did hear our neighbors beside us or above us, but the noise was minimal. The breakfast bar is varied enough for the pickiest eater. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay From start to finish”
Reviews.Author: mecmom11
Reviews.Content: From start to finish I was happy with my stay. I think the location was very nice. There is abundant free parking. There are multiple places to buy food in easy walking distance such as a Subway, a Mexican fast food place and some others. Within about a mile are two grocery stores and lots of other stores. One side of the hotel is on the harbor and there is a walkway that is a great way to exercise. About ten minutes stroll is a great playground if you bring kids. The area is very nice and is very safe. The staff was very friendly and helpful as soon as I arrived. Check in was prompt and easy. I had asked for a quiet room and got one I was pleased with as I am a light sleeper. The hotel is near the airport but I never heard any noise from airplanes in the room. There is also no street noise as it in the back of the parking lot which is shared with the other shops and restaurants. The room was nice and if I needed anything the staff was very prompt in responding. They have a free shuttle that will even take you to other hotels. If you need them to buy you food from the market they will also do that. There is free breakfast every day and dinner 4 nights a week. The only drawback is the food, which did not impress me, but other people were eating there and seemed ok. There are two exercise rooms, a game room, and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sjems
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. It was clean, quiet and the staff was very friendly. I had a 2 bedroom suite shared with my daughter her husband and my granddaughter. We had plenty of room. The suite has a full kitchen with untensils so we could cook if we wanted but there were restaurants in walking distance and there was also places to get a massage or pedicure close. My only complaint was there was no childrens programming available on television that didn't have to be paid for. All in all this was a perfect place to stay with family!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - VERY friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveFamilyHolidays
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The 2 bedroom suite was big and very clean and comfortable. The sheets were so soft and the beds were very comfortable. Heaps of rooms for our family of four. The full kitchen was great. We loved the breakfast buffet and the welcome home dinner - it saved us a fortune with young children and the staff at the resturant were super friendly. The kids loved the heated pool and the walking paths. there is a brilliant playground about 5-10 minute walk away that is excellent for young children. The rooms are spotless and the daily cleaning was very effecient. The laundry room was very helpful and the washers and dryers were quick. The hotel is about a 10 minute drive to downtown San Diego and very close to the Zoo and seaworld ( heaps of free parking but there is also a shuttle that runs to the major attractions). Would loved to have given this hotel 5 stars as we really enjoyed our stay BUT it is very noisy - you can hear the planes and you can hear the peoople walking around you in the room above and talking in the room next door. You do get used to it - but if your a light sleeper - beware!! That said we would like to commend the staff at this hotel they were so helpful with all the little things we asked of them and they are ALL very friendly. Its a great family hotel and we would recommend it and stay again ( Hopefully soon - fingers crossed )

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with small children”
Reviews.Author: ironmom69
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children stayed here for 5 nights in early Feb 2011. We chose this hotel based on the previous reviews and because they offered suites. Having a full size kitchen was great with two little ones, even if we didn't eat in much. The week day dinners (Mon-Thurs) were a nice touch if the kids were too tired to go out to eat. Complimentary hot breakfast was decent - lots of healthy choices but my kids of course wanted the fruit loops they had never eaten before. There is a walking trail just out the back door of the hotel that leads you to this most amazing brand new playground. You can also run a 6 mile loop on a little island across from the hotel - ask the hotel manager who is a runner for details. The hotel also had laundry facilities which was handy. We did not use the pool as it was too cold out (62 degrees) but it looked very nice. The fitness centre had one treadmill, one elliptical, and some free weights. There is a Trader Joe's and Von's grocery store 0.7 miles away. There is also a Starbucks, a sports pub that serves very good pizza, and a few other chain-type restaurants in a strip mall in front of the hotel. We will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time we are in SD. The service and staff were superb. Overall, this is a very clean, professional hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for young kids”
Reviews.Author: jephperro2007
Reviews.Content: At first I was skeptical about this hotel, and wondered how could a hotel near the airport be ranked so high on Trip Advisor. But indeed this hotel was great for us. It's not a luxury hotel, but it is excellent for what it is - a family friendly hotel. I believe all the rooms are suites. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for my wife and young son. It had a kitchen which let us make our own lunches. Breakfast was offered by the hotel and it was good each morning - eggs, tater tots, toast, waffles, cereals and fruits. On weeknights the hotel offered a dinner, which while not fancy was very convenient in our situation. And the price we paid for the rooms was very reasonable. It is close to the airport, but the noise didn't bother us from inside the room. It is in a convenient spot for car trips to the Zoo, SeaWorld and Old Town. There are many restaurants and grocery stores within 10 minutes of walking from the hotel in the Liberty Station mall. We made several trips to the Vons and Trader Joes. All in all, I was glad to have booked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near San Diego Airport”
Reviews.Author: truffles808
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before returning home because this hotel was near the airport and it was such a wonderful hotel. I wish I had stayed longer. Fairly new, clean suites and convenient business center to print out boarding passes. There is also free breakfast daily and free dinner M-Th. Also lots of great restaurants within walking distance. The park outside is also beautiful. Truly a home away from home hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: barryvo
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel and everything has been GREAT! The staff is very friendly and professional and it feels like home staying here. The free meals are a nice perk and the folks in the kitchen work hard feeding everyone. I’ve been here for three days and will be here another week. I would definitely stay here again anytime my business travel brings me to San Diego. There are a lot of nice restaurants in walking distance along with many nice parks and walking trails. This hotel is a hit since you get nice meals in the evening Mon-Tue, free internet, nice rooms, free parking, and just an overall great place to stay. The walls are a little thin but it isn’t a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Sixvans
Reviews.Content: San Diego is wonderful!! We had never traveled to this city and were unsure where to stay or what exactly to do with our limited time. We researched places to stay on trip advisor and were very pleased with this hotel. We had our children 6,9,12 along with us so we needed a bigger room with space to "run". The hotel provided both with the two room suite, pool and activity room. It also had a beautiful walking trail bordering the river which was also provided some entertainment for our family. The hotel was close to Sea World, the airport and also the various marinas. The breakfast was great with plenty of variety and the evening meals also helped decrease our cost. Thanks for the tip trip advisor, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: ErnieScar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent for families like ours on vacation in San Diego. We had a 2 bedroom suite with 2 full baths which was great for our family of 5. The staff were very helpful and the hotel is in a great location. The free breakfast and supper (4 nights a week) was a real bonus as is the free parking and wifi. The only minor problem we found was the sound proofing between rooms is not great. Overall a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ilikecows13
Reviews.Content: I have two complaints about this hotel. The girl who checked us in was brusque and acted annoyed when we walked in the door. It appeared as though she was emailing or chatting when we arrived. Next, the breakfast was awful. Everything (speaking of the "hot" food) was cold and stale. Other than that, the stay was wonderful. The location is nice, right next to shopping and fairly central to most of San Diego. The rooms (2 bedroom suite) were clean and kept up. We had a really nice time and hope to take our kids someday.

Reviews.Title: “Return stay definitely!”
Reviews.Author: navymom123
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego visiting one of my 2 sailor sons before his deployment. I wanted to stay somewhere that was more like home rather than a hotel room and found that in this hotel. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite and the was more than ample room for us and for some of his friends who stopped by to just chill out. The room was comfortable and very clean, the breakfast was wonderful, the grounds of the hotel were beautiful with a nice walking path nearby. I used the laundry room which was also clean and convenient as well as the exercise rooms that were adequate and clean for my needs. The location of the hotel was very convenient to the North Island base in Coronado as well as to the city, the airport and other area attractions. Liberty station itself provided many restaurants, a Starbucks, Trader Joes and Vons within walking distance or a few miles away. I even got a wonderful, wonderful massage in the Massage Envy location right across the parking lot. Ask for Katherina if you go there!! Fellow Navy mom and awesome massage therapist! All in all a wonderful experience and would definitely stay there again. Hopefully in the early summer when my other son returns from deployment!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gandalf1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and 2-year old son from 4th Jan to 7th Jan 2011. Wonderful, wonderful experience. Nice, large and clean room, large kitchen, comfortable bed and pillows. Even the sofa bed was pretty comfortable! Dinner was provided throughout, and the meals were actually pretty good! Location was great, near restaurants and Trader Joe's. Next to a nice promenade, with a large playground nearby. It was actually pretty quiet even though it was very close to the airport. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout. Simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier-Staff was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SoNotChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites with our 7 and 9 yr. olds for a family vacation. Location is AWESOME! Close to the airport, attractions, restaurants, and TRADER JOE'S :) We typically choose business hotels because they are generally quieter. It was very quiet despite the fact that the airport is so close. The hotel has plenty of parking and backs up to a walking path and inlet with a little park not too far down the path. Breakfast and Dinners were an awesome value and well stocked. Staff was EXCELLENT; our travel agent made a gigantic goof (long story) and we were all exhausted when we got in. The desk manager not only let us check in early, he upgraded our room. I wish I could remember his name!! They were also very helpful in providing directions and suggestions for restaurants, etc. It doesn't have a swimming pool, but since we went in March, that was not an issue. It did have a basketball court and a very nice outside veranda area adjacent to the breakfast room. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent self contained accommodation”
Reviews.Author: scottmelon
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights over New Year with our 3 children under 10 in a 2 bedroom suite with sofa bed. An excellent property for our needs after a visit to Disneyland. Rooms spacious and clean with two reasonably sized bathrooms. Hotel quiet and clean and situated near two supermarkets, restaurants and a large park for children. Inexpensive washing facilities on site and kitchen in rooms adequately stocked to prepare meals if desired. Free breakfast reasonable for America. Close to airport however we were not disturbed by aircraft noise. Free parking on site and a car would be helpful if your plan is to see San Diego as property not located in city centre ( about 5 min drive). Recommend Vons for groceries and Solare Italian restaurant for excellent dinner. Undoubtedly the best value for money property of our North American holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient place for stay with young kids”
Reviews.Author: star_happylife
Reviews.Content: Hi, As always, Tripadvisor reviews were very helpful in this find. This was the only reasonableplace with king bed in bedrrom + sofa-bed + kitchen + good location + breakfast + early dinner was a definite plus. Nearby Trader Joes very helpful. Also, Cabrillo vista point is 5-10 min drive away. Staff, especially lady in morning breakfast time (Corrine ?) very nice..always had bright smile and eager to help. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ksmom2Kansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights between Christmas and New Year's. We thought the location was great for a fairly short drive to the zoo, the Midway Museum, La Jolla, Gaslamp area, etc. It was very close to the airport, but the airplane noise did not bother us at all. The room was very nice. We stayed in a two-bedroom, so it had three TVs and two bathrooms, which we all appreciated! Breakfast was good and did have some variety from day-to-day. Two little problem kept this from being truly a five-star in my opinion. The wireless internet in the rooms only worked sporadically and for two days not at all. Also, our room was right next to the exercise room, and so we were woken up almost every morning by the TV from the exercise room blaring loudly. Not a big enough problem to go to the trouble of being moved to another room once we were settled in, but I'd ask for another room on check-in if you get assigned next to the exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PrairieTraveller63
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful - nicely decorated and laid out, great staff, beautiful surroundings, great location, abundant breakfasts with a huge selection, free wireless, parking, newspaper, and safe deposit box service. We had two-bedrooms suites, which were perfect for our needs - everyone had plenty of space and the extra bathrooms were great. It was a little chilly for the pool, but the kids used the hot tub most days. We traveled to San Diego for our first Christmas away from the snowy and cold prairies. There were nine in our family group, including grandparents, adult children and grandchildren in their late teens. We would love to go back and will recommend this hotel to everyone! There were good stores close by: Trader Joe's, BevMo, etc. and a Starbucks and Subway were a short walk away. We also had great meals at restaurants in the area, especially Solare (Italian) and The Corvette Diner.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Kiyomi-San
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our 4 daughters, ages 13-5. We got a 2 bedroom suite. Our room was super clean. The breakfast was ok and the breakfast room got a bit crowded after 8am. This hotel, I thought, was a little far from the downtown area, but if your renting a car, I guess you'll be fine. It was close to Seaworld. This was a family hotel, so I suppose if it were just my husband and I, we would have preferred something a little more trendy and closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 4 Day Weekend Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Mel D
Reviews.Content: We stayed Stayed at this hotel for four day Halloween weekend. Our family had one one BR Suite and one two BR Suite. We checked-in early evening and had no wait at all. Our room keys were already ready and we hit the complimentary dinner and cocktails that is offered Monday through Thursday Nights. We reserved a 2-bedroom suite and were given a room on the top floor of the north tower which had a nice view of the Marina and Coronado skyline. The suite was very spacious and excellent for groups. 2 bedroom , 2 bath, living room, and full kitchen. Parking was free and it as just a short drive into downtown or a $20 cab ride away (which can be called by the front desk). There is free internet in the room, a free Hot breakfast consisting of Eggs, Bacon, Breakfast Potatoes, Waffles, assorted fruits, rolls, and fresh juices and coffee. The hotel actually had alot of amenities: pool, outdoor fireplace, fitness center, pool table, and a basketball ball court. We were worried about noise because of the airport but surprisingly that was not an issue, we used the hotels free shuttle service to and from the airport and it was quite convenient. You can take bus to Old Town and visit there, or catch the San Diego Transit Train at Old Town to visit stops on the way - Fashion Valley Mall, or if you're going to football game at Qualcomm Stadium (This is your best way to go) Train Drops you off at Gate 3 of the Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: evenstar944
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October. I was a little concerned that since it was near the airport it might have been a little noisy, but we did not hear any noise whatsoever. My husband and I loved the room. It was huge and came equipped with a full kitchen which was stocked with utensils, oven, microwave, kitchenette table, sink and even dishwasher. This opened out into the living room which had a huge writing desk, sofa and flat screen TV. In a spearate room was a king size bed which we both found very comfortable and another flat screen tv along with two night stands. I appreciated that the bathroom sink and mirror was separate from the rest of the bathroom. Breakfast and dinner was included in our room rate. Breakfast was great! They offered waffles, eggs, bacon, fruits, cereal, bagels, toast, juices, coffee among other items. We did have dinner on 2 nights out of our stay. Dinner was adequate, just don't expect grandma's home cooking. All this for a rate of $159 a night. I thought it was a very good value. For those who did not think it was in a central location, I do not understand what would be considered central in San Diego. Yes you need a car in San Diego because it is a very spread out city and requires highway/freeway driving to get to most places. The layout is similar to LA but on a smaller scale with less traffic and you don't want to be without a car in San Diego. It is not like San Francisco. Our longest drive was about 20 min or so to get to La Jolla, took about 10 min or so to get to the Zoo/Balboa, less than that to get to the seaport/USS Midway area and about 15 min or so to get to Point Loma/Cabrillo. We would have rated this place five stars but the only thing that brought the rating down for me was that there was a hint of a cigarette scent inside of our room but not outside. We were in a non smoking room but maybe the smoking section was on the same floor as us. The air was a little stale and my husband's allergies worsened a bit in the room. It might have been the ventilation system, and there might have been some dust in it. As for the room itself, it was very clean. Overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 4kiwistravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and staff helpful. Its handy to many things although you need a car as its not exactly central - but this is reflected in the reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a group trip”
Reviews.Author: mrtee733
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one weekend night over Halloween weekend. On travel with a small group of friends for a night out in Gaslamp and the Charger game the next morning. We checked-in early evening and had no wait at all. Our room keys were already ready in a informative check-in package with a nice welcome letter from the manager (Nice touch!). I reserved a 2-bedroom suite and was given a room on the top floor of the north tower which had a nice view of the water and san diego skyline. The suite was very spacious and excellent for groups. 2 bedroom , 2 bath, living room, and full kitchen. Parking was free and it as just a short drive into downtown or a ~$20 cab ride away (which can be called by the front desk). This place would be perfect If it was walking distance to gaslamp. There is free internet in the room, but was kinda slow as in most hotels. The free breakfast had a good selection of food including fresh juices and coffee. The hotel actually had alot of amenities(pool, bbq, fitness center, pool table, bball court) I wish I was able to use, only if my trip was more than 1 night. I must also note that my girlfriend left her purse in a drawer after we checked-out and thought she lost it. However, the hotel took the time to call me and let me know she left it and that we could pick it up. They have very honest housekeeping! Check-out was as easy as a phone call to the front desk. As a Diamond member, I really enjoyed my stay and would def recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and terrific service”
Reviews.Author: paul518
Reviews.Content: IF only all hotels could deliver like Homewood. Okay, I was sceptical. Could Homewood really deliver like the other reviewers suggested? Well, YES! Great location. Nice people. Squeaky clean. My only "complaint" if I must come up with one is that the bedroom was tiny -- no space for a bag. Other than that, the place was spotless. As I think about upcoming trips, I'll put Homewood Sutes on my checklist. It's the ideal place for me and my wife and infant son. They offered a pack and play but I brought ours. In fact, we put Junior down in the P/Play in the bedroom, watched a movie in the living room and then carried the P/Play out to the living room through the doors. Easy! Homewood is to Suites as Hilton Garden Inn is to single rooms -- great value and well appointed. BTW, this location is in a newish part of San Diego so there are lots of walking/biking paths. Within five minute walk there was a huge playground for Junior to play in. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: beachboy381
Reviews.Content: My family (incl 2-1/2 year old daughter) stayed here for 2 nights in October and were very satisified with our stay. Location: Very convenient - located in a new stripmall; 2min from airport, 10 min from Seaworld and Zoo. There was plenty of self parking next to our room Room: New and clean. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and found it roomy for 3 adults and 1 child. Room included full kitchen Staff: Overall very friendly and helpful. Although when we checked out the person at the front desk was a bit rude Misc: Complimentary hot breakfast (incl cereal, fruit, pastries, eggs, meats and waffles) was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Avg. Hotel, tiny bedrooms in suites, clean, but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Aquafam
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor let us down on this one! We're beginning to find that some of the truly nice or luxurious hotels don't rate as high on tripadvisor as general "family friendly" average places. Free Crappy Waffles and Free, cold, egg substitute seem to always rate better than a world class 5 star resort and spa. We found deals at the Hyatt downtown for the same rate as this place but decided that since it was rated so much higher on TA that we'd give it a try. Let me tell you that there is no way on the planet that this place is as nice as the Hyatt. However, if you're looking for a hotel to let your kids run down the hallways screaming "to meet new friends" then this is the place for you. If you want/ need a room with a kitchen then again this would be a good choice. Moral of the story here is to understand what highly rated family friendly means- Free B-fast, kitchen, screaming kids, elephants above you, no-frills. We had a two bedroom suite. We found it a little annoying to have to completely unpack the suitcases since there was no place- zero- nada- for a full size suitcase except standing upright in the closet or in the middle of the kitchen. Coffee was good but breakfast was nothing better than any other free hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Quiet, Friendly, Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: keza1_10
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is well worth staying at. The rooms are quiet, beautifully maintained and the beds are comfortable. The breakfasts and evening meals were all of a very good standard. The dining staff were always smiling and nothing was too much trouble. The location is good. We hired a car and had GPS. We are a family of six and the two bedroom suite was very suitable and met our needs. So well done Homewood Suites out of 5 Hotels that we stayed in the USA we rate you the Best! We definitely recommend you.

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Mother_of_5_teens
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We traveled about 5 1/2 hours from Phoenix, AZ to visit the Zoo and Sea World. Both attractions were within 10 minutes from the hotel. We selected the 2 bedroom suite which was roomy enough for six people (2 adults and 4 teenagers ranging from 13 - 19 years old). Each room is equipped with a flat screen, roomy closet, dresser, and bathroom. The living room area included another flat screen tv, sofa sleeper and a dresser. There was also a full kitchen and dining table that seat 4 people. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. There is also an outdoor pool and basketball court. My children enjoyed the game room that is adjacent to the hotel lobby. The game room has a flat screen and pool table. I was expecting more games (ie. wii) but the children were satisfied playing pool. The breakfast was definitely a money saver and we all enjoyed making fresh waffles each morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel to travelling families. Oh you will definitely need a car to get around. There are a few restaurants in walking distance but they were not at the top of my list for places to eat. Lastly, the hotel does have a small fitness center, a business center, free internet and free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KiwiSmiles
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel and loved the location - nice walks along the water and as we had a car it was an easy drive to shopping centres and other areas of this lovely city. Free parking, a very nice complimentary breakfast (including hot and cold choices - make your own waffles is fun) and a basic but filling dinner each night - also complimentary and very good value. We had a two bedroom suite and it was spacious with bathrooms in each room and a full kitchen, which came in very useful. It was very modern and the maid service was wonderful and it was lovely to get back after a long day out to a room that was comfortable and clean. Laundry facilities were great and very user friendly. Check in and check out was a breeze. We would highly recommend this hotel to others and would definitely stay again if we visited San Diego in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: pemberley_traveler
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for sons graduation from Marine Corp. boot camp. Hotel was close by the airport and MCRD. Free airport shuttle was nice. Had to use taxis for going to the base. Price of your stay includes dinner Monday through Thursday evenings (wine & beer included) and also nice breakfast buffet with mostly continental items, although waffles and eggs were included. Not the tastiest of foods, but it was free so you really can't complain. Another nice bonus was having a laundry facility on the second floor to be able to do laundry. One little tip, if you are in room by the elevator, CHANGE rooms immediately, as the noise from it will keep you up all night. It was a very nice and clean place to stay. Nice pool and hot-tub area, as well as a basketball court. Very nice and helpful staff when it came to recommendations. Overall a wonderful place for families and/or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great for families”
Reviews.Author: Sabcfamily
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel with easy access to all tourist destinations. Situated on lovely Liberty Station with grocery stores near by and walkways and fields. Hotel offers breakfast and dinner during the week - well done, always plentiful and good service. Nice pool area and lovely rooms. Laundry rooms excellent. Great for our family of 4. Would recommend and stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Polly051
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. Very clean, pretty and comfortable. Breakfast was your typical hotel breakfast but very nice. We even had dinner one night that was great. Hotel is in a lovely quiet spot. You do hear the planes as it is close to the airport but never at night. Beautiful grounds and a lovely area to walk by the water. In a location relatively close to all attractions as long as you have a car. Parking is free which is a BIG plus in this area! Loved the entire time we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: kattie40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Labor Day weekend. Room was clean and comfortable on arrival. As previously mentioned the breakfast facilities were not great..... we had to sit separately from our young children as there were no free tables on the first day. We got up earlier the next day in the hope that there would be more space but no - very overcrowded again and also the cooked food trays were empty and we had to ask for more food to be brought out! We were also disappointed that the evening reception serving hot food/snacks only operated on a Mon-Thurs, food was not available during our weekend stay and this was one of the things that had prompted our booking. On our final night our sleep was disturbed for half an hour by a couple rowing in a room adjacent to ours,we had not previously had any 'neighbor' noise in any other hotels which we had stayed in. Swimming pool area was lovely and clean with great views over the river. The hotel is in a great location for local parks, restaurants, riverside walks, etc. We had a car so had some lovely days out and the hotel is close to many local amenities, Sea World and San Diego Zoo only 10 mins drive away. All in all an ok hotel but we have stayed in better for less money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Agree with the good oppinions”
Reviews.Author: Arie_Sh
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in apublic area near park and water. Try to get a high floor with water view. Good rooms, bads, kitchen, TV , bathroom , breakfast, and afternoon buffet. Room with pool table - free. wifi works fine, but not best reception in all the room. Pool and hot Jacuzzi. All buldings have access only with room card- extra security. Service is good , but too correct. FAst check in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideGoldie
Reviews.Content: This is a great base to explore San Diego. Only minutes to the zoo and with free parking and a lovely area to walk along the water - there's a great playground about 5 minutes along the path which our kids loved. The breakfasts are very nice and so are the evening reception light dinners. It was great to have an early dinner with the kids without having to go out, although there are plenty of places to eat nearby. Rooms are spacious and new, everything was very clean and it's great to have the kitchen to make a quick snack.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but you do need a car to get around”
Reviews.Author: Welshgirl2010
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel over the recent Labor Day weekend. The room was excellent, no complaints at all - very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. and we had a partial view of the harbour. However the breakfast area was extremely crowded on all three mornings and it was very difficult to find somewhere to sit and eat - we went outside one day and shared tables on the other days. Also the free evening reception is only available from Monday to Thursday which was disappointing. The hotel has no bar or restaurant and the nearby restaurants are all "fast food" places. We ended up at the Marriott hotel next door on all three evenings which serves good bar snacks and has a restaurant and a nice bar area. The riverside area around the hotel is very nice for walks etc but to get into the city centre you do need a car. I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTimJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and and 2 children (12,11) stayed for 1 night in July 2010. The night we were there the hotel appeared full and we were smilingly upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. This suite was excellent with a king bed in 1 bedroom and a queen in the other. The 2 bedrooms were connected by a compact sitting room and a decently equipped kitchen. Because we were only there for 1 night, we didn't use the cooking facilities. However we did want to get ice and even though I searched high and low, I couldn't find an ice bucket. I ended up walking to the ice machine to collect ice with a saucepan from the cupboard. This was no big deal but on my return,I met a guy going the other way to collect ice also carrying a pan so it didn't seem to be an isolated omission for our room. It's a bit strange these are not supplied but as I say, it's no big deal. As others have commented, the'free' evening reception meal with wine and beer for the adults is of excellent quality but because the hotel was full the night we were there, there wasn't enough tables to seat all the guests. Since you were not allowed to take alcohol out of the dining area, we had to rutun later in the evening in order to get a table to eat. In the morning, it was the same story. The dining area was very full with some big parties cramped around some very small tables. The breakfast was good and plentiful but nothing exceptional. Although both the evening meal, breakfast and parking are 'free', don't be fooled into thinking that Hilton haven't baked these costs into the room rate. The night we spent at the Homewood Suites was the most expensive (in rate terms) of all the 18 nights we spent on the West coast and that included staying in some city centre hotels in places like San francisco. Having said that, the hotel is excellent and rightly deserves its high Tripadvisor ranking. It's very convenient to the airport and you can access all the major tourist attractions with ease (top tip - we were pleasantly suprised with the USS Midway museaum which is close by. If you have young bys, its a real hit as an attraction). We like staying in suites compared to regular hotel rooms because of the extra space and the Homewood Suites is a great - particularly if you can get a good room rate!

Reviews.Title: “At Home(wood) in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here while on vacation in Southern California with wife and two sons (10 and 7). This is truly one of the best hotels I have stayed at in all of my travels! Every staff member we came in contact with had a friendly smile and "what can I do for you" attitude. The front desk provided a map and directions to the zoo and the lady in the manager's reception area helped me wrap up some dinner items to take back to the room for my family. The most outstanding service was when a couple of the engineering staff helped clean beach sand out of my rental car. I even had a chance to visit with the manager while the staff were helping with my car. She is a wonderful lady who is focused on having the best hotel with the best service in the area. The suite and bathroom were very clean and everything was in great working order. The wireless internet connection worked perfectly. The small balcony was a nice place to get a bit of fresh air. Airplanes regularly take off over the hotel area, but the sound in the rooms is minimal. The pool is a little on the small side, but was the perfect temperature and plenty of fun for the boys and some new friends. There is an outdoor terrace on the third floor that overlooks the waterway and airport. The walkways around the hotel and surrounding grounds, including along the waterway provide great strolls. We ate dinner there one of the nights - plenty of good food that was replenished regularly. Breakfasts were good overall, even though I still don't much care for the Homewood Suites scrambled egg "mix" or whatever it is. They did have some cheese and pico to put on the eggs that made them better, though. The business center was great for printing boarding passes. All in all, this is the place to stay in San Diego as far as I am concerned. It is close to downtown, the airport, and the Zoo - and parking here is free! I highly recommend staying here. Helpful hint - you are allowed to take in food and water (just not in coolers) to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Always again in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Loisl56
Reviews.Content: New Hotel - spacious suites - friendly staff - wonderful park - very good restaurants in walking distance - breakfast buffet is very, very full of people !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: viv2367b
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. They were able to upgrade us to a 2 bedroom suite for the majority of the nights that we were there, which was great as we were traveling with our 2 boys. The employees were all very helpful and very nice. It is very close to the airport but I only heard airplanes once during our stay. The free breakfast in the mornings was great, including the make-your-own waffles. We weren't ever around for the free dinners, so I can't comment on that. They also have a nice pool too. It's also very close to a shopping center and close to many fast food restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Brianandmichaela
Reviews.Content: Central to everything you want to see in San Diego. Pool and hot tub. Complimentary breakfast and dinner. Suites have separate bedroom, living room with pullout couch, fridge, cook top and microwave. Although near the airport flights stop by 10 p.m. Disneyland is about an hour away and Legoland about 30 minutes. Hotel is minutes from Old Town, the Zoo and Sea World

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and lots of the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: puffingirl
Reviews.Content: Suites are great when traveling with the family. Rooms have pull out couch, frig, microwave and stovetop. Hotel offers breakfast and light dinner included. There is a pool, hot tub, exercise room and laundry. Minutes from zoo and seaworld. Lego land 25 minutes away. Disney one hour 20 mins away. Although near airport flight seem to end by 10 pm and don't start until 630 am.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: Traveler60089
Reviews.Content: Everything about The Homewood Suites Liberty Station was fantastic! First of all the location was wonderful, centrally located and close to almost everything. Each and every staff member we met was courteous, cheerful, and eager to offer assistance. The hotel grounds were beautiful and along what I believe is the America's Cup Harbor. Lots of free, convenient parking. The effort to provide good tasting, high quality meals was unbelievable. Breakfast included eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, juices, fresh fruit, cut up melons, yogurt, cereal, high quality baked goods, oatmeal, granola, breakfast potatoes and more. They even had shredded cheese and homemade pico de gallo for the eggs. During the day, they provided coffee, tea, and watermelon juice. The evening light meals were the best we have ever experienced for included meals of this type. One evening they had excellent homemade meatloaf, assorted salads with homemade dressing, potatoes, and more. They also had cold drinks plus beer and wine. Other nights they had entrees including chicken fajitas and cajun chicken. Apparently the Homewood Suites and the Marriott Courtyard next door are under the same management. The Courtyard has a full kitchen and the homemade meals are prepared there and brought over to the Homewood Suites. The hotel was spotless and our room was spacious and comfortable. We had an excellent view of the pool, the harbor, and the skyline. Liberty Station is a former military installation that has been converted to civilian use and is filled with stores including Trader Joe's and Vons. There are also a number of great eateries as well.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: randy_howarth
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another week in San Diego and thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Homewood Suites at Liberty Station. This time we had our granddaughter (5 years old) and she especially enjoyed the pool, the Movie in the Park playing of Blind Side and the morning breakfasts with wonderful Carbon Waffles, strawberries and whipped cream. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and the service is great. There is a Starbucks, Subway, Oggi's Pizza and more within 1 block plus a Von's and other stores/restaurants about a mile away. We will return here again and again when visiting family in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: iluvmatt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our two boys - ages 2 and 4. We could not get a 1-bedroom and had to settle for a studio. Although the 1-bedroom would have been nice, we were content with a studio. I peaked inside a 1-bedroom while housekeeping was cleaning it after someone had checked out, I realized that the size of the 1-bedroom was not much larger than a studio. The dining table was of the same and the living area was about the same. I think the biggest difference was a wall to separate the bed from the living area. Pros: - the hotel is pretty new and the amenities are modern - free breakfast is good and plenty - there is an awesome playground within walking distance, if you have small kids - there are several good restaurants across from the parking lot - Trader Joe's is nearby (but not within walking distance) - surrounding area is very pretty (right by the water) and clean - you can talk walks or jog right outside of the hotel - parking is plenty, free and right in front of the hotel, unlike some resorts where you have to walk a mile to get to your car Cons: - the pool could be slightly larger - the dining table could be larger with 2 more chairs (there were only 2 chairs) - there is no oven, if you want to bake a pizza or pasta - there could be more kitchen utensils We am going back in a few weeks. We really enjoyed not only the hotel but surrounding area. It was perfect for our family since we did not have to pack the kids in the car to go out to eat. Because the playground was nearby, they were extremely content !!!

Reviews.Title: “You just can't beat the free breakfast and dinner!”
Reviews.Author: dukeofllano
Reviews.Content: Loved it-- comfy rooms ( stayed in 1 bedroom suite with fold out couch and roll-away, 2 TV's; perfect for 2 adults, 2 kids, 1 preteen!) Awesome, accomodating service. Once when we were in line to get free face painting, and they were about to run out of time, we left--- and the hotel staff member overseeng it came out and found us outside to tell us they could fit us in. That was above and beyond! Really, for a nice, clean, comfortable hotel, you just can't beat the free lunch, dinner, glass of wine, parking, and wifi. Saves you a ton of $$, especially when you are spending your days buying lunches at theme parks and lots of souvenirs. My kids also loved the pool table, and the pool. The only thing I would have changed was the chilly weather, but I guess they don't have any control over that.=). Definitely would recommend if you are headed that way. PS- Didn't hear the planes at night, but it sure was fun to drink coffee and watch the planes take off in the morning! Also, the front of the hotel is pretty humdrum looking, but don't let that fool you- it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, breakfast needs sprucing up a bit.”
Reviews.Author: L0veSanDieg0
Reviews.Content: The property was lovely, situated on the fomer Naval Training Center. The rooms were very clean. Every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly and willing to answer all of our questions. We enjoyed walking on the nearby waterfront over to the park area. There are several museums/points of interest along the way. After a few days, the same fare at breakfast was a little disappointing. There were a couple of days out of the 4 that we stayed where we ended up going elsewhere for something other than scrambled eggs and waffles. I suggest investing in a couple more waffle irons due to the wait time. We did not utilize the pool, but it looked sufficient. We did not experience any of the 'noise' issues as the other reviews state. The property is located right next to the airport, but the jet noise ceased after about 10pm. We didn't have any problems sleeping with the windows and arcadia door wide open all night. We also didn't experience any noises from other rooms as previous reviews speak of. All in all we would definitely stay here again. We would probably bring items that we enjoy more for breakfast than rely on the hotel's offerings every day. We brought our own items for lunch, utilized the gas grills on the property and enjoyed picnicking along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: dotfurio1
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping to meal hosts always greeted us with a smile and made us feel welcome and comfortable. The rooms are nice-comfy beds, clean, a t.v. in every room, full size fridge, microwave, 2 burner stove, and all the cooking utensils and dishes you need. There's a Vons a couple blocks away for stocking up. They offer full complementary breakfast every day and dinner M-Th, including wine and beer and a vegetarian option. Even my picky family members enjoyed the food. We hardly dined out during our stay as breakfast and dinner meals were provided and we packed our lunches and snacks in the room. It's very close to a lot of attractions-we weren't more than 10 min from the Zoo, Sea World, Old Town, Seaport Village, and it wasn’t very far to drive to La Jolla beach or the Wild Animal Park. Amenities at the hotel include exercise rooms, pool and jacuzzi, a couple balcony patios and a nice courtyard patio with outdoor fireplace, basketball court (balls at the front desk), pool table, and board games you can check out from the front desk. It's located next to a park area for walking along the water and there’s a nice playground a short walk away. Overall this was a very nice place, wonderful amenities, and great location. This is our new favorite place to stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family reunions with the hotel perks”
Reviews.Author: Disneylovers
Reviews.Content: My family and extended family (total of 22) stayed in a total of (4) suites, 3 of them in the large 2 bedroom suites to sleep 6 comfortably with lots of privacy (doors between the main area and bedrooms). The activity perks satisfied everyone: basketball court, pool/jacuzzi, and pool table. Morning breakfast and M-Th reception hour kept our restaurant bills down, and the local restaurants, all within walking distance, supplied great food. A must: Corvette Diner, at the other end of the Liberty Station area (roughly, a 15-20 minute walk along the waterfront), is a fun time for all. The room rates were a bit pricey, but if you take into consideration the breakfast and weekday happy hour, it all evens out. Reception area was a great meeting place for us to invite outside visitors to chat and catch up. Great security (you need your key card to access all of the buildings, including the backside of the main building). If you really want to relax and enjoy the laid-back lifestyle of San Diego, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet family hotel - much in walking distance”
Reviews.Author: lisaPBPhx
Reviews.Content: Driving from Phoenix, we were tight with 5 in a king suite - required some air mattresses on the floor but we don't like to invest in two rooms and REALLY liked the location. Our room was near an outdoor terrace with a water view. Free wi-fi was a benefit but ran slower than at home. Enjoyed pool, basketball court and the breakfast offered plenty of choices (even if the food was a bit institutional). We did not utilize the evening reception / dinner. A short walk from the hotel is a huge park with playground and basketball courts -- in addition to sports court at the hotel. Nice running/walking/jogging/ path along the channel. Further along there is better dining and museums and Trader Joe's and Vons. The hotel is adjacent to a mall with a sports bar/restaurant, yogurt shop, Subway, and other restaurants so teenagers can have a bit of independence especially if you have other plans. We have friends nearby who have problems with airport noise but this was not a problem at the hotel. Close to Maritime museum and Mission beach, I like the location much better than hotel circle and traffic is less congested than driving to Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: ls1987
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Homewood Suites Liberty Station. The hotel was very clean and spacious (we had a 2BR/2 bath suite for our family of 6.) It was centrally located to the areas we visited...SeaWorld, La Jolla, the USS Midway, Cabrillo tidepools and monument, Coronado, Balboa Park, and Horton's Plaza. The area is nice and family-friendly, and there was a Von's nearby for groceries/snacks. We enjoyed the hot tub and pool and outdoor fireplaces. The breakfast area got very crowded, but other than that minor inconvenience, it worked out great for us, and we would stay there again if given the opportunity to visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “a good comfortable family hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefunfive
Reviews.Content: very comfortable, tidy and good facilities for a family of five. the breakfasts were great included. the dinners were average albeit part of the tariff. i guess if you are visiting you want to go to other places so i didnt matter so much. a beautiful spot and a different aspect to the downtown area. very easy to get to seaworld, mexico etc. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: kjfa15
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a Homewood Suites many times before but this hotel was WAY BETTER! The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. When we needed maintenance they were prompt, kind, and went the extra mile to help. The hotel offers a free breakfast and a free dinner EVERY NIGHT! The food was fantastic! The hotel also sits on the bay and has a walking trail to a very nice park. The hotel also has many wonderful restaurants within walking distance. We were thrilled with this hotel and felt like we were at a resort rather than a regular hotel - LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its a room”
Reviews.Author: TheMuggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights...4 long nights. We had rooms near the hotels big industrial fans which kept me awake a lot during the nights. (they didn't bother the other half, but he's not a light sleeper like me) We could also hear the people above us very well...which was also very annoying. And the air conditioner was so loud...soooo very loud! The bedroom with the outside balcony was the room with the smaller double bed instead of the room with queen bed which we found a little odd. Other than the above the place was ok. Enough room for the 3 of us, good wardrobe space, good water pressure in the showers and plenty of parking spaces.

Reviews.Title: “great value for location”
Reviews.Author: audeli
Reviews.Content: we were in san diego for the zoo and sea world. booked a 1br suite but got upgraded to a 2br automatically. very spacious for us 4, we were able to each sleep w one child in separate rooms. drive to zoo and sea world was reasonable 10-15min. complimentary breakfast is average, but great because we have young kids. the only thing is, and i think i have this problem with most hotels anyways, that the sheets are very staticky and scratchy, made it uncomfortable to fall asleep (i have eczema).

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay I've Ever Had Anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: VABCH28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Homewood Suites 5/1/10-5/8/10. This was the cleanest and friendliest place I have ever stayed in. The staff was polite and greeted you on every encounter! The landscape was beautiful! This Homewood suites is close to everything. We also drove to Los Angeles which was only 2 hours away. Sea World is close by as is Petco Park, and so are casinos. restaurants, shopping centers and several beaches. If I ever get the chance to visit San Diego again I will return to this Homewood Suites!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom unit on the 3rd floor of the South Building. Room was clean and well equiped. Shower good. TVs were all large flat screens with very good pictures. Air Conditioning unit was VERY loud in the living room and on the balcony in the 2nd bedroom. It did cool the 2nd bedroom more than the other two rooms. It would not be easy to sleep on the sofa bed with this unit cooling. Using ear plugs in the bedroom pretty much blotted out the noise. Ceiling fans in the bedroom are a wonderful feature. There is an outdoor terrace at the end of a hallway on the third floor with tables and umbrellas and a restroom. It is a very nice place to sit and look at the city skyline or watch the planes take off while enjoying a coffee or reading a book. All staff were very friendly. Maid service was a bit spotty - did not have dishwasher soap or towels upon arrival and they did not replace the regular coffee when cleaning the next day. Free parking (usually around $35 in the city) and WiFi were a big plus. Breakfast good, but maybe more variety and an earlier weekend start time (7 AM currently) would help improve it. The location was an easy 10 minute drive to the Zoo, the Embarcadero and also had very easy freeway access. Oggi's Sports Bar across the parking lot had very good pizza and micro brewed beers. We could hear the people in the adjoining room thru the walls and knew when they used the closet or flushed toilets. I also smelled smoke at night being pulled in by the air conditioning.
