Also, we had pounding above us each day - maybe kids. The planes were loud at times, but only briefly. If the air condtioning was running, it totally eliminated the noise of the planes. We will plan to return on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorWestCoast
Reviews.Content: Worth all the great reviews - wouldn't change a thing. From the time we checked in it was obvious that the staff was caring and out to make our trip awesome. Dinner the first night was a great Cajun chicken with Jambalaya - with a glass of cold white wine, all complimentary, the day in the airport sunk away. The kids were comfortable from the minute we got there which made us happy. Nice pool area with a view of the water, long esplanade walking along wildflowers, and a place over the bridge to do my morning run. It is just beautiful property. Lots of restaurants for lunch choices as well as for the weekend. Trader Joe's and a chain supermarket nearby. And get this - they will do your shop for you if you like - we didn't but nice to know it's there. It was quiet at night, I never heard any noise, air conditioning, airport or otherwise. We all slept really well which isn't usual for us. Breakfast, Dinners and no added hidden costs - this is my choice of stay for San Diego as it should be yours if you like a excellent value for you vacation. Thanks Homewood Team! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Iflyyx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in a two bedroom unit. Overall, a very well done property with no major complaints. Within a 10 minute drive to most major attractions (downtown, Sea World, Maritime Museum, Balboa Park) and all can be reached with an easy non-highway route. Minutes from the airport. There is a central check-in and dining building that is flanked by the two “lodging” buildings. Both lodging buildings appear virtually identical and are four floors high. The only difference is that the “North” building is 100% non-smoking. There is a very short outdoor walk from either building to the central dining area. Access to the lodging buildings is under 24 hour key card restriction. Rooms are generally well-insulated. Room doors were well engineered – none of the typical slamming door syndrome so common at many properties. Although close to the typical departing flight path from airport, the in-room noise was not a problem as the AC unit has the ability to run in “fan” mode when not actively cooling. This covered up virtually all noise. With the “fan” mode off, we could definitely hear the rumble from departing jets. The only negative to the room insulation is between floors. We switched to the top floor after the first night due to the continual trampling sound from the occupants above us. AC unit did not do a good job moderating the temperature between the three rooms in our unit. The master bedroom (which was furthest from the AC unit) was significantly warmer than the other bedroom (which was closest to the AC unit). Given the significant amount of airflow that gets pumped through the one vent in each room, there was no good way to self-regulate the temperature. Trying to slow the airflow in the cooler room by closing the vent just resulted in the very loud sound of rushing air trying to make its way through a restricted vent opening. Very small exercise room is located in each building. Note that the facility only opens at 6:00 a.m. – not terribly convenient if one is not on Pacific Time. But, as the facility is located on the 3rd floor of each building, I suppose this reduces foot traffic noise in the morning for those residing on the 3rd floor. The free breakfast is generally well presented and is continually stocked by an attentive staff. After a week, it does get a bit old as there is not much variety from day-to-day, but the convenience makes it worthwhile. No trouble getting a table even during spring break time. Outdoor pool was heated and warm enough for kids to enjoy. Air temps were 68-72 degrees. Not a lap pool, but fine for kids to play. An in room DVD player would have been a nice and inexpensive addition.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and safe”
Reviews.Author: momof3inIL
Reviews.Content: After doing tons of research of where to stay, I am very happy with my choice! Seemed like everywhere you had to pay for parking and internet. (Both were free here.) I picked the Homewood Suites based on Tripadvisor reviews. We stayed there 4 nights. We stayed in a 2BR suite. This was a great size for a family of 5 with 3 kids under the age of 10. Had 3 TVs, 2 baths (sinks outside toliet/shower room), ceiling fans in bedrooms and good size closets. It looked like most rooms had a small balcony. But ours did not. There was also ample parking! Not an issue whatsoever! Breakfast was always busy, but we always found a table. The waffles were a favorite for the kids. My main complaint was where the room (ended in -07) was located. The master bedroom shared a wall with the exercise room. I was woken up at 6:45am with the sound of the elliptical machine whirling noise. Then I could hear the people talking "I've already done 2 miles" and on with their conversation. I was very disappointed. The Exercise Room is open 6am-10pm, so beware. Other than that it was quiet, even though it is near the airport. I would also agree with another reviewer about maintaining the temperature between the rooms. The other bedroom was much colder than the LR or master bedroom. We tried to close the vent, but it made a horrible loud whistling sound when we did it. Overall I would stay there again. We passed many of the hotels I had checked out online. And am very happy with my choice for the location. We felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “For a hotel of this class in San Diego, a good choice”
Reviews.Author: bcjunction
Reviews.Content: I saw the reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor, and whenever I see a moderate class hotel ranked #1 in a crowded market, I become a little (or a lot) skeptical. However, I was pleasantly surprised - it really was a good hotel in a good location. It's not a five-star luxury resort, but it certainly is worth considering for an extended trip with family. For a Homewood Suites/Residence Inn type of hotel, it is one of the nicer ones I have stayed in. The pros: 1. The hotel still feels brand new - not at all old or run-down. 2. The area surrounding the hotel also feels new - it looks like the whole area was redeveloped over the last few years, so there are newer restaurants and facilities nearby - not at all like the surrounding Point Loma area. 3. Free parking 4. Free breakfast buffets (kids loved this - waffles, eggs, the usual hot fare) 5. Free dinners (yes, free dinners - OK, it's institutional food - you are better off eating out, but there were plenty of people who seemed to love it) 6. It's about 3 minutes from the SAN terminal, but somehow doesn't feel like an "airport hotel." 7. It has suites (i.e., real bedrooms) with separate living/dining room and kitchen with full sized refrigerator (also range top and microwave, but no oven). 8. Flat screen TVs. 9. Nice walking trail/lane next to hotel - seems safe 10. Comfortable beds and updated bathrooms 11. Free internet access, and free printers near lobby for internet/office 12. Had towels by the pool (why can't most hotels get this right?) The Cons: 1. Somewhat loud A/C unit in rooms - not easy to regulate temperatures in each separate room. 2. If you're next to the elevator (an -08 2BR suite), you hear it in the MBR. 3. You will need to drive to any SD tourist sites or downtown (but you'll need a car anywhere you stay in SD) 4. Not a luxury resort by any means - upscale dorm furniture in living areas, but functional 5. Not cheap compared to other nearby hotels 6. Pool somewhat small (but again, this is not a luxury resort) 7. Yes, you can hear airplanes sometimes (you are next to the airport, after all) 8. Limited TV selections - not full cable line-up (kids had no Nickelodeon, and you had to pay for Disney (?)) 9. Don't quite understand the sliding door to a 2 foot deep balcony - looks good at a distance, but practically useless. 10. Rooms are in two buildings not attached by indoor walkway to the lobby building - need to walk outside to get breakfast, etc. Not a big deal - only 20 feet or so. So in the end, we'd stay there again. Since we paid over $200/night for a 2BR suite, I would hope that non-spring break rates are lower. It's not a luxury property, not a resort, not close to tourist sites, not cheap, and not romantic - but we still really liked it. Go figure...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly removed from the city center”
Reviews.Author: Bicholisto
Reviews.Content: A good choice in San Diego. Some rooms are better than others (we were initially offered one with very little light - and were staying a whole week, which would have been depressing). You can hear the aeroplanes but it wasn´t loud enough to be an issue for us. One objection we had is that our credit card was deducted the full weeks bill plus a few hundred dollars damage deposit from the moment of check-in - without us being told about it. If you are near your credit limit this might be a problem. The hotel is comfortable and modern, with well appointed spacious rooms and kitchen. You get a pretty good breakfast, and (mon-thurs) a passably adequate evening meal (with beer and wine), all in the price. A good deal for families. There is great parkland immediately by the hotel, which is a big plus, so you can walk safely to shops and restaurants in Liberty Station. Recommended are Trader Joes for food and drink shopping, nearby Oggis for beer and Sushiya for inexpensive sushi. Also, walk 20 mins along the waterside park to Steals Winebar. Another great place is Point Loma seafood (try lunch there) - walk or drive towards Shelter Island and it is on your left on the waterfront). Oh, and take a bus or taxi to Ocean Beach to enjoy happy hour at The Vine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a good rate!!!”
Reviews.Author: MacFamily35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my daughter and her friend stayed at the Homewood Suites for 2 nights while on a trip to San Diego. I booked it based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. It is a beautiful hotel, great suites with a kitchen and two tvs, clean and modern. it is in a great location, near downtown San Diego and not to far to the beach. The breakfast was very good in a beautiful dining area. Service was good and it was overall a comfortable hotel at a very good rate. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with no fear of finding anything bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BSSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood suites in September 09 as part of a road trip in California. We stayed for 4 nights before driving to Vegas. The hotel was lovely. Check in was smooth and quick. The room was brilliant - it included a full kitchen, living area with sofa and TV, bedroom with comfy bed and (another) TV, balcony overlooking the river and a great bathroom with toiletries. Everything was clean and comfortable and the room was nicely decorated. The hotel includes a free dinner on weekdays, which we only had once because most of our stay was over the weekend. The dinner that we had was filling, not fantastic, but did the trick at the end of a long day. Pool was on the small size for a larger hotel, but was never full and usually quiet and relaxing. The outside seating area was great to chill out at the end of the day. The gym was good, again almost always empty. The hotel also offers free use of PC's which have internet access... which is always helpful. Really, if you are staying in SD, you are probably looking to see the sights and use the hotel for relaxing after a day out. This provides a great base for doing exactly that. For the price, well worth the TA number one in SD. Would stay there again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: daxter8
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Homewood Suites, this hotel has free parking, free breakfast and light dinner ( Mon - Thurs). The location is great and there are restaurants within walking distance. It is a short drive to Seaworld and shopping Centres. The hotel was very clean and quiet, loved the fact it has kitchen amenities, a laundry, pool and two TVs. We stayed in 15 hotels on our holiday and this was the only place that had this. The staff are helpful and friendly, note they will not organise tours for you, I had to ring and do that myself but very minor hiccup. All in all I would definitely stay here again it is a wonderful family oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and convenience; kitchen facilities great for families”
Reviews.Author: AdelaidianTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a modern upper mid- market all- suite hotel with excellent facilities. It is calibrated toward longer stays, with facilities which make it conveient for families and business travellers alike. These include daily breakfast and a nightly meal included in the reasonable room price. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable, and the location is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: HHSteve
Reviews.Content: I average about 20 nights a month in hotels, all over the world, and am very picky and critical. I usually never write my review until after I check-out, so I can capture the entire experience. I am currently at night 3 of a 32 night stay at this hotel and already know that it is the best hotel that I have ever stayed in. The location is perfect for what I am here doing. The service is incredible. Every single employee is friendly, courteous, and helpful; and there are a large number of employees assigned to each task. The desk always seems to have 2 or 3 attendants. Breakfast and Dinner service is provided two or three people as well. Senior management is everywhere, from wandering the hallways to asking how things are in the lobby. The meals are great. At many Homewood Suites the evening Manager's reception is a joke. At this one, both Breakfast and Dinner have been world class, all three days. Delicious and healthy. The internet here is very fast. It gets bogged down at some peak times, but over-all is the fastest I've every had in a hotel. Video conferencing with my daughter was better from the hotel than it was in our house testing it out before the trip. Yes, I'm saying that the hotel internet works better than my Comcast Broadband at home (some of the time). I don't watch TV, but there are two huge flat screen sets in my room. I think that they have premium channels beyond the norm as well. I am 100% happy with everything about this hotel. If I had to find flaws, I would say that the rooms could be a little bigger, as the king sized bed in my suite is kind of crammed in. Also, as a HHonors Platinum Customer staying for 32 days, a free upgrade would have been nice. Between the people that work here, the location they built in, and the speed of the internet, I would say that this should be the model for all future Hilton properties.

Reviews.Title: “One night but we were totally impresed”
Reviews.Author: tr1sho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites Dec 30th. After a day at the zoo we were so pleased to find such a comfortable place to relax and unwind after walking all day. The staff was top notch. The free dinner was so plentiful and good. The wine & beer were also a huge plus. We retreated back to our room after printing out our boarding passes at the computer area. My husband called the front desk to find out how to connect to the FREE wireless internet connection. We had a guy at our door in 2 minutes to set it up with us. He also changed the batteries in our remote control on the TV. Special thanks to Joey for that!! That is some personal service. This place was awesome.. close to the bay and had a full kitchen. The personal services were what made this place stand out. We loved it and will be back next time we are in San Diego. One note: Get to the buffet breakfast and dinner early during any peak holiday time or you'll be in quite a line. Food is just that good!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: VBC65
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel stay ever. The breakfast was great and the dinner saved us lots of money. There is a pizza place and a Sushi place right across from the parking lot that we tried and were not disappointed. The pizza place is a little pricey but the food was good. The sushi was very, very inexpensive compared to other sushi places that we have been to. The hotel staff was amazing. They even do your grocery shopping for no charge!!! The pool is heated which made our 8 year old very happy. We visited the Zoo, Sea World and LegoLand and they were all very close to this hotel and easy to get to. I will never stay in a different hotel chain ever! We were there for a week and it felt like home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its Number One ranking”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: After reading about all the families staying here, I was hesitant to stay as a solo traveler. However, I could not have been more pleased! The front desk staff were more than helpful and even remembered my name. My one bedroom suite was extremely comfortable, clean, bright, and quiet. The widescreen televisions were outstanding. The breakfast buffet was varied and substantial, AND the coffee was good! Since I did not have a car, I moved to a different hotel in the downtown Gaslamp District (see Hotel Solamar), after only two nights, so that I could do more sightseeing on foot. I wish I had stayed put at the Homewood!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - fantastic has to be one of the best”
Reviews.Author: callanders4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a 2 bedroom with 2 bathroom suite with kitchen on the ground floor for 3 nights. Was one of the best hotels in our travels to LA - San Deigo and the Hawaii. These guys really know how to look after people. The room was very clean and modern, having the ability to prepare a home cooked meal was a treat and much easier on the wallet after a week eating out every day. Very close to all attractions yet far enough away to give you peace and quite. Vons suppermarket around the corner was fantastic.. Make sure you obtain a discount savings card ..their free and you save a bundle. All the staff were very freindly and helpfull ...and no nasty unwanted fees have appeard on the credit card !! A room safe would have been nice ..but the do offer free safe keeping of items at the main desk in a saftey deposit box. The free breakfast was about average.. but I and everyone else in our family group dont like powdered egg and bacon that you can see through ...but thats pretty much what you get in the USA. The waffles did go some way to countering this slight problem. It's really the little things that count and the Homewood suites at Liberty Station have their act together ..I would have no problem recomending this place and hope to one day return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: lotsofslots
Reviews.Content: This is a Great hotel!!! The staff is one of the best. Everyone at this hotel goes out of their way to see all your needs are met. From housekeeping to management they are courteous, friendly and will to help with anything you need. The hotel is CLEAN and very nice. Rooms are quiet and set up well. Each room has a balcony of some kind and the view from upper floors to the pool and water area is wonderful. We stayed 2 nights before a cruise then returned when we got off the ship and stayed another night. The management let us leave our car in the lot and called a cab service to get us to the cruise port. We wanted to go to a movie and they found the closest and gave us directions. As it was Thanksgiving they had a list of open restaurants and prices if you wanted Thanksgiving dinner. Food at Welcome reception and breakfast was wonderful and the service staff kept everything clean and filled.This is a great hotel for all ages as there is a game room and other activities. We will stay here again if we are in the area. Our thanks to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “A TREAT FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: flaggytravellers
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We arrived for thanksgiving weekend after driving down from LAX.. a little cautious because we had booked ourselves not through travel agent but we were so happy with our choice. The reviews on trip advisor had been spot on. We had a two bedroom suite, to describe the room; kitchenette with dining, lounge area separating two bedrooms each with own bathroom and wardrobe. Free Internet, Free Parking, 3 TVs, full size fridge, free breakfast and onsite Laundry... We encountered no noise issues from hotel or airport... and our suite was right next to the elevator.... slept like babies. Really comfy beds. The hotel is close to Vons and Trader Joes for supplies and some restaurants in the carpark... we only tried Oggis and thought it was not too bad.... Great location for travelling to Seaworld and the Zoo... no more than 15 minutes from each. Our tips for San Diego. Must go to Seaport Village and USS Midway Old Town for Mexican food... amazing and worth the wait Island Prime Restaurant... even if only for the amazing views of San Diego and finally definately stay here especially if travelling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with kids!”
Reviews.Author: 4boysDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! The Monday through Thursday dinners were great. There is a pool (as in billiards) room off of the dining area. My big kids would finish dinner (or breakfast) and then go in to play pool while we finished feeding the baby. All of the meals we ate there were wonderful. The place is extremely clean. We had a 2 room suite that was very spacious and nice. The kitchen appliances were all stainless steal and very clean. The housekeeping did an excellent job every day. I really appreciated having fresh clean towels on a daily basis. The grounds were beautiful. Our kids had a lot of nice area to run around. There is a basketball court that my children were able to check out a ball and play on. The location was excellent too. The Liberty Station shops and restaurants are all right across the street. We had both Greek and Mexican food from the restaurants there that was very good. I loved being so close to Balboa Park and the AIrport too. All and all I would highly recommend this hotel. My oldest son asked if it is a 5 star hotel while we were there and told me that was the best place we have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “+P+E+R+F+E+C+T+”
Reviews.Author: Leentje666
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and my father in law, so we needed two rooms. Since we rented a car, it didn't matter in which part of the city we stayed. In or around Gaslamp was ridiculous expensive (we stayed three nights starting on a friday), so I checked hotels around the bay. I found out that is would be cheaper to book a 2 bedroom suite, rather than booking two separate rooms. Initially I was looking at The Half Moon Inn, but read the reviews on Homewood suites, and decided to go with Homewood suites. The price on both hotels was similar (on Hotels.com). I payed 500€ in total (around $700) for a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite. About $116 a night per room, if you look at it that way AND you got the nice extra of a small living room, dining area and fully equipped kitchen (not a kitchenette, but a big one!) The suite was in an excellent condition, very well kept. One room comes with a queen bed and the other one with a king size. Every room has its own closet. It was very nice that there was free internet, wired and wireless. We didn't have the complimentary breakfast though, we like to go to Café 1134 on Coronado when we are in San Diego. This was actually our best hotel experience ever... It was very, very nice, but absolutely not uptight. We stayed in suites before, but this one gave us a much more comfortable feeling. It's nice to come "home" after a busy day in the city and not in some room with just a bed and a chair. In the evening we just sat in the living room, like we were at home... consider it a home away from home :-) And don't worry about airplane noise...They don't fly at night.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: We were visiting the San Diego area for a few days and wanted to stay close to downtown without spending a fortune so we decided, after reading the reviews, to try the Homewood. It is only a 5 minute drive to downtown core. The hotel was perfect in every way. The rooms were very large and came with a full kitchen if you so desired to eat in. The breakfast buffet was better than average and the weekday complimentary snacks and beverages in the lounge are a nice touch. The only little complaint I can think of is that the pool is a little on the small side for the size of the hotel. We have stayed in San Diego many times before but in the past always chose the beach areas. This place is not near the beach but is very central to all the attractions the city has to offer. For the money, I think it is the best value going.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT IN ALL WAYS”
Reviews.Author: Topbloke68
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night for trip to Seaworld with our 3 kids - 12,10 and 7. We stayed in a room with two separate bedrooms, and pull out sofa in separate lounge area. Kitchen if you need it too! Overall modern, excellent facility. Check in very quick, heaps of parking, close to everything including many restaurants to eat at. Breakfast included in tariff which was way above average standard. Wireless speeds were good and business centre to do some print outs on. Heaps of other facilities such as pool, laundry and billard room. I would absolutely stay here again. Tariff I would say is OK for what you get, but is also at the more expensive end of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: travlingal51
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here at the end of a cruise. We were looking for something near the airport and this fit the bill. This was our first stay at a Homewood Suites. The room really was a suite with a separate bedroom that even had a ceiling fan. There was also a living area and kitchen, with 2 burners, a full size fridge, microwave and even a dishwasher. It would be nice if you had a family staying to have the kitchen, we didn't use it. The hotel was located in a pretty area and had a nice business center and decent breakfast. The only complaint I have is that the room was noisy, the walls must be very thin, you could hear people taking in the next room, children crying, etc. When walking down the hall you could hear people clinking dishing and silverware if they were eating. I sleep with earplugs, so it really wasn't a problem. Just be aware that the walls are thin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to public transportation and the airport, good eats a short walk”
Reviews.Author: Audra631
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a wonderful trip to San Diego. We were there for a week and really made use of the fabulous public transportation system that the city offers. (I won't say more, but if you're interested see the separate comment I posed on this subject.) The hotel is in a pretty nice complex with a Courtyard by Marriott as well as several restaurants that had above average food (types: Italian, Thai, Sushi, Mexican). All the food was fresh, well made, and reasonably priced. Even the take out Mexican place had great food. The hotel chain specializes in suites and for people who need the extra space to travel with children or to accommodate different schedules it can be great. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and my major complaint was the suite was on the small size, particularly the bedroom. Still the space is well designed and there was ample storage for clothes in the closet, bedroom dresser and living room dresser. The kitchenette featured a full refrigerator, 2 burner electric range, microwave, sink and dishwasher. Also provided were utensils and dishes for 4, basic pots and cooking implements, toaster, and coffee pot. The hotel does offer the standard buffet breakfast in the mornings and manager's reception weekday evenings, but we tend not to make use of them so I can't report on that. The hotel was nicely laid out with a main building in the center offering the buffet, store, business office and front desk among other things and the North and South buildings having most of the guest rooms. Each of these buildings had 4 floors with elevators, guest rooms on all floors, a laundry room, a 3rd floor terrace and an exercise room. The hotel featured pleasant styling in all the buildings and a generally welcoming feeling. The patio between the two residential buildings featured outdoor seating and barbecues for use by guests. Also available was a pool table in the main building, a pool near the North building, and a basketball court by the South building. All in all I would recommend this hotel especially for the location, but the accommodations had plenty to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Mutandis
Reviews.Content: On booking this hotel, I was a little perplexed as to why it would be amongst the top ranked hotels in San Diego. Having stayed there, I remain a little unclear as to why it holds the top spot but I think the answer is that it does-what -it-does very well. It doesn't have the usual attributes of a popular hotel - it's located in the car park of a shopping centre and isn't particularly luxurious. However, the rooms are very spacious, the staff are unerringly helpful and the breakfast quite hearty. It is also very near to the airport and located next to a park. In sum, the Homewood Suites doesn't seek to be in any way upmarket - it aims to do an outstanding job of providing comfortable and welcoming accomodations and certainly achieves that.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Her Again - No Question”
Reviews.Author: randy_howarth
Reviews.Content: With two children living in San Diego and a new grandson - we plan to visit as often as possible and will definitely stay at this hotel. The rooms were clean, well equipped and it is great having a suite with 2 flat screen tv's. I needed a place to work during the day and the two tables in the living area were perfect. The location is fantastic -- very close to downtown, airport -- and yet removed enough to be calm and peaceful. Hotel sits on a bay inlet with walkways and well manicured greenspaces. Breakfast is provided at no cost 5 days a week, as well as a light dinner. The pool area is adequate with plenty of seating areas. There is a Starbucks, Pizza restaurant and a few others about a block away. a shopping center with restaurants and good church are all within 1 mile.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location when traveling with children”
Reviews.Author: tcdash
Reviews.Content: There were a total of three adults and two children(5yrs and 2yrs old) in our party. We rented a two room suite which included a kitchen and two full baths. The adults stayed in the rooms while the kids slept on the pull out sofa. The beds were comfy and the two bathrooms made getting ready in the mornings quick and easy. The breakfast and light dinner that is included in your stay is great for those traveling with children. We didn't have to wake up extra early to go and eat somewhere before heading out for the day and at the end of the day the light dinner was perfect and kid friendly (i.e mac and cheese, taco bar, etc). There are also grocery stores and restaurants near by which alowed us to buy drinks and snacks for the kids and keep them in our room. The location of this hotel is also great for those planning to see the theme parks. It was about 20-25 mins to both sea world and san diego zoo and about 45 mins to legoland. It is also right down the street from the airport but you would never know it. You don't hear the planes flying over head. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel stays ever”
Reviews.Author: kmrau
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a 1-br suite, but were upgraded to a 2-br when we checked in. We stayed for 5 nights. The staff were professional and the service was good. The suite itself was immaculate with a good kitchenette. The property is fairly close to the airport and is about a 5-minute drive from downtown and Sea World. Overall, one of our most comfortable and memorable stays. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “A little hard to find, tucked in behind the strip mall”
Reviews.Author: ZippyPinhead
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not so easy to find for first-timers. I had the address and had looked it up via an online map, but we still had to ring them to be sure of the location. Hint: if you can see the old navy ship (?) which is (now?) set in concrete, you're getting very warm. But the hotel is well-hidden behind a strip mall/convention center. We stayed a night at this hotel while making a trip to San Diego for a conference at a nearby location. The rate for the room was $139 plus tax, if I recall correctly. The hotel is not far from the airport. I know this in part because I could hear jets coming and going continuously. If you're a light sleeper, this detail could be a bother, but we were not really put out by the constant air traffic. I slept OK for the first night in a hotel (which is often an issue for me). The room we were given had a kitchenette. It was wasted on us, but I can imagine it might be useful for some folks. I did appreciate the refrigerator, which was spacious and empty. Sadly our stay was very brief, or I probably would have grabbed some beers at the local market to chill in the refrigerator. We did note that the cabinets in the room were well-stocked with plates, pots, and stuff one might use to cook. But again, we were only in the room for about 8 hours, most of it spent sleeping, so it was not of use or interest to us. The room we got was reasonably spacious, but the layout was sort of odd. It's one room, not a suite, and at one end there is a couch and coffee table. At the other end there is a bed. The TV is between the two, on a high dresser. If you want to watch TV-- the channels were limited-- you need to swivel the TV so it can be seen from either the bed or the sofa. There was a balcony, but it was just for show. It was so narrow as to be all but unusable. The hotel has at least one workout room/gym, but we did not use it. Free breakfast is available from the hotel, too. On the morning we ate they had scrambled eggs, home-style fried potatoes, and breads, etc. It was appreciated, even though we were not quite blown away by the quality. I've stayed elsewhere and had much better free breakfasts. Overall, This was a reasonable place to stay for the night. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: winedoenecke
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel for families or business travelers. It is close to everything including the airport , beach, bay waterfront and downtown. The new Liberty station park area nearby was relaxing and fun. An exceptional bargain, with great breakfasts, snacks in the evenings, large rooms with suites and kitchens. All around an incredible vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: bonerad
Reviews.Content: Because of my son's severe food allergies, having a kitchen when we travel is a necessity. Most suites I have stayed in with kitchens are plagued by pests. Either because this hotel keeps their rooms clean, or because this is a new property, I felt safe enough to leave food out on the kitchen counters. During our 3 day stay, there were no signs of pests. Modern furnishings with 2 LCD HDTV's. Large bathroom and vanity. Complimentary breakfast, but also a local shopping center on the other side of the parking lot (free parking), with decent restaurants. Supermarkets are down the street in Liberty Station. Central location to downtown, zoo, Seaworld and beaches, it is a little far from the freeway. A nice home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Baylorbear95
Reviews.Content: We booked two one-bedroom suites using Hilton points for two nights at this hotel. Upon arrival, the staff asked if we would consider switching to a two-bedroom unit. They only charged us the points for a one-bedroom for one unit, and the other unit we had booked was refunded. We were very happy with this, and the two-bedroom unit we were given was great. The only drawback was that it was a handicap accessible room, which meant the only thing separating the large shower from the toilet was a curtain. Since we had small children, a bathtub would have been preferable. Every time someone took a shower, the entire floor of the bathroom was covered in water. It was a minor inconvenience, though, and not a big enough issue for us to repack and ask to have a different room. Everything was clean and the grounds were lovely. It was too cold for us to use the pool, but we thought the view overlooking the river was nice. For us, the location was excellent. There are several restaurants in the complex. It was a short drive to Castillo National Monument, which I would recommend. The breakfast was typical of Homewood Suites. It seemed a policeman's convention was using the hotel, and so at times the breakfast area seemed crowded. However, we were always able to find a table to use, and the staff worked to keep food and seating areas available and sanitary.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value”
Reviews.Author: The-Duck-Family
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of Homewod Suites and have always enjoyed them. However, this hotel did not meet our expectations. Our room was small, but clean. The morning breakfast was worth what we paid for it, free. The food was lukewarm, at best, unless you make a waffle. The dinners we had there were terrible. Although, the servicemen seemed to really enjoy the free beer. The dinning/dinner area was always very crowded. The outdoor pool is not very private, along the Esplanade. We wish we had stayed somewhere else. The staff was very pleasant though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But A Distance”
Reviews.Author: nem
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton member and I've stayed at numerous Homewood Suites. This hotel was similar to other Homewood Suites. I enjoyed my stay. However, there were a few things that I did not enjoy like the distance from places in SD and the noise. The Pros: Clean Hotel Close to Vons Grocery Store, Trader Joes, Starbucks, and numerous of restaurants Within walking distance to a park and playground for those with younger children Complimentary Breakfast Close to airport Free Parking and lots of spaces The Cons: Not that close to Mission Beach, downtown, and Balboa Park as I thought Not easily accessible to the highways-takes longer than you think to get to and from places The Noise-I could hear clearly what my neighbors next door where doing. Not something that you want to hear especially if you have young children trying to sleep Small Rooms-Compare to other HS that I've stayed at, I thought the rooms lack square footage and storage space. Make sure that if you are a family of 4 or more no matter how small your children are; get a two bedroom. The one bedroom suite was way too small for myself, my husband, my 3 year old, and 4 months old child. We felt cramped and we are all skinny and small people. Especially since you have to enter the bedroom to utilize the bathroom. I like how Hilton has their Embassy Suites laid out much better. Lack Of Space In Dining Area-there were never enough chairs and tables available for breakfast or dinner unless you were there before start time. Dining Area Location-The dining area is in a seperate building from the hotel rooms. So, it's a bit of an inconvenience if you have small children, want to take your food back to your room, or if you need to go back to your room for something. At other HS, I will just get my food and take it back to my room. This HS did not have any of those food containers for you to carry food back to your room...which would have helped because there were never enough spaces to eat in the dining area. I will recommend this hotel if you are doing things within the Point Loma area of San Diego. However, the location was quite a bit of distance to the places that we visited in San Diego. The next time we will stay in Hotel Circle like our previous trip. That location was easily accessible to highways, beaches, downtown, and Balboa Park. Great hotel, but didn't like how long it took for us to drive to places in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like noise”
Reviews.Author: m00958
Reviews.Content: Pros The hotel is set in a wonderful location, and is very handy for SeaWorld and the zoo. There is a great evening walk to be had along the waterfront. Just across the parking lot is a small commercial centre with a range of restaurants. The hotel has a free evening meal (with free beer!!) from Mon-Thur. The quality is not amazing, but it certainly saved us a few $ on eating out. The rooms were a good size and clean. Good laundry facilities, exercise room and pool. Free wireless internet throughout the hotel. Cons Without doubt the noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in. It didn't start well when we were given a room for disabled people, without being told. Being 6'3" I don't need sinks etc any lower than they already are. So, after trekking back to reception we got another room. The replacement room was next to the lift. It didn't appear to be a problem, until we went to bed. Our bedroom was right next to the lift shaft, and I don't know who was using the lift at 3am, but ti was certainly on the move throughout the night. The next day we moved room. The third room was much better. Although the final room we stayed in was quieter, it was still noisy for 3 reasons: 1) The hotel has no sound proofing. The people above could easily be heard walking around. Luckily they always stopped being noisy at a decent hour, so no complaints were necessary. 2) The hotel is almost right in the flight path for the airport. Not a massive problem as the planes seemed to stop taking off about 22:30, and didn't start again until about 6:30. 3) The absolute worst, and noisiest, thing was the air conditioning system. Each room has it's own system that feeds all the rooms in the suite. It's very noisy. This could be controlled within the suite by turning the temperature right up (stupidly there is no off switch!). However, due to the lack of sound proofing the air con systems of the suite above and below could be heard clearly, and when laying on the pillow the whole sound reverberated even more. My wife and I found this insufferable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: news222
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 4 days, 3 nights for a business trip. Not having been to San Diego before, I also played tourist when not working. The hotel and front desk staff provided a wealth of tourist information that was extremely helpful. I'd arrived much earlier than check-in time, so they offered to phone my cell when my room became ready. I had a king suite which was quite large and perfectly clean. It was a little bit noisy with exterior doors near my room and noise from the room above, but overall not bad at all, and I such a pretty view of the waterfront. A little bit of airplane noise being right next to the airport, but I found it to be very minor. The property sits on NTC park's waterfront, so a short walk or jog takes you down the NTC park Esplanade, or over to the Spanish Landing waterfront. Free and plentiful parking, free and plentiful breakfast and dinners with complimentary wine and beer Mon-Thurs evenings make most Homewood's a great value, not to mention the rooms all have full kitchens as well if you prefer to eat in. Von's and Trader Joe's, not to mention many restaurant options are within walking distance. A short 10 minute drive gets you to almost every major site in San Diego including the beaches, theme parks, downtown, seaport village, or the bridge to Coronado (or you can take a ferry), and the property is in a very clean, safe area. I didn't use them but they seemed to have a very nice pool, sportcourt and gameroom if you have kids. Their free wireless internet was one of the best hotel wireless services I've ever used!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, property and great location”
Reviews.Author: travmama
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights based on Trip Advisor reviews. It was perfect for our needs. You will need a car if you stay here. Parking is adequate and free. The room was spotless and comfortable. The room had a very well stocked and fully equipped kitchen. I believe during the week there were free light dinners but we were never there for the meals. Breakfast was very good. You aren't far from the airport and there is a hotel shuttle. The trolley station is only a few miles down the road to get into the city if you chose not to drive in and pay for parking. Old Town is very near the trolley station as well as the San Diego trolley tour stop/ticket sales. The area is new and very nice with new shopping areas and restaurants. We loved Sammy's Wood Fired Pizza (a local chain) and we ate there twice - they serve so much more then pizza and even had Gluten free pizza for my daughter that was delicious! There is also a grocery store here. I will definitely stay here again next time I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: fernster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days while our family spent vacation in the San Diego area. This is the second summer we have stayed at this location; used Hilton points on both times. The word must be getting out because the hotel was much busier this summer versus last. Rooms are great and the staff is very friendly. The breakfast buffet was the usual Hilton fare. We didn't eat the evening meal that is offered during the week (did drink some of the free beer, though). The hotel is on a harbor inlet with very nice landscaping and walking trails. It is very close to Sea World, Zoo and airport. In the same parking lot is a Oggi's Pizza (recommended), a sushi restaurant, Subway, Starbucks, a mexican eatery with counter service, a greek restaurant, and an ice cream/yogurt place. The hotel also has 2 outdoor gas grills for your use as well as an outdoor sports court. The entire family loves staying here. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Lovetovisit19
Reviews.Content: We stayed August 9th and 10th, 2009. Overall our stay was fine. We had a cold reception at the front desk at check-in. Our suite was only moderately clean. When we called the desk to report the items that needed attention no apology was offered. That being said the room was comfortable, quiet and very pretty.. The dining room staff was excellent and made our stay worthwhile. They were hard working and friendly keeping the buffet-styled food service running smoothly. The food was goo

Reviews.Title: “Great Hub for the Comic Con!”
Reviews.Author: Mely_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and two of our friends stayed in a studio suite at the Homewood Suites Liberty Station. We wanted a sizable room for the four of us, and Homewood Suites included breakfast so that was a bonus. The check in was very easy, and the front desk was helpful. They were booked solid, but able to put us near the pool and get us into our room a full two hours before check in. They gave us a rollaway at no additional charge, and gave us maps for San Diego. Room: Clean, Spacious, new - there was a nice ceiling fan over the King sized bed, and that was so helpful. The kitchen was new and cleanl Hotel itself: Nice outdoor patio on the 3rd floor with awesome views and tables, chairs, and umbrellas. Great place to relax with a beer, but ... no beer allowed! My only complaint. Breakfast: included daily. The breakfast room was clean and welcoming, and the staff kept everything full. The food was better than continental, and definitely good to get you started. Waffles, eggs, bacon, toast, bagels, coffee, juice, etc. "Light Dinner": Monday through Thursday they serve a managers reception "Light Dinner." We checked it out on Thursday, and it was great! Totally above my expectations. They served tacos (not authentic or anything, but free and plentiful", rice, beans, and a salad bar. They also served free beer and wine. So great for people on a budget. (Or for those of us who were going out later.:) Pool: average to nice. Great warm water. Clean towels poolside. You can see the water from the pool. Nice view. Front Desk : after the front desk experience it seems like it went downhill a bit. They were still helpful, just not quite as friendly, and maybe they were just overly busy. The Comic Con flooded the city! Area: you need a car to stay here! Free parking, though, so that is good. it is a good four miles to the convention center. There is a nice little pizza brewery right in the parking lot, and that made things really easy. Oggis. Stick with the pizza! Lots of choices and pretty good. There is a Trader Joes and a Safeway-esque grocery store a few blocks away. Walkable as long as you aren't carrying tons of groceries. The Homewood Stuies have full kitchens. All in all it was a great trip, awesome for falmilies, awesome for budget considerations, and definitely a great location for pre or post cruisers. And for next year's Comic Con - great because you can hike the 3/4 mile to the Sheraton and take the free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get and VERY noisy!”
Reviews.Author: kitty22217
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the review from the previous traveller 'Deepwood' this is a very noisy hotel and not condusive to a restful nights sleep. The noise in the hallway from doors slamming, from very early in the morning, the noise from the aircraft taking off from before 7am and the noise from the air condition unit are all extremely annoying and takes it's toll after a few days. We didn't really find it too convenient to downtown at all. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly but the early evening snack was very poor quality so don't count on it to replace dinner as a way of saving money, we had to go out and eat every night we were there. Really wanted to like this hotel and it does have it's good points but just felt it was a clean, well run middle of the road hotel with an expensive price tab. Felt it was way overpriced for what it actually is.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: dfabulous63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Homewood Suites in July 2009 on our first trip to San Diego. At first I was afraid to book something that was not directly downtown but, boy, was I glad I did!!! This place is perfect. More like an apartment than a hotel, we had a one bedroom suite with full kitchen. Plenty of FREE parking, convenient location to EVERYTHING in San Diego, ability to walk to nice restaurants and much more! We loved the park just outside our door and we strolled along the path several afternoons to relax by the water. We also loved the outdoor fireplace which we enjoyed every night. There's a Von's grocery and Trader Joe's nearby and so we grilled out steaks one night at one of the 2 gas grills located in the common area. The Go San Diego card was nice that they gave us also. We used it at the Pizza place across the parking lot the first night for a free appetizer. The staff were very nice and friendly. We stayed in the South Bldg. As I stated earlier I was worried about not booking downtown but this place was perfect in that I could get away from the crowds of downtown and relax in what felt like a nice family neighborhood. I actually began to feel like this was my home. But, like Cinderella, it had to end. I would definitely recommend this place and I would definitely stay here again. Oh, and did I mention, I was totally free because I used my Hilton Honors Points!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, location, meals, and room!”
Reviews.Author: keeks2020
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Homewood Suites in Carlsbad last year and really liked the hotel. The one in San Diego was just as great. It is close to the zoo, Sea World, Old Town, Seaport Village...really everything you want to go to. We spent the day at La Jolla and that was only about 20 minutes away. There is a Trader Joe's right near the hotel, as well as Oggi's Pizza and other restaurants so it's convenient for food. We have a 20 month old son and cooked a lot. It's great to have a full kitchen. The hotel also serves a full breakfast and dinners M-Th at no extra charge. They also have coffee/tea/cocoa all day long which is nice. There is a pool table, a nice pool and it's right by the bay so i was able to run along the bank and that was really nice. There's a huge park nearby. There are BBQ's and a fireplace and it really has a cozy atmosphere. The best part is the room. We had a 2 room suite which was huge! A lot of room for our son to run around in and we had a lot of room to relax. I would definitely stay at a Homewood Suites in any city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Anyone...And it's new!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2VacationForever
Reviews.Content: I am going to start this review with the fact that this hotel is new. A lot of hotels are great, but they get worn down quickly, just with average wear and tear, and this will do the same, but for now it is new. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. They serve dinner on Sunday through Thursday which is nice for business travelers. Breakfast was great. Nothing super fabulous, but better than most. Value - Excellent Rooms - Clean Location - Safe, nice area, but a drive to get anywhere. Service - Except one breakfast man who took on my dad when he said "fake eggs", everyone was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: ginger2007
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Homewood Suites Liberty Station while attending Comic Con from July 21 to July 26, 2009. The location is fabulous - very near the waterfront and near restaurants and grocery stores. Within walking distance (across the parking lot) is Oggi's Pizza where we ate one night. Not great pizza but everything else looked good. Also, in that same area is a Starbucks and a few other businesses. A short driving distance away is Von's and Trader Joe's. Von's is pricey - there is a Ralph's down Rosecrans street about 2 miles that is much more reasonable (off of Sports Arena drive). The room was completely stocked as far as the kitchen went. We bought food and made sandwiches for the Con. The bathroom is tiny but with only 3 of us, that wasn't an issue. We had the one bedroom suite. It is a quiet hotel - we never heard airplanes even though they were flying over all the time. The A/C was great - never uncomfortable and the bedroom had a ceiling fan. The hotel employees were very welcoming and nice too. The breakfast was fine. Not great but good enough. The waffles were the best part as was the free coffee every morning. The buffet also included sausage, oatmeal, cereal, breads, fruit and potatoes. The light dinners I can't comment on because, due to Comic Con going late every night, we missed out on that. We did walk by during Taco night and they looked pretty darn good! This will be our new San Diego hotel from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place - would definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: LorMo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Homewood Suites Liberty Station for 3 nights, July 13-16, and loved it. We were traveling with teenagers who had just turned 16 & 18, so the two bedroom suite was perfect for us - two bedrooms, two bathrooms, sitting area, kitchen - and 3 flat screen televisions. There was enough room for all of us to be comfortable and also have our privacy. Very good value, great location, very clean, beautiful grounds, friendly staff, lots of (free) parking. Would definitely stay there again if we are in San Diego (which we hope to be!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: kwick58
Reviews.Content: Spent a fabulous week in a 2 BR suite in July. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Grounds well kept. Plenty of outdoor seating and several outdoor fireplaces for cool nights. Located near an old naval base that is being rehabbed with plenty of shops and restaraunts. Also next to a beautiful new park right on the bay with lots of walking and bike paths, play areas for small children and soccer fields. Great breakfast served daily and light dinner every Mon-Thur with complimentary beer and wine, all included in the price of the room. A real money saver when traveling with a family. Transportation to and from airport. Also the Trolley comes right to the hotel for tour pick up. Would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pf-rider
Reviews.Content: We returned from six nights at the Homewood Suites and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and the dinners and breakfasts were suprisingly tasty. The room was clean with a view of the channel coming off the bay. We look forward to future stays at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New equals clean!”
Reviews.Author: VickiScottsdale
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 4 night stay at this property. If you're like me and appreciate a clean facility, this is the place to stay. Upon check in we were given room 168, which unfortunately was a bottom floor room in the south building with a window that faced a wall. They front desk graciously gave us another room in the north building. We were in room 401, corner room with a large window overlooking the pool and the water, with another large window in the bedroom with a view of the fireplace seating area. Very nice. We loved the location and amenties offered as far as stores and restaurants within walking distance. Everything is new. Wonderful walking path. The staff was pleasant and accommodating. The free breakfast was good, although I'm not a fan of the powdered eggs they used for the scrambled eggs. There's a Starbuck's within walking distance, along with a Von's and Trader Joe's to help stock the full size refridgerator in the room. Lovely property, great location. The other reviews pretty well sum up all the benefits of staying at this property. Let's hope they don't raise the prices once everyone finds out about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: beckyt220
Reviews.Content: While i've certainly stayed at fancier and more luxurious hotels, i feel like this is the first hotel I've ever stayed at, that's really understood what it means to be hospitable. All employees that i've encountered during my two week stay were warm, welcoming and made me feel at home (especially gary, rachel and duncan). They're genuinely happy to help you and are just super laid back, friendly, and nice. While they really made the hotel special, the warm breakfasts every morning, the week night dinners and the free coffee throughout the day were like the icing on the cake. The rooms are just the right size and very clean, and after a week into our stay, the hotel left little gift bags on our door with slippers in them and a thank you note. I love that attention to detail. Also, in case you're as lazy as i am, i never once had to do dishes..... my housekeeper loaded and ran the dishwasher whenever necessary. Just make sure you leave your housekeeper a nice tip when you leave. They probably work the hardest out of anyone. Bottom line is i loved staying at the homewood suites at liberty station. I was there for business, but after staying at this hotel it felt like a vacation. We were so spoiled that i honestly didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 2 weeks in California of which 6 nights we spent in this hotel and what a great place to stay! A lovely hotel in a very attractive location we were really impressed with everything that this hotel has to offer. The rooms are fantastic and more like small apartments than hotel rooms. Ours was a one bedroom suite and along with the kitchen appliances and kitchen equipment, there was a flat screen TV in the sitting area and also in the bedroom, a very comfortable king-size bed and bathroom with shower and bath. The room also had doors that lead to a small balcony and my one suggestion would be that chairs are supplied to enable you to sit out, as although we had a smoking room for my partner, he still preferred to smoke here rather than in the room itself. Breakfast was excellent, although my advice would be to get there before 9.00am as that’s when the main crowd arrive and (especially at weekends) there can be queues, particularly at the waffle making machines. Other options included scrambled egg, home fries, bacon and/or sausage patties, toast, bagels, muffins, cereals, juice, yoghurt, fruit etc. Just about anything you could want really. The Homewood also serves early evening meals Monday – Thursday and we enjoyed a few of these including hot dogs and macaroni bolognaise, during these meals they also provide salad plus wine and beer, a good option for families with ever hungry children! The property is divided into north and south buildings with an area between that had barbeques to use plus seating areas around gas fires. Each building has a fitness room, more geared up for people doing CV work rather than a weights routine, and there is also a basketball court. The pool area is very nice, although at the beginning of our stay the water was very cold, this appeared to have been rectified later in the week, and the sun beds the most comfortable I have ever used with a lovely thick mattress. Pool towels are also available and can be picked up by the pool. There are places to eat within a few minutes walk, the ones we tried were a very good Thai restaurant where we had dinner one evening, a Greek café where we had a lunch, gyros with fries and a drink, which was good, and Oggi’s where we ate once and went most nights for drinks at the bar. Other places include a Sushi restaurant that looked very popular, a Mexican Café plus Subway and Starbucks. There are also places to eat about 10 mins walk away where you can also find a Vons supermarket and a Trader Joes. I have to mention the staff in Oggi’s who were so friendly and welcoming and made it a pleasure to visit, a special thank you to Finlay, Amy, Matt and Chris. Just one thing to mention if you do stay at this hotel and intend having a few night out in the Gaslamp District cab fares can be quite steep and expect to pay $15 each way without tips. All in all we had a fantastic time in California and a wonderful stay in the Homewood Suites and San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Pern453
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days while my husband took a class in San Diego. The location was convenient to the downtown harbor, Sea World, Balboa Park/Zoo, the airport, and Point Loma. It took about 15 minutes or less by car to each location. The rooms are real suites as promised. A separate bedroom and living room/kitchen area. We got a roll away for one of our kids, two slept on the couch. The large refrigerator was great for keeping our leftovers, milk, etc cool for us. It was quiet, we rarely heard anyone else in the hotel. We were on the fourth floor in a corner that faced water each direction. It didn't have the small balcony, but we didn't mind. Breakfast was something our kids looked forward to each day. There were eggs, waffles, toast, bagels, rolls, fruit, and muffins daily. Drinks were milk, juices, coffee, and hot chocolate. We tried the evening meal a couple of times. It was ok. They had nice salads, iced tea, beer, and wine. The Chicago Homewood we've stayed at in the past had a soda pop machine, pudding, and ice cream so you could have that. This one didn't have those items or as much selection in general. The dining area got crowded at times, but there was room outside on the patio too. The building we were in wasn't attached, so we had to use our room key often to get into the dining area and pool. Not a problem. The pool was small, but nice and clean. Plenty of chairs and tables. It wasn't especially warm during our stay. Highs in the lower 70's, but the pool was warm and the hot tub was nice. There are some restaurants within walking distance. Oggi's was good for sandwiches and pizza. There's also a Subway, TCBY, sushi place, and Mexican restaurant. It's very close to a Navy base, so they're there often in uniform. Trader Joe's is maybe a mile away. They had cheap ($.29) water that we bought before we went to the zoo, pretzels, etc. We went to the new Corvette Diner which was a lot of fun, but super busy in the shopping/dining area near Trader Joe's It's right next to the USS Recruit, a former landbased Navy training ship. It's neat to see.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: k1ckstand
Reviews.Content: The San Diego Homewood Suites has been my favorite family hotel experience so far. The room layout really worked for me; there's a bedroom for the parents (with closet) and a living room with foldout couch, to which we added a cot. The breakfast is more than adequate, and the complimentary weekday dinner is really nice (if you're not a fan of going out to eat a lot), and you can take it back to your room and not feel like you're eating in an office. There's also a full kitchen in the room. Just perfect for a family trip. Also, the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: SBDAD
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of the ratings, was not dissapointed. Decided to get the two room suite for the few extra bucks, it helped with our 5 yr old daughter, who usually likes the "mama and papa" bed during our hotel stays. Both rooms were excellent, each with a complete bath and tv...etc Watch out for the taxis fares,it seemed anywhere we went it was $15-20

Reviews.Title: “A definite yes, if asked if we would stay again.....”
Reviews.Author: changkay
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in San Diego with my (elderly) parents and 2 boys. Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, one with a king bed, one with a queen and a double sofa bed in the living area. 3 flat screen TVs, kitchen and 2 bathrooms. We had plenty of room for all of us. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Took advantage of the breakfast every morning.... there was enough variety to keep everyone happy and the complimentary suppers Monday to Thursdays were good. The boys enjoyed the basketball court outside. We walked to Trader Joe's or Vons to pick up groceries...took us about 10 minutes. The hotel was very clean and well kept. The only drawback was that the air con was a bit noisy and kept one of the rooms too cold, so we switched it off and opened the windows, which wasn't great as we heard all the planes taking off at 6 am. Walking distance to Starbucks, a variety of restaurants...pizza, sushi. Easy access to the attractions...we never drove for more than 30 minutes. Beautiful area...near a park and nice playground area. One of the best hotels overall that we have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: caps47
Reviews.Content: Very nice large and clean room. Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Can walk to restaurants and park. Would definitely stay here again. Go eat at The Tin Fish. The best Cod I have ever had. Several blocks from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: cocoabear01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here at the Homewood Suites while visiting San Diego for a leisurely trip. I will start right off by saying that I would definitely stay here again and look forward to staying at another Homewood Suites chain location while on vacation elsewhere. The location is terrific- it’s less than 5 minutes from the airport and we did not once hear an airplane. The only noise factor was from the naval base located directly across(this noise was easily drowned out however). It’s also easily located near the highways/expressways for access to attractions. We enjoyed our short 10 minute drives nightly to the Gaslamp area. Our hotel room was perfect. It had everything we needed including a full kitchen with utensils. Room service even washed our dishes and placed them back to our surprise! I highly recommend going to the walmart (about a 20 minute drive) and buying breakfast items to save money. The hotel does however serve complimentary breakfast, but it wasn’t worth eating twice. We didn’t try the complimentary dinners that were served so I’m not able to comment on them but I would expect the same quality of food(nothing spectacular). Every hotel staff member that we encountered was friendly and welcoming. This place is an exceptional deal in comparison to the average San Diego downtown hotel which charges $25 for parking and doesn’t offer the convenience of an apartment away from home. Our hotel room was always clean and updated with flat screen tv’s and modern furniture. Our Homewood Suites hotel was a definite bonus to our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shnel
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and equipped perfectly. Good location, great breakfasts and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or leisure, and a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: floridabonds
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, large hotel. I travelled here on business for 2 weeks. The hotel is an all suite property. I had the 1 room suite which was an "L" shaped room with a full kitchen (full size frig with freezer, microwave, oven, stovetop and dishwasher). I had a little balcony (not really big enough to sit on, just more like a large window to open) which overlooked palm trees with a view of the water. Breakfast was plentiful and decent. I attended their evening reception/snack or whatever they call it - but it's actually a full dinner with salad. The location is about a mile or so from the airport but I never heard any noise that bothered me. The hotel has fitness rooms, but the one in my building wasn't really usable because the a/c wasn't working properly at the time. They also have laundry facilities which is nice when traveling on business or with the family. The location is great - close to downtown but far enough so you don't hear noise and such. Close to great supermarkets - Vons and Trader Joe's. Also some very nice restaurants in the area - Point Loma Sea Foods (which is also a fish market) and Pizza Nova (on the water with much more than pizza). This hotel has lots of free parking and is well-lighted at night. I'm coming back with the family in the summer to take a vacation in the area. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and they have walking paths.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in April with our two kids (8/6) based on recommendations here on Tripadvisor. Our initial experience wasn't what we expected, as when we arrived we were told that the only room available was a first floor suite, which we discovered after entering was designed for handicapped guests, and as such featured a large bathroom with no discernible break between shower and the rest of the room. Meaning that taking a shower would result in water going all over the bathroom. The kitchen was small and cramped as well. This wasn't acceptable for a family with young kids, so we went back to the desk and were told we could switch rooms the next day, which we did, moving to a much larger room on the 2nd floor. After that, the stay was perfect. As others have noted the hotel features tons of amenities to keep kids and parents entertained. Highlights for us included daily breakfast buffet (though the eggs are always overcooked) featuring a variety of fruits, cereals, as well as waffles and breads/pastries. They also rotate a daily "meat" dish (either bacon, sausage, or biscuits/gravy). Other highlights included the sports court which we used most mornings for a bit of basketball, a pool table, free wired/wireless Internet, free Business center, complementary popcorn/coffee/tea in the rooms, large fridges, fully stocked kitchens, pool, jacuzzi, outdoor hot tub, outdoor terraces, and the surroundings which includes the USS Recruit, a training ship built into the ground, and the bay behind the hotel featuring walking/jogging paths. Across the parking lot is a small shopping center featuring about half a dozen places to eat (Sushiya and Oggis were very good). Service was fine, we didn't have any problems, and the staff was very friendly. Rooms were clean and spacious. There is are outdoor gas grills but we never got to use them. Rooms are equipped with two flat-screen HD TVs with ample selection of HD programming and movies on demand. The only complaint about the room is that the pull-out couch is uncomfortable, but the main bed/pillows are wonderful (and they give you plenty of pillows). They also advertise a complementary light dinner Mon-Thur, though we never tried it. The location is of course ideal, five-ten minutes from major tourist hotspots including the USS Midway, Gas Lamp, Old Town, and Seaport Village as well as Seaworld and Mission Beach and five minutes from the I-5 to head north to Legoland, La Jolla and other locations. Parking was always plentiful and close by. Keep in mind this is a family oriented hotel, there are kids everywhere, breakfast is a bit crazy, and the hotel is pretty much quiet by 9:00 PM. There's no bar, but they do sell beer/wine at the pantry. A Vons grocery store is about 5 minutes away off Rosencrants street. Overall though, we loved the place and would come back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Deepwood
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nicely kept. There were military transient families that seemed to be up very early in the morning . The acoustics in the hallway were not good and doors were slamming early in the morning. Not a restful sleep for some of us who were on vacation. Otherwise, the meals were adequate. The only hotel that serves a light supper eventhough it was not the freshest food it was included in the price. Great location to downtown and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable at Homewood Suites Liberty Station”
Reviews.Author: jmpage
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a 2-bedroom suite which was very comfotable. The hotel is very close to the San Diego airport and offers a complimentary shuttle to the hotel. They will send the shuttle as soon as you call them upon landing, There are many restaurants within across from the parking lot. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast buffet including waffles and hot items such as eggs & bacon. There's a public walkway along the marina at the back of the hotel. The pool area is very nice and includes a very hot whirlpool. There's also an outside fire place with seating. There's a third floor balcony on each building where you can watch the sunsets/sunrises. The atmosphere is very casual and relaxed. We really had nothing to complain about, and found it to be very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MGreene16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites for five days in early March with our college age son. I had called the day before arrival to see if we could get our Hilton Honors five night certificate upgraded to a two bedroom suite. After a bit of discussion (including a potential $50/night upgrade surcharge), we did end up with a complimentary upgrade and were delighted to have two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and three HD TV’s. Our suite (466) was on the fourth floor looking over the central facility; if you looked sideways you could see the esplanade and canal. The room was very comfortable throughout our stay, and our son was delighted to go from a college bunk bed to a queen bed, private bath, large desk, and balcony. And free wireless, of course. Our room was on the corner which was great for lack of noisy connecting walls; the only problem was the closet in the king bed room was not really set up to hang things but fitted with a couple of wire shelves so we had to share our son’s closet. One bathroom was actually a handicapped room so we had plenty of space. The kitchen was well equipped although we barely used it. The beds were great. The hotel was in an excellent location for us to get everywhere we wanted to go; everything seemed close by and it was only minutes to downtown. And it was very pleasant to be right on the waterway with a beautiful path past birds of paradise and palm trees. The planes did not bother us at all; the “white noise” of the room fan was enough to block them out. The breakfast was handy to have but it didn’t really seem like a lot of variety although the fruit and waffles were nice; we did eat breakfast out one day. It never got too crowded to find a table but it was close a couple of times. The two suppers during our stay were Swedish meatballs and meatloaf; although we ate dinner out we did stop by for salad, rolls, and a nice glass of wine. We didn’t spend a lot of time in the hotel and it was a little too cool to swim, but it was very pleasant to come back to our little apartment every night and be able to spread out and relax (and nice to have a place to put the doggie bags from dinner). We only got a short look at Liberty Station when we went to the Von’s for sandwiches one day, and to get ice cream at Stone Cold another time, but it all looked like a very nice place to stroll. It would have been fun to be able to bike the grounds around but we didn’t see any rentals. We did drive by some big guns though and could picture the recruits learning how to shoot them.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ww1614
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here and had a great time. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a king bed in one room and a sleeper sofa in the other. Since my kids don't like to share a bed, we also got a rollaway cot for no extra cost. The free buffet breakfast is excellent (scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes, choice of toast/english muffins/bagels, pastries, cereals, fruit, and waffles). There is a nice pool (it was a bit breezy and in the shade during the later afternoon). The staff was very helpful in bringing us extra blankets and helping us figure out the thermostat. We had dinner there Monday and Tuesday nights. Monday was Salisbury steaks, potatoes and gravy. Tuesday was a baked potato bar. Both nights they also served wine and beer. There is a lovely outdoor area, and we saw that some people used the grills provided. The room was very quiet despite the proximity to the airport, and we shared only one wall with another room, which was nice (we have noisy kids). The parking is plentiful and free. There is a kitchen area in the suite and it was well-stocked with plates, utensils, etc. Another service they offer that I've never seen mentioned is that they will go grocery shopping for you! We didn't take them up on this service, but I can imagine it is very useful. There are grocery stores nearby, including a Trader Joe's.
