There are also several restaurants right next to the hotel, including pizza and Mexican. The one downside was that we felt the wifi connection was a bit weak and dropped out on occasion. However, at one point we had to print something, and the front desk person made it very easy (he gave us a flash drive, we copied the document to it, and he printed it at no cost to us).

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but you pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: Skrypnek
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites was a very nice hotel. The suite really felt like a house, everything was provided for the kitchen, even a dishwasher. The breakfast was scrumptious and really generous. The light week night welcome dinner they had was very good, also. My kids enjoyed the pool. The workout room and laundry was very conveniant. Be sure to get change at the front desk for the laundry to avoid the torture device they call a change machine. The price was not feasible for a long trrip for a regular family but it was a nice treat for our stay to go to Seaworld. No shuttle to Seaworld, which meant we paid parking, whihc was disappointing. It is so close, a shuttle makes sense.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: GoHerdHuntington
Reviews.Content: Our group of three adults and two children stayed here in Jan 09. We found this hotel via trip advisor. The suites are wonderful. They are modern, clean, and comfortable. I have high expectations and they were all met or exceeded. There is a full size kitchen. Someone had mentioned that dishwasher detergent wasn't provided, but I asked for some at the front desk and was given 6 packets. One of the best parts of this hotel is the service. All of the staff were helpful and cheerful. A full hot breakfast is served each morning with a rotation of bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, etc. On weeknights, they have a welcome home reception. We were skeptical because we had never had a hotel offer a free dinner option so we had planned to go out each night. However, the food is terrific and there is plenty to eat. For example:meat and meatless lasagna with a garden salad, cold bean salad, garlic bread and cook. This hotel costs less than most in san diego because it is not in the popular downtown area, gaslamp area, or harbor area. But, it is only about 5 miles from there and about 3 from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Liberty Station”
Reviews.Author: simfam
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a 1 Bdrm Bayview Suite for 7 nights after Christmas. We had a kingsize bed in the bedroom with a queen size sofabed in the living room, and 2 large flat screen TV's. It was a large corner suite on the third floor which had 2 windows both with nice views of the waterway. There was a large closet in the bedroom with lots of hangers. The kitchen had a full size fridge and lots of counter & cupboard space. Everything about the room was so clean, comfortable and spacious. The hotel is situated at the far end of the parking area of an outdoor shopping/dining complex (Liberty Station), so there is plenty of free parking. The staff that we encountered were always pleasant & helpful, especially the staff in the buffet area. The free morning breakfast was the best that we have ever had from a hotel. Too many choices to list everything, but the kids favorites were the cinnamon buns and self-made waffles. I liked the sampling of fruits, yogurt, cottage cheese, and english muffins. It is hard to believe, but they also serve a complimentary small buffet dinner Mondays thru Thursdays. While we were there we missed the baked potatoe bar night, but had dinner on the Orange Chicken night. They also served rice, buns, salad and beverages. As long as you were eating in the lodge area you could help yourself to their beer on tap and white or red wine! Coffee/tea & hot chocolate was available 24 hrs/day. I would love to stay here during the warmer months as the grounds are beautiful with an outdoor fireplace, self-serve BBQ's for cooking, patio tables, pool, basketball court, and walking path along the water. The location was very easy to navigate from and just minutes to the airport. If I HAD TO search for something to complain about it would be that housekeeping kept leaving only 3 of each bathroom towel for 4 people. I did leave a note with my tip one day and she did leave 5, but each day after that just 3 again. Also once we used our dish cloth she took it away and never brought another one. Not a big deal. Overall we are glad we found this #1 rated hotel thru TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved the Homewood Suite”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveller100
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Chirstmas Holiday in Dec 2008. To our surprise, the hotel rate includes breakfast (everyday) and dinner (light meal & salad and cocktail) during weekdays. The room was roomy, we had the two bedrooms and sofa bed and kitchen that had stove, dishwasher and microwave, sink complete with all the utensils and pots and pans. We had free internet acccess from our room included in the hotel room rate. Breakfast was wonderful, from hot entree to cold entree you named it, my favorite was the waffle maker. They also had fresh fruit, yogurt, toaster for bagel/bread and muffins, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatos etc etc. Coffee is offered 24 hrs. The hotel had a nice courtyard for BBQ or just relaxing for family. There are two supermarkets located within 5 minutes driving:Von and one offering only organic items. Around hotel you can also find restaurants like pizza place, sushi, mexican etc within walking distance. Staff are friendly and dilligent. Except for one front desk person during off hours that was not so knowledgeable, the rest of the staff made up for her incompetence. Tips: Bring your dishwashing liquid if you don't want to use the dishwasher all the time. We were very happy with our stay, room was clean and amenities were plenty, we had kids with us too. Fast food chains and other nicer restaurants are also near by with tin 10 minutes driving, like Black Angus, Red Lobster, try Phil's BBQ... Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, new, & clean”
Reviews.Author: TrojanLonghorn
Reviews.Content: Used Hilton points for a free stay so I can't complain too much. Although this place has so many positives having it as the number 1 out of over 260 places to stay in San Diego may be a bit deceptive to those looking for a 4 or 5 star experience. This was one of the best 3 star places I have ever stayed in. It was clean, had granite in the kitchen and was all new. The restaurants in the parking lot were close. The Zoo was close, and so was the airport. The pool view was great, although the pool is not heated so a bit too cold for this time of year. The complimentary breakfast and dinner were a nice touch and the food was not bad at dinner time. Breakfast was just as good as any other hotel buffet I have been too. Nice having a suite with 2- 42 inch flat screen TVs. Brought a portable DVD player to hook up to one and set it up in one room for our 18 month old to watch her favorite shows and still had room to do other things.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel by the bay”
Reviews.Author: bricksclick
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this hotel highly. It is in a wonderful area of San Diego called Liberty Station, which is an old naval base converted to a residential and tourist area. It is quiet and serene with lots of room to relax and play and exercise, but convenient to the rest of San Diego via Harbor Road and I-5 and I-8. The hotel is clean, the staff is helpful and friendly, and there are complimentary morning and evening meals. I used the fitness room, and the equipment worked! The shower experience was satisfactory. The wi-fi is free and fast. There is a full kitchen in each suite and everything worked as intended. The housekeeping staff came in every day and even did extra, unexpected duties like washing our dishes! Two large flat screen TVs were appreciated. The bedding was nice and comfortable, with more than enough blankets and pillows. The only two downsides to the hotel are more related to its location, and not the fault of Homewood Suites. It is almost directly under the flight path of the large jets taking off from nearby San Diego International Airport, so it can get noisy. However, the planes cannot start taking off until 6:30 a.m. and must stop by 11:30 p.m. And while there are several small restaurants around the hotel property, there are no nearby convenience stores to pick up a quick soda or snack. The hotel itself does offer a small selection of snacks and drinks, however, in their lobby. Overall, an excellent stay in a welcoming, laid-back city.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: ChillyTennessee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days while on a business trip to San Diego. My wife and infant son accompanied me on the trip. We had a 1 bdrm suite. We have stayed at several Homewood Suites locations over the last couple of years. Overall we had a very good experience I recommend this hotel for business and for family trips. The staff is very professional and helpful. The hotel was clean and well maintained. It looks newly built. The surrounding community appeared safe. The hotel is in a good location. It's no more than a 5 minute drive to the convention center and the heart of downtown. It's almost walking distance to the airport. The weekday evening meal and the breakfast were good. The living room and the kitchen were spacious but our bedroom was a little small. The king size bed was a very tight fit for the room. The weekdays we were there the hotel's other customers appeared to be mostly men b/w the ages of 30-50. We did not see another family at the hotel for 2 days. I thought that was odd. The other customers appeared to be at the hotel on business. My wife speculated that the close proximity to the Navy submarine facility and that it was the off season for the amusement parks,i.e. fewer tourists and families, were the reasons for this. We did see several families with young children checking in on the weekend. We had a good experienced and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: richardBoston
Reviews.Content: Well, we finally went on our 2 week golf vacation to San Diego. I have followed the comments about the hotel for 6 months. I was not disappointed. Great location to downtown and getting any where else. You need a car!. Great Sushi across the parking lot. Restaurants include a greek, Italian,mexican thai all within a 2 min. walk. The free morning breakfast was a great deal. The staff was awsome. The suite was clean and fairly spacious. Von's ,Trader Joe's market are with in a 3 min. drive. Sammy's wood fired Pizza at the Plaza was very good. Great Hotel and great location. Thanks fellow Trip advisors we loved it. We stayed 11/06-11/20/08. great weather

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but didn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: byunioncity
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, wife, and two kids ages 4 and 6) stayed at the Homewood Suites at Liberty Station from Saturday, Nov 1 thru Monday, Nov 3. After reviewing the reviews here on TripAdviser (specifically looking for a best rated hotel for a family with young kids), I decided to reserve a 1BR bay view for 199.99/night with one king size bed (in an enclosed BR) and a sofa bed in the living/kitchen area. I have to say, my stay didn’t really live up to my expectations. Don’t get me wrong. The hotel isn’t bad. It’s very clean and modern, and I had no problems with the staff, but I found the hotel room and my experience somewhat lacking. When we first arrived at around 10pm on a Saturday, the first thing I noticed was a group of young people smoking and talking loudly on the balcony in one of the rooms on the second floor of the North building where we stayed. Apparently there was a party going on in that room which was pretty loud. Some of the guys from the party were also down at the entrance of the building to have a smoke. Being this was in a navy town (and the name of the hotel - liberty station), I expect they were military (one even said “good evening sir” as I passed thru the entrance with my luggage). Don't get me wrong, I'm a formal military person, and completely understand, but it was still disconcerting entering with my family with these young guys laughing and smoking at the entrance. That night we could even hear the party going on from our room which was on the fourth floor and on the other side of the building. Fortunately, that night, we were too tired to care, and it appeared their stay was for only that night since we didn’t see or hear them the rest of the stay. Regarding the room, although very clean, was much smaller than I expected (at least from what I expected looking at the pictures). The King size bed took up a lot of the bedroom, so there wasn’t much clearance to get to the drawers in front, but the bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. The sofa bed when rolled out was clean and good too. They provided sheets, a blanket, and a couple of pillows in the closet, but when rolled out, the bed took up quite a bit of the living area too. One problem was that there was only one small vanity with a single bathroom sink to share among the entire family – not the two sink with a wide top and mirror that you see in most hotels. The sink was also outside the toilet/shower room which had its pluses and minuses. The plus is that if you shower, you can close the bathroom door so the mirror doesn’t fog up. The minus is that the sink/vanity is in the bedroom area which means less privacy. One other annoyance about the bathroom was that the shower head was way up high. I’m 5’11 and I had to reach almost at full arm’s length to adjust the nozzle setting, so I would think this would be a disadvantage for a shorter person like my wife. Also, it’s a fixed nozzle, so you can’t direct the direction of the shower spray, but it did provide plenty of hot water. The closet was relatively small too, so I think the room I selected was meant more for a single person or a couple, but not a family. The view wasn’t that great either. It was more a view overlooking the pool, and the view of the bay was a partial unimpressive one. Knowing this, I’m thinking it would have been better to select a cheaper room without a view. Visiting nearby Coronado, maybe next time, I would consider a hotel overlooking the ocean Some other minor things that I think the hotel could have done to make the hotel more attractive to a family with kids: spend a little money and include some packs of hot chocolate for the kids instead of just coffee and tea, and at least include the Disney Channel on the cable TV. All there was for kids it seemed was the Cartoon network which didn’t have a great selection of cartoons at that (seemed a lot were adult oriented at night). The hotel provides free continental breakfast buffet every morning, but again, it didn’t look as nice as the pictures on the website. The breakfast is held in the hotel eating area (not a restaurant) near the hotel lobby. On our first morning (Sunday), it was packed and loud. We had to wait a bit for a table to open. The breakfast was standard budget items you would buy in bulk at Cosco (powdered eggs, cereal, bacon, fruits, small Danishes, toast, juices, coffee etc. You could make your own large waffles. The breakfast was o.k. It was all you can eat, so we made sure we got our fill and took some fruit and things up to the hotel room for later. The next morning (Monday) was less crowded though and we had no problem getting a table, so I guess it’s the weekends when it gets crowded. There didn’t seem to be many “family with kids” oriented restaurants within walking distance of the hotel either. There was a Mexican and a Thai restaurant, but they seemed more geared for business people and didn’t seem to have many customers. A Subway, a Greek Café, and a Pizza/sport’s bar restaurant was also nearby but we didn’t consider them great places to take a family to dinner. I would like to have seen a reasonably priced chain family restaurant like MiMi’s or AppleBee’s close by, but it seems you had to travel a number of miles to get to these type restaurants. The pool was clean and warm and there was a nice Jacuzzi hot tub, and interestingly enough there didn’t seem to be anyone using them during our stay, so we had these facilities all to ourselves. The location of the hotel is located just off the airport and close by to attractions like sea world, San Diego Zoo, and old town, but it was also relatively far away from attractions that I think are more interesting and fun like the Wild Animal Park, Lego land, and Coronado beach. Available parking was plentiful and free which was great compared to other hotels. Again, I wouldn’t say that our stay was all bad – just didn’t live up to my expectations based on the reviews, the hotel website, and for what I paid. It seems most of the great reviews for this Hotel was for those who chose the two bedroom suite, so maybe that would have made a difference. In my opinion, the hotel wasn’t the greatest for a family with young kids. I would say the hotel is better for people here on business, a single person, or a couple (but NOT on their honeymoon) on an extended stay at San Diego. The hotel just didn’t seem to have that “Family Fun” factor about it if you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to see why this topped the Trip Advisor list”
Reviews.Author: jasruth
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We selected Homewood Suites Liberty Station based on the reviews right here on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. Everything went smooth from check in to out. They have a great breakfast included with your room. Best included breakfast I've seen for awhile. Great staff was definitely a plus too. Pool and hot tub was very nice. Landscaping was done very well too. Free parking at the hotel. The hotel was a bit away from the sights, but then San Diego is not all that big nor hard to get around in. We had a car, so it was not difficult for us to get where we wanted to go in a short time. Catching a cab would be easy too I think. Only a short drive from Seaworld, San Diego Zoo, Old Town, Downtown, etc. It was nice to be away from everything but close just the same. There were several dining options within easy walking distance too. Definitely to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: HMMC76
Reviews.Content: We booked the 2 bedroom suite with 1Q and 1K bed. It came with 2 full bathrooms and kitchen equipped with a sink, dishwasher, fridge, microwave and 2 burner stove. We were very happy with the room. It was very clean. It came with lots of pillows and lots of towels. It also had flat screen TVs in both bedrooms and the living area. Bathrooms: very clean and stocked with towels and tissue paper. The shower head was tall enough so you don't feel like you had to squat down. Bedrooms: there were plenty of pillows but they were all down so, for me, it didn't provide much support. One bedroom had a small balcony. Living area: there was a 2 person couch and a single chair to sit. There was enough room for 2 adults and 2 kids. Kitchen: was well stocked with plates, cups utensils. It even had a knife, cutting board, pots and pans. They empty the ice bucket in the freezer so that you don't have stale ice when you check in. Building overall: looks very new. There is a walking path behind. There is only one ice machine on the 1st floor but there are vending machines on each floor (4 total). There are 2 buildings. There's a hot breakfast every morning and a hot dinner Mondays through Thursdays. Very simple but gets you full. There are also more restaurants and a Starbucks and TCBY within walking distance. There is a Vons and a Trader Joe's and more restaurants within a 2-3 minute drive. Or if you're ambitious, about a 10-15 minute walk. Close to the freeway. The pool was small (31 person capacity) and the jacuzzi was only for 6 people but it looked like it was maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: coloparkers
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed 5 nights at the Homewood Suites and loved it. We used Hilton Honor Points and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom unit. I always appreciate when managers are willing to do this. Incidentally, the hotel was sold out as we tried to add an extra night at the end of the trip. Front desk informed us they'd been sold out every night for all of September and October. My sons had a bedroom with a queen bed, a TV and a bathroom, my husband and I had a king with our own bathroom and TV and my daughter had the pull out couch with her own Tv. Hav ing the kitchen was invaluable. We picked up groceries at Trader Joe's (3-5 min car trip) and kept them in the fridge. We also took a cooler and filled it with sandwich fixings, sodas and fruit the days we went to Sea World, the Wild Animal Park and the Zoo. We didn't take the cooler into the parks, but kept it in the car for a picnic lunch. Huge money saver! As other posters have said, the hotel is a superb value. Free breakfast, free light dinner, including beer and wine (M-Th eves). The hotel is new and in a fantastic location. It's right off Harbor Drive in the former naval station that's been torn down and rebuilt as Liberty Station. There are parks being built, condos, restaurants, shops and the two hotels; Homewood Suites and Marriott Courtyard (next door). There's a beautiful walking path along the water behind the hotel. The navy training vessel, the Recruit, is in dry dock, right next to the hotel. Signs indicated it will be a museum. Within the same parking lot there are numerous restaurants, including a Starbucks. Turning out of the hotel onto Harbor Drive puts you at the marina area for harbor cruises, the Midway, the Star of India, etc.. within 5 minutes. Again, super location. The staff was very friendly and our room was always cleaned quickly. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value in a great location. It wouldn't appeal to someone looking for a highrise luxury, romantic hotel or one with a resort feel and luxurious pool, but otherwise I think most anyone would be pleased with the Homewood Suites. We'll definitely stay here again when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ,Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussiefamilySydney
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 really enjoyed our stay at Homewood Suites Liberty Station.This is the ideal location to visit the many attractions San Diego has to offer. We had a 2 bedroon suite which was ideal for us and we were impressed with the quality of the room. The buffet breakfast helped get us out of bed early after late nights at the baseball and offered a good selection.If you choose to stay in for dinner "Oggis" across the carpark is terrific. We found the staff very helpful with directions and the free parking was a bonus. We wouldn't hesitate recommending Homewood Suites and look forward to staying again when we next travel to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way. Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzers
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a 26 day road trip and absolutely LOVED it. We chose this hotel based on TA reviews and I can fully understand it being the # 1 hotel in San Diego. We had booked a one bedroom suite via Expedia but found on checkin that we had been upgraded to a large two bedroom / two bathroom, fully equipped apartment at no extra cost. Free wi-fi is included in all rooms. The property is very new, well laid out and in a very convenient location if you have a car. There are quite a few restaurants and a supermarket nearby if required. All the staff were phenomenal in their dedication to customer service - they deserve a medal in this regard. The free breakfast and "light" dinner were another bonus which we really appreciated and enjoyed very much. Thumbs up Homewood Suites Liberty Station - keep up the great work you are doing! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: redfarb
Reviews.Content: I'm hard to please and I liked this hotel. It’s a simple place right across the street from a Navy base. There are lots of military personnel and families staying there. My wife and two sons (12 and 8) booked a two bedroom suite for $399 a night. Room was just big enough and the pool was small but clean/fun. The free breakfast was pretty much what you should expect for a free breakfast. It’s in a small shopping center so there are other places to get food close by. Staff were personable and helpful when asked. We needed to be in downtown SD and this was a perfect fit - just far enough away from downtown and no more than 10 or 15 minutes from Balboa Park and other attractions. I plan to try Homewood again on a family outing.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: NallaVancouver
Reviews.Content: We returned to Vancouver BC last evening after spending two nights at the Homewood Suites, Lanning Road San Diego. Everything about this hotel is excellent, the staff, the rooms, the complementary breakfasts,the pool and with only a 5 minute drive to the airport. Have already recommended it to friends. Al Oct / 08

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Tiptoptraveller
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay, with new, very clean, very comfortable, large suites, with a good sized living area and a nice large kitchen. Very nice outdoor fireplace, BBQ area and pool. The free breakfast and evening snacks were adequate, but not worth a detour. The adjacent area is attractive, safe at night, but the restaurants in the immediate locality leave something to be desired. A big grocery store (Vons) is about 3 min drive. As with much of San Diego, you really need a car to get the best out of it. Despite being near the end of the runway, aircraft noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Nana069
Reviews.Content: We spent one of the best weeks we have ever had on vacation staying at the Homewood Suites San Diego Airport - Liberty Station. I spent approximately 15 hours online going over and over reviews before choosing Homewood Suites. My husband said the time really paid off, for this was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The grounds are lovely with a walkway along the inlet right on the property. There are two outdoor gas fireplaces that were so nice to sit around on cool nights. If you desire to grill your own meal, there are two gas grills. There is a variety of restaurants within walking distance and the hotel is only 1.5 blocks from public transportatiion. We had planned to rent a car, but decided to wait to see if we needed it. The mass transportation in San Diego is clean, safe, and extremely affordable. We did not spend all week what one day of car rental would have cost. We wanted a suite, but has not imagined we could afford one. The cost of our room, especially considering the meals provided, was a bargain. We had expected breakfast, but what we received was BREAKFAST, including scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, hash browns, juice, hot and cold cereal, waffles, yogurt. fresh melon and fruit, plus coffee and hot chocolate. One morning we had sausage gravy and biscuits, (my favorite). We were also lucky to have our visit coincide with the nights Homewood Suites provide an evening meal (Monday thru Thursday). It was so nice to come back to our room in the evening and know there was a hot meal awaiting us. These meals also include complimentary wine and beer. The hotel is fairly new so it is nicely decorated and well maintained. The service was exceptional, with one desk attendant delivering information to our room that we had requested. There is a business center, but internet connection is available in the room, also. The only criticism we had was there was only one sink in the bathroom area and it was in front of the closet so the space was close. This could present a problem for a family with several people to get ready at the same time. I would recommend this hotel for all groups. It was the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: zansu
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites in general are great for families, and the Liberty Station/San Diego Airport location is no exception. The rooms are standard for a HS - comfortable beds, Neutrogena bath products, full kitchen -- as are the meals (breakfast and weekday dinner). The staff is very friendly and gave each of the kids (four in our extended family group) their own drawstring bag with a beach ball and visor. We had a two bedroom suite for two adults and two kids, so we had more than enough room. Pool is nice, with towels supplied. There's a deck on the third floor with a telescope, so you can watch the planes take off. The property is located in an area that used to be part of the Navy Training Center but is now being redeveloped. There is a Courtyard by Marriott next door, and a retail area that includes a good pizza place (Oggi's), Subway, Los Primos (Mexican), a Greek place, and a Starbucks. Close by is a Trader Joe's, Cold Stone, and other dining options. The property backs onto an inland waterway, so there are boats, water skiers, and birds to watch. Grass, gravel and paved paths run along the water, and connect the hotel to a large park. There is a play area about 5-7 minute walk with a play structure and a climbing wall. Tons of grassy areas. Minutes from the airport, convention center and Sea World. I do not rank this property as excellent due to the smell of the offgassing from the furniture. This is common in new furniture, but still unpleasant. It is noticeable when returning to the room at the end of the day, and dissipates quickly after opening all of the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family suites”
Reviews.Author: Annettefullofjello
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel in a magazine article about family travel deals and this hotel was listed as a family-friendly hotel. I booked a two bedroom suite as there were four adults. I was soooo pleased when we arrived. We had a full kitchen fully stocked with supplies, a dining table, small livingroom with a fold out couchbed, two bedrooms and two baths all for a very reasonable price because we split it with the other couple. The price included a breakfast every morning and a small dinner Mon thru Thurs. Lovely hotel and only a year old so everything was so new. Airport noise was not at all an issue and this hotel was close to everything you would want to do in San Diego. We all loved our stay and have no complaints. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great family location”
Reviews.Author: orsijamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while visiting theme parks and found the hotel to be really nice for a family and well located. The rooms are generous, each with a reasonable sized LCD TV (approx 36inch). We had a 2 bedroom suite, with a separate living area. Each room has an independent bathroom. In our wing the entire fit out seems new - less than 12 months by the look of the wear and tear. The soaps were all neutragena - so great quality again. The only complaint I have, which is not a major problem is I can occasionally hear the floor above, but only when they stomp or drop heavy things. No problem in this case, but if you had very noisy upstairs residents you would certainly know it. Would definitely recommend this for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonjamdti
Reviews.Content: We (two parents, three teenage girls) visited the hotel in late July having booked on the Hilton website a few months earlier. The two bedroom suite was great- clean and quiet , beds comfortable and the kitchen living area spacious. Staff were very helpful, pool fine, breakfasts a little crowded but food good. We never made it to the evening meal. The location is good didn't notice the airport. Seemed very close to all the things we wanted to see, shopping area (Vons, Trader J) 10 min walk, some places to eat just across the car park. Can't really think of a single problem.

Reviews.Title: “Overall was pleased with stay”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMari
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at another Homewood Suites in the past and was very happy there, so we expected this one to be similar. It was in that the room was spacious. We had the two bedroom two bathroom unit which was large enough for the five of us. It was spotless and the maid service was terrific. The building itself was also very clean. You could tell that the hotel was pretty new. There is a shuttle which picked us up and brought us to the airport which was very nice. The breakfast was plentiful and of a wide variety-there were cold cereals, hot cereal, milk, juice, eggs, breads, rolls, home fries, and make your own Belgian waffles. The front desk staff were all friendly and helpful. They assisted with directions and maps to theme parks and other attractions when we needed them. The pool was heated and delightful. We thought that the food at the other Homewood Suites was better in that they had more of a selection-they had pbj sandwiches and yogurt if you did not like the dinner they served. The hotel is located in a quiet naval community. Even though it is very close to the airport, we did not hear any planes inside our room. The hotel is also within walking distance of many eating places-pizza, greek, mexican, and ice cream, and several shopping areas with supermarkets, drug stores, retail stores, and others are within a short driving distance. Overall, we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: thetractorman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights for a conference, and it worked great for us and another couple we know. The staff was wonderful, the evening reception (Monday - Thursday only) was prettty good, and the breakfasts were good every day. There are several good restaurants right out the front door, and more about 1/2 mile away in the Liberty Station shopping center. You can also get groceries, etc. at Trader Joe's and Von's in Liberty Station. The rooms are spacious enough - larger than many condos in San Diego. You also have a full-size refrigerator, cook top, microwave and dishwasher. No oven, though. There are gas grills on the patio. For relaxation, there's a small basketball court, pool and hot tub, and miles of walking paths along the harbor and nearby parks. Though I'd rather have the convenience of staying downtown, this hotel worked great for us and it's a lot less costly than the downtown hotels. Take the 923 bus to go downtown or to Ocean Beach, but remember this bus stops running about 7pm. And, yes - I'd stay here again. In fact, I've already reserved a week here for next year's conference.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beetrvln
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just one night at this hotel while he was in San Diego on business. We booked 2 rooms, as our son and a friend were attending a concert in the area as well. The hotel staff was great, we checked in for both rooms, and they kindly kept the keys for the boys room downstairs with their name on it, so they could get their own keys when they arrived late after the concert. Our suite was extremely clean and they had soft music playing when we opened the door, which was a very nice touch. We attempted to check in a bit early and the room was not ready. When we returned later in the day, the front desk staff thanked us for our patience and bumped us up to a room with a beautif ul view of the water, and city skyline. The bed was extremely comfortable, the furniture was very clean and in great condition. We were a little concerned when we booked this hotel with it being close to the airport. Turned out to be no problem, we didn't hear the planes at all with doors and windows closed. After my husband finished working, we took a walk along the water, and then made our way to the wine bar in the shopping area right in front of the hotel. The location was very convienent, and we would most definitely return to this hotel when in the area either for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Trv71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely wonderful...luxury at its best! The surroundings are breathtaking! The hotel room are comfy and clean. The perfect bed away from home! Breakfast buffet is fantastic. The staff is smiling, friendly and helpful! One of the best hotels in San Diego...Superb experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OfcSupport
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! My son and I tagged along while my husband was away on business. We loved the location and all of the amenities the hotel had to offer. Our teenage son played basketball there, used the pool table and swimming pool. The landscaping and outdoor areas are beautiful. We stayed in a studio suite. Friends of ours had a one bedroom suite. With the exception of the additional television I actually preferred the studio suite. I liked the open floor plan better. The location is great. Read the other reviews on that. Oggi's right next door has great pizza. Two grocery stores are very close to the hotel. The staff was very helpful. They printed a boarding pass for me when I was having difficulty, provided us with directions and took care of anything we asked of them. We ate the light dinner one evening and appreciated it. We also had breakfast there each morning. I would say if you are staying there more than a few days you may tire of the same breakfast every day. They do have a variety but really only seem to switch from bacon to sausage. I have been at other Hilton properties, Hampton Inn, in particular that have had better breakfasts. I didn't care for the potatoes or eggs they served. Having said that they do offer oatmeal and waffles and other items so we never really went hungry. Housekeeping was great. They do not have in-room safes. We used the hotel shuttle from the airport. We were told it would be a 15 minute wait. After an hour I called the hotel back and a van arrived. The van has a large green Marriott emblem on the hood and side of the van. On the side behind the Marriott logo is the Homewood Suites logo in a light color. The courtesy area is very busy at the airport and I was only able to see the Marriott logo when the van initially went around and ignored it. An hour later when the driver showed up there were no vehicles around it and I caught a glimpse of the Homewood Suites logo. I wished they would have told me when I phoned for the shuttle to look for a van with both logos on it. I wonder how often they have to return because people miss that. My husband was traveling with co-workers. We chose this property because the "W" hotel was sold out. They finished their work a few days earlier. The guys that stayed at the "W" were forced to pay for the next day because they did not give 24 hours notice. My husband checked with the staff around dinner time the night before and they had no problem with him checking out the next morning. We have family in this area and most definately will stay here again. This property is at the very top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific property & location though pricey”
Reviews.Author: Marsh511
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights with a family of 4 (w/ wife, 7, 5 yr old girls) on our annual San Diego visit. We need SPACE when we travel as a family, so we always look for a 2-bedroom suite. WIth this stay, Homewood has now taken over our #1 spot from the Staybridge chain. This property is located in a deceptively convenient location, about 8-10 minutes from the airport, 10+ minutes to Sea World or Old Town, and just over 15 minutes from places like Seaport Village, Petco Park, and Gaslamp District (though I'd imagine during rush hour, this could double). We were also able to WALK across the parking lot to no less than SIX good places to eat for families (nothing fancy...but a great Greek restaurant and an pub/pizza/Italian place Oggi's were typical). There's also a Starbucks and Subway there. Not only that, Homewood properties serve a darn good evening snack which almost works as a meal (meatloaf, lasagne, tacos, etc.), at least for the kids. The 2-bedroom suites are similar to other chains' 2-BDs - but the middle living room and kitchen area seemed more spacious than Residence Inn, Summerfield Suites, or Staybridge...and the property was absolutely spotless! This hotel has a better-than-adequate pool as well as eating area...though because of the summer vacation high occupancy, finding seating during breakfast was a little tough. Still, there are many outdoor tables just outside the dining area that served as a great overflow for many families. In the evenings, a few parties were using the outdoor grill to cook up their own burgers, etc. All in all, this property seemed to be planned very meticulously. On the downside: (a) meal service workers were like timekeeping Nazi's - by 9:30 a.m SHARP, pretty much every food item was put away, and when I wandered over to see what was still out and to try to get one more cup of orange juice, one worker sternly eyed me and barked out "We stop serving at 9:30." During the summer, it would be great if this hotel kept weekend hours (to 10 a.m.) for breakfasts every day. The breakfast food selection at this Homewood didn't have quite the same variety or quality as a Homewood I stayed in Texas last month...but still much better than adequate. (b) Elevators are *extremely* slow...and few. A property of this size could use 2 sets of elevators per building...and they can certainly move a little faster. During room clean-up time (which may be pretty much all day), the housekeeping crew did not appear to have their own elevators, so they frequently tied up the single elevator (per building) with their carts and maintenance items. Try to get a room that faces either the parking lot (still a nice view of hills and the recently completed Liberty Landing/Navy Training Center commercial complex) or the Bay. I would opt for the non-premium (not "Bay View") rooms on a high floor (3 or 4) as this would keep your costs a bit lower. Try to avoid the rooms that face the between-building walkways, especially on the 1st 2 levels as there's a lot of pedestrian traffic, mostly hotel guests coming and going...but they seem very close when your room faces the walkway. At $284/night, this was one of the most expensive 2-bedroom suites we've stayed at, but considering the time of year and location, I still feel we got a good deal. And kudos to the housekeeping crew who did a terrific job cleaning our room every day, and managed to do so without misplacing or losing any of our kids' stuff (you know how 5 & 7 years olds drop or leave crayons, books, and stuffed animals *anywhere*) -- instead, they neatly arranged items they found on top of the dresser. AND, they did all of this with a very limited window of time as we tended to come back to our room several times daily, and we'd put up the "Privacy" sign often. Still, they found the time to do an excellent job cleaning and prepping our room every day. Oh...our suite also had 3 fantastic 37 or 40" (didn't measure LOL) LCD TV's that kept everyone happy in the evenings. If you have a PS3 or WII or another video console, BRING IT!! On second thought, your kids may never want to leave the room... I give this property my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great location, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Likes3StarsorBetter
Reviews.Content: This was by far the most well appointed room that we stayed in during our recent trip to California. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite to accommodate our family which includes 2 teenagers. This unit had a beautiful kitchen area with granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, and everything you need in the way of dishes, etc. They even had paper towels! The TVs in every room were large flat screen models. The room was spotless and nicely decorated. I believe the hotel is quite new... under 3 years old I would guess. The location is very good. Very close to San Diego harbor, downtown, Harbor and Shelter Islands, and the airport (but we did not hear any airplane noise). There are dining options close by. A good pizza restaurant and bar is within walking distance. I think there is also a Subway restaurant and a wine tasting bar in the same shopping area. The down side of this hotel is the price. Our suite with tax was about $350.00, but it was on a weekend in July which is the high season in San Diego, and the location is close to just about all of the sights to see there. In this city, any nice hotel is going to cost you this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: G8RED
Reviews.Content: My expectations were so high after reading all the reviews. When we drove up I began to feel that maybe we made a mistake (not that it was going to be horrible but that this might be just a typical chain hotel). Oh boy was I wrong! From the momemt of check in, to the rooms, to the service to the amenities this place is unbelievable. I had to laugh because we just came from a hotel in Dana Point (Holiday Inn Express) that costs about the same as this one but the two could not have been on opposite ends of the spectrum in terms of quality. 2 Full Bedroom suites seperated by a full kitchen and living room. 3 High Def LG LCD TVs. Full breakfast and nice dinner all included in the bill. Pool table room, nice swimming pool area. This place was getting a high volume of people running through it and there staff was perfect at cleaning up and making you feel like you were staying at home (actually that is not a true statement because at home we would not keep our place this spotless all the time). We also loved the location = they have a nice walking/jogging path along a lake or ocean inlet. Right next door is a plaza full of brand new stores offering all kinds of food options. There is even a massage place that was brand new and offering a one time introductory massage for $ 39 (hour)/$ 57 (1.5 hours) that both my wife and I took advantage of. We LOVED and LOVE this place and will stay here anytime we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: wessa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many nice hotels in the San Diego area over the years. We have decided that from now on, if this hotel is available, we will always opt to to stay here. Very, very clean everywhere, which is a huge priority to us. Rooms are large and comfortable. Great central location to all that San Diego has to offer. Used the exercise room every morning, had their bkfst once and it was just fine. Incredibly helpful staff. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Cramos6269
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from July 3 - July 6 and we had a blast. This hotel was constructed September of last year. We stayed at a 2 bedroom suite. The room is very clean. The Kitchen is so complete. From utensils to pots and pans, plates, cups and glasses. The kitchen has 2 burners, microwave, full size refrigerator, coffee maker, dishwasher. Everything that you need. The Breakfast is awesome too. You can hardly find a hotel that serves hot breakfast. There's a lot of choices. eggs, bacon, sausages, bread, :make your own waffle, juice, milk, oatmeal, fruits and cottage cheese. They also have a lighted sports court where you can also play there at night. The swimming pool is clean. Also the parking is free, unlike other hotels in San Diego where you have to pay for parking. They have a laundry room and exercise room. The staff are totally friendly. There is a bridge there , walking distance leading you to a park. We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. They are very accomodating and very generous on everything. Check out time is 12N. We will surely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: buckeye627
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Homewood Suites for 4 nights in June of 08. We had a 2 bedroom/ 2 bath suite which was very nice so our daughter could have her own bathroom. The room was wonderful and had everything you could want. The staff was very nice and helpful, to the point where the person behind the desk wasn't sure exactly how to get us where we wanted to go so he called the establishment and and had them give him the directions. The breakfast was excellent and the staff in the breakfast room was very attentive. The area is very nice and a great place to take walks as my wife and I did at 6 each morning. Very good location to see the sights of San Diego if you have a car - 10 minutes to the zoo, 10 minutes to Sea World, and 10 minutes to SeaPort Village. We are looking forward to our next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room with nice view”
Reviews.Author: ILnaturetrav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Homewood Suites for two nights the last week of April. It was close to the airport and to Point Loma. We went to the zoo, Coronado Beach, Cabrillo National Monument & Sunset Cliffs. They were all a short drive from the hotel. The breakfast was a normal Homewood spread and was good. We did not try the supper. Having a Subway, Panera Bread and Starbucks in the same vicinity was nice for lunch and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Red007houston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and we liked everything about this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were great. Location is close to everything. The only problem I had is I wanted to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but clean”
Reviews.Author: agiustino
Reviews.Content: I flew down with my mom to check out the hotel for future visits with our 2 young children. Staff were friendly and check in was smooth. Our room looked directly at the pool ground level and it was suprisingly quiet. I slept on the pull out couch and it was comfortable. There are 2 great playgrounds within walking distance for young children and the one over the bridge has a sandy beach. The only negative to this place is you must have a car. We took taxi's but it was expensive to go anywhere. And don't let the staff call you a cab because they called a private guy who cost more. We did walk to a local Trader Joe's, Starbucks and fabulous grocery store but it would be too far with young children. Breakfast buffet was great. I couldn't find a tip jar for staff during breakfast which I think should be mandatory and may explain why others have said they weren't friendly. Overall I'd recommend this for young families with a car. I might try staying closer to town though as its a bit in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: socalady
Reviews.Content: My family absolutely LOVED this hotel. We have young children ages 1, 3, and 5. Upon arrival, we were greeted by friendly front desk staff and given a ground level room which we had requested. Our suite was spacious, even with a crib in the room. My husband loved the flat screen tv's. There are lots of restaurants close by, and Subway and Oggi's are both walking distance. There is a big navy ship cemented into the ground next to the hotel which was an amazing sight for the kids. Alsothere is a big grassy area to run around and play and a basketball court. There are full kitchens and dining room tables. We borrowed a high chair from the hotel's main dining room which made meal times easy for our 1 year old. We stayed for a weekend so we didn't get the evening meal but there were great choices for breakfast including lots of hot and cold items, juice, etc. My daughter enjoyed making her own waffle in the do-it-yourself waffle iron. The only thing I would say about breakfast is that the breakfast "hostesses" were not very friendly. They were not outwardly rude but they did not speak or smile the whole time we were there. They just stood next to the food with stony faces and replenished items when necesary. My husband joked that they should be called the "breakfast wardens" instead. We stayed here for an event at the san diego sports arena which was just a 10 minute drive away and downtown san diego was just a short drive away also. Overall I would say that this is a great hotel for families with young children and the breakfast is a great perk that will save you lots of travel time and money and will not dissapoint. *One important tip, request a room away from the elevator or you will end up asking to switch rooms. The elevator noise is VERY LOUD in the rooms right next to it on either side*

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites San Diego Airport - Liberty Station
HotelInfo.Address: 2576 Laning Road, San Diego, CA 92106
